loans.name: Jeannette Akouvi

texts.en:
Madame S. Jeannette Akouvi was born in 1963 in Kpalimé. One of seven siblings, her family was unable to support her education beyond a secondary certificate. Married and the mother of three children, she was forced to leave her village to move to Lomé in order to continue her business selling boubous (traditional African clothing). Her husband is a driver. Although the family is in an unenviable financial situation, they have a household atmosphere a well-off family would dream of. Ambitiously, she used her first $150 loan to trade clothing in a favorable market.

A new $850 loan would allow her to offer her customers new and different boubous, as well as a range of other products. This would permit her to satisfy a larger number of clients and make a profit consistent with the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Jeannette Akouvi est née en 1963 à Kpalimé. Fille d’une famille de sept personnes, elle n’a pas eu de soutien pour continuer ses études après son Brevet d’études. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a du abandonner son village pour venir s’installer à Lomé afin de continuer son commerce de vente de boubou. Son mari est chauffeur. Bien que la famille n’ait pas une situation financière enviable, l’ambiance dans le foyer fait rêver à une famille aisée. Ambitieuse, elle a fait son premier de $150 pour commercer la vente des habits et elle est à son quatrième crédit. Tous les crédits reçus sont remboursés dans les conditions prévues.

Ce crédit de $850 lui permettra d’offrir à sa clientèle d’autres boubous et d’autres gammes de produits. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire un grand nombre de clientèle et de faire des bénéfices conséquents au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase and resale of boubous (traditional African clothing)

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Ms. A. Denise was born April 14th, 1977 in Lomé. She is single and has one child. Having only a middle school education, she had to begin supporting herself at a young age. She is a retail saleswoman of bread, raw peanuts and snacks. She has already benefited from two loans which she repaid on time.

Today she is seeking another loan of $850 which will allow her to increase her activities by offering her customers processed peanuts, ground coconut, and bulk peanuts. This will allow her to expand her market share and to make her activities more profitable.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Denise est née le 14 Avril 1977 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant. De niveau d’études de classe de 4ème, elle a du commercer très tôt à se prendre en charge. Elle est revendeuse de pain, d’arachide et de casse croûte. Elle a déjà bénéficiée de deux crédits qu’elle avait remboursés normalement sans aucun retard.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un autre crédit de $850 remboursable qui lui permettra de renforcer ses activités en offrant à la clientèle des cacahuêtes, des cocos râpés, d’arachides. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître sa part de marché et de rentabiliser plus ses activités.

loans.use: increase retail sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Miss Rose A., a young woman of 26 years, is from Lacs. The daughter of a poor family, she had to abandon her studies in 11th grade and immediately threw herself into revenue-generating activities. She began by selling of all types of clearance merchandise, especially secondhand shoes. The two loans of $150 and $350, which she has repaid on time, have allowed her to launch herself into a business which she has mastered well enough. However, the development of her business today requires stable loan capital which she does not have.

Thus, this third loan of a total of $900 that she is soliciting will allow her to buy a wide range of shoes to make her business grow. This will allow her to best satisfy the needs of her clientele to make her business more profitable.

Translated from Frech by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Rose est une jeune fille de 26 ans originaire des Lacs. Fille d’une famille mal aisée, elle a du abandonnée ses études en classe de première et s’est aussitôt lancée dans les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a commencé dans la vente de produits de liquidation de tous genres, notamment les chaussures d’occasion. Ces deux crédits respectifs de $150 et 350 qu’elle a d’ailleurs bien remboursés lui ont permis de se lancer définitivement dans le commerce dont elle a la maîtrise assez bien. Toutefois, le développement de ses activités demande aujourd’hui un fonds de crédit assez consistant dont elle ne dispose pas.

Ainsi, ce troisième crédit d’un montant de $900 qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter diverses gammes de chaussures pour accroître ses affaires. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire au mieux les besoins de sa clientèle pour mieux rentabiliser ses activités.

loans.use: To buy and resell a wide range of shoes

loans.name: Etchidé

texts.en:
Mr. Etchidé Daniel S. was born in 1975 into a large family. He ended his studies at the secondary level because his parents could no longer afford to pay for his education. He decided then to take up revenue-generating activities and partnered with a friend to sell audio cassettes. He managed to obtain a first loan of $400 which allowed him to open his a kiosk of his own. A dynamic young man with business sense, he effectively manages his business, which should develop if he has a more stable source of loan capital.

Thus, to strengthen his business, he is asking for this loan of $750, which will allow him to buy audio-visual CDs to satisfy the needs of his clientele and to enlarge his business in order to continue serving their needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Etchidé Daniel est né en 1975 d’une une famille nombreuse. Il a arrêté ses études au niveau secondaire parce que ses parents n’arrivaient plus à lui payer la scolarité. Il décide alors de se lancer les activités génératrices de revenus et s’associe avec un ami pour la vente des cassettes audio. Il arrive à obtenir un premier crédit de $400 qui lui permet d’ouvrir un kiosque pour son propre compte. Jeune homme dynamique et ayant le sens des affaires, il gère avec efficacité ses activités qui devraient bien évoluer s’il avait bénéficié d’un fonds de crédit plus consistant.

Ainsi, pour renforcer ses activités, il sollicite ce crédit de $750 qui lui permettra d’acheter des CD audio-visuel pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle et avoir un bénéfice à la taille de ses affaires afin de subvenir à ces besoins.

loans.use: To buy and resell audio-visual CDs

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.en:
Mrs. Falilatou M. was born on Janary 24, 1967 in Lomé. She comes from a large family. After her primary education, which she regretfully ended, she took up the business of selling kitchen utensils, soup tureens, and other such items. She is married with two (02) children and also cares for the daughter of a friend. Her husband is an unemployed mechanic and almost all the living expenses rest on her shoulders. She has engaged in this business for 12 years and has mastered certain business techniques as a result of her experience. She benefitted from two past loans which she managed well and repaid on time without incident. She is a confident woman and deserves financial support to further her business.

Falilatou is asking today for a loan of $950 which will allow her to buy in bulk from wholesalers in order to respond to the demands of the market. The realization of this project will allow her to enlarge her business and to increase returns and revenues to address the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Falilatou est née le 24 Janvier 1967 à Lomé. Elle est issue d’une famille nombreuse. Après ses études primaires qu’elle arrêta avec regret, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de vente des ustensiles de cuisine, soupières et autres. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et en charge la fille d’une amie. Son mari est un mécanicien sans activité et presque toutes les charges se reposent sur la femme. Elle exerce ce commerce il y a 12 ans et maîtrise certaines techniques de commerce par son expérience. Elle avait bénéficié par le passé de deux crédits qu’elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser parfaitement sans incident. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités.

Falilatou sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en gros chez les grossistes afin de répondre aux exigences du marché. La réalisation de projet lui permettra d’accroître son activité et de facto, augmenter sa rentabilité et ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and resell kitchenware

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisabeth O. is a 45 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two (02) children. Very active, she has spent 25 years running a business selling seals, dishpans, and other plastic items. Starting off on her own, she was unable to enlarge her business to obtain adequate revenue to contribute to household expenses. With her first two loans of $350 and $650, obtained and repaid without incident, she was able to build up her business a little bit. However, it turned out to be insufficient to respond to the demand of her market.

Today, Mrs. O. is asking for a loan of $1000 to strengthen her business. This loan will serve as capital to buy seals and dishpans in bulk, as well as iceboxes, to attract more clients and increase sales. This will allow her to generate enough revenue to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame O. Elisabeth est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Très active, elle exerce il y a 25 ans le commerce de vente des sceaux, bassines et autres articles en plastique. Débutant avec son propre moyen, elle n’arrive pas à accroître ses activités pour en tirer de revenus adéquats en vue de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Avec ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $350 et $650 obtenus et remboursés sans incident, elle a pu rehausser tout petit peu son activité. Mais, ils s’avèrent insuffisants pour répondre à la demande de son marché

Aujourd’hui, Madame O. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour renforcer ses activités. Ce crédit lui servira de fonds de commerce pour acheter des sceaux et bassines en gros ainsi que des glacières pour attirer plus de clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Ceci lui permettra de dégager un revenu adéquat pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and resell seals, dishpans, and iceboxes

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie O. is a 41 year old woman. She is married with three (03) children and one additional person in her care. Her husband, who was a driver for a local company, is currently unemployed, which makes his wife bear sole responsibility for household needs and the children\'s education. Despite her low level of education, she has successfully guided and managed a business which till now has allowed her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her main activity is the preparation and sale of the corn-based stew ’Akassan,’ followed by the purchase and sale of charcoal. However, her financial means are very limited with regards to enlarging and developing her business, which could be very profitable if she had more steady loan capital.

Thus, she is asking for a loan of $850 which will allow her to build up a sufficient supply of cereals and characoal. This opportunity will allow her above all to provide for her household and for the educational needs of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame O. Marie est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et a une personne à charge. Son mari, qui était chauffeur dans une société de la place est actuellement au chômage obligeant sa femme à faire face seule aux charges familiales et à l’éducation des enfants. Malgré son niveau scolaire très bas, elle arrive à mener et à gérer des activités commerciales qui lui ont jusqu’à présent permis de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de la famille. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de la bouillie « Akassan » à base de maïs, puis à l’achat et à la vente du charbon de bois. Mais ses moyens financiers son très limités pour accroître et développer ses activités qui pourraient lui être très rentables si elle disposait d’un fonds de commerce plus consistant.

Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $875 lui permettant de constituer un stock suffisant de céréales et de charbon de bois. Cette opportunité lui permettra surtout de subvenir aux besoins d’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges familiales.

loans.use: To build up a sufficient supply of cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Monique Gbénami

texts.en:
Born on May 2, 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Monique Gbénamiest A. is a single woman with one child and three (3) brothers and sisters in her care. Abandoned and left to herself by her husband, she had to face life’s difficulties alone; this obliged her to run small business activities to pay for the education of her brothers and sisters, themselves abandoned by very poor parents. She benefitted then from a $400 loan to open a small shop selling general food supplies, liquor, and religious items. This business grew very quickly and Mrs. Monique is unable to respond to the demand of her clientele, which grows daily, because her financial means are very inadequate.

Today, despite a very low level of education, she strictly and efficiently manages her business and aims to enlarge her store. This is why she is asking for a new loan of $1200 to build up a supply of general food products and to respond to the demands of her customers. Thus, she will be able to increase her revenue and improve her standard of living and her family’s.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 2 Mai 1968 à Lomé, Madame A. Monique Gbénamiest une femme célibataire avec un enfant et trois (03) frères et sœurs à charge. Abandonnée et laissée à elle-même par son mari, elle dût faire face seule aux difficultés de la vie ; ce qui l’a obligée à mener des petites activités commerciales pour payer les frais scolaires de ses frères et sœurs abandonnés eux aussi par les parents très pauvres. Elle bénéficia alors d’un prêt $400 pour ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale et de vente de liqueurs et articles religieux. Cette activité a pris de l’ampleur très vite et Madame Monique est incapable de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui croît au jour le jour, car ses moyens financiers sont très insuffisants. Aujourd’hui, malgré son niveau d’instruction très moyen, elle gère avec efficacité et rigueur son commerce et compte agrandir sa boutique. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale et répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To build up a supply of general food products

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.en:
Mrs. Kokoé K. is a young woman of 34 years. She is married and has two (02) children. She reached 10th grade and quickly abandoned the schoolbench to profit in the beauty products and perfume business. She has already received 2 loans which she paid off before the repayment date. She is a dynamic and determined woman who deserves to be supported in enlarging her business and augmenting her revenues for the benefit of her family, of whom she is in charge.

For her business needs, Kokoé is asking for a loan of $850, which will open the door to purchasing beauty products and perfume from wholesalers. This will allow her to enlarge her display, attract more customers, and considerably augment her income, letting her improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Kokoé est une jeune femme de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle a atteint la classe de 2nde et a vite abandonné les bancs au profit du commerce des produits de beauté et de parfum. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits qu’elle a soldés avant échéance. C’est une femme dynamique et déterminée qui mérite d’être soutenue pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus au bénéfice de sa famille dont elle a la charge.

Pour les besoins de ses activités, Kokoé sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui ouvrira les portes pour s’approvisionner des produits de beauté et de parfum chez les grossistes. Cela lui permettra d’agrandir son étalage, d’attirer plus de clientèle et d’augmenter considérablement ses revenus pour contribuer à l’amélioration du mieux-être de la famille.

loans.use: To obtain a supply of beauty products and perfume from wholesalers

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Mrs. Afi S. was born in 1972 in Gapé. She was abandoned by her husband and left with one (01) child. In order to deal with her needs, as well as her child’s, she started selling knives, spoons, and forks. Dynamic and perseverant, she received an initial loan of $150 which allowed her to begin and succeed, in one way or another, in taking charge of her life. She runs a traveling business, going from area to area and from house to house, which seriously tires her out during the day.

To reduce the difficulty of her business activities, Mrs. S. is asking today for a loan of $800 which will let her rent a location or small place to create a store and to stock it with kitchen utensils in addition to knives and such. Financing this woman is contributing not only to the improvement of her living conditions, but also keeping her from prostitution and all of its sexually transmitted diseases, including AIDS.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Afi est née en 1972 à Gapé. Elle est abandonnée par son mari avec un (01) enfant. Afin de faire face à ses besoins ainsi que celui de son enfant, elle se lance dans le commerce de vente des couteaux, cuillères et fourchettes. Dynamique et persévérante, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit de $150 qui lui a permis de se lancer et d’arriver, tant que mal, à se prendre en charge. Elle fait le commerce ambulant, allant de quartier en quartier et de maison en maison. Ce qui l’a fatigue très sérieusement au cours de la journée.

Pour réduire la pénibilité de ses activités, Madame S. sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir à louer un local ou petit emplacement pour en faire une boutique et de s’approvisionner en ustensiles de cuisine en plus des couteaux et autres. Financer cette femme c’est contribuer, non seulement à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie, mais plutôt lui éviter la prostitution avec tout ce que cela comporte comme les maladies sexuellement transmissibles dont le SIDA.

loans.use: To rent a space for a store and to obtain kitchen utensils

loans.name: Homnaka

texts.en:
Mrs. Homnaka A. is a woman born in 1953 in Niamtougou, in the prefecture of Doufelgou in Northern Togo. She is married and the mother of four (04) children, and also has two (02) nieces in her care. Her husband, retired for 15 years with a meager and irregular pension, does not contribute productively anymore to household expenses. Thus, to deal with school fees and the teaching of the children, Mrs. A., in addition to her principal business - the sale and storage of cereals (millets, corn, and beans) - has added the preparation of ’Tchoukoutou,’ a millet-based drink which is very popular with the local population. However, her limited financial mans do not allow her to develop and enlarge her business. Still, she is a confident woman with a good sense of managing the gifts of others, which has translated into two previous loans of $350 and $650, repaid without any problems whatsoever. Seasoned and committed to her business, she deserves to be supported financially in her activities.

So, she is asking for a loan of $950 to obtain a stable stockpile of cereals and to resell these in times of scarcity. This will help her prepare the local drink and augment her income to tend to the needs of her family, who count solely on her for their survival.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Homnaka est une femme née en 1953 à Niamtougou dans la préfecture de Doufelgou au Nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et a à sa charge deux (02) nièces. Son mari, un retraité depuis plus de 15 ans avec sa maigre pension encore irrégulière ne contribue plus pratiquement aux charges de la famille. Ainsi, pour faire face aux frais de scolarité et d’apprentissage des enfants, Madame A., en plus de son activité principale qui est la vente et le stockage des céréales (mil, maïs, haricots), y associe la préparation de « Tchoukoutou », une boisson locale à base de mil qui est très apprécié par la population. Toutefois, ses moyens financiers limités ne lui permettent pas de développer et d’accroître ses activités. Pourtant, elle est une femme de confiance ayant le sens de la bonne gestion des biens d’autrui, cela s’est traduit à travers des deux crédits respectifs de $350 et $650 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés sans incident. Très expérimentés et dévouée dans son commerce, elle mérite d’être soutenue financièrement dans ses activités.

Aussi, sollicite-t- elle un crédit de $950 pour faire un stockage consistant des céréales et revendre en période de pénurie. Cela pourra l’aider dans sa préparation de boisson locale et à augmenter ses revenus au besoin de sa famille qui ne compte que sur elle pour sa survie.

loans.use: To stockpile cereals and to resell in times of scarcity

loans.name: Akolé

texts.en:
Born on April 15, 1966, in Aného, Mrs. Akolé W. comes from a large family. She left her studies in 11th grade to professionalize in sewing. Married with three (03) children, she has opened her own store and is the boss of 10 apprentices. However, her store is poorly equipped and she is unable to satisfy in a timely manner her customers, who appreciate her styles and fashions, which they find impeccable. She runs her store modestly and has demonstrated her assured honesty through her first two loans of $350 and $550, obtained and repaid without incident, despite bearing all the familial responsibilities, since her husband has been unemployed for two years. She deserves to be supported financially in the growth and development of her store. Due to her rigorous management skills and the quality of her work, no investor will regret having financed this dedicated woman.

Mrs. W. is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy two sewing machines and to run a fabric business (notions store/haberdashery), which does not exist and is needed in her area. Financing such a business is contributing to feed and improve the quality of life of more than ten people.

Translated from [language] by [your name], Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 15 Avril 1966 à Aného, Madame W. Akolé est issue d’une famille nombreuse. Elle a abandonné ses études en classe de 1ère pour se professionnaliser en couture. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a ouvert aujourd’hui son propre atelier et est patronne de 10 apprenties. Toutefois, son atelier est mal équipé et elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps sa clientèle qui apprécie pourtant ses prestations et ses modes qu’elle juge impeccables. Elle gère avec modestie son atelier et a fait preuve d’une honnêteté certaine à travers ses deux premiers respectifs de $350 et $550 obtenus et remboursés sans incident, malgré que toutes les charges familiales se reposent sur elle car son mari est au chômage depuis plus de deux ans. Elle mérite d’être financée pour accroître et développer son atelier. De par sa rigueur dans la gestion et la qualité de ses prestations, aucun investisseur ne regrettera pas d’avoir financé cette femme très dévouée.

Madame W. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter deux autres machines à coudre et faire le petit commerce de mercerie qui n’existe pas et très demandée dans son quartier. Financer une telle activité, c’est contribuer à nourrir et améliorer les conditions de vie de plus d’une dizaines de personnes.

loans.use: To buy two more sewing machines and set up a fabrics/notions store (haberdashery)

loans.name: Kingbédé

texts.en:
Mrs. Kingbédé TOMEGA is a young woman of 25 years born in Vodougbé in he prefecture of les Lacs. Married to a municipal tax collector, she is the mother of two (02) children, with a sister in her care. Obliged to help her husband, whose small income cannot cover the family’s needs, she runs some small business activities such as the sale of loincloths and trade in primary need goods thanks to two successive loans of $250 and $400, obtained and repaid without incident.

Today, Mrs. T. has opened for herself a shop to sell loincloths and alocholic beverages in the grand market of Hédzranawoé. To stock her store with loincloths of superior quality, she is asking for a loan of $1200. Given the effort provided by this illiterate woman and especially by the rigourous management she has demonstrated in her business, there is no doubt that these new finances will also be well managed and repaid without any difficulty. This will give her a second wind on the economic front and will contribute enormously to the improvement of her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Kingbédé est une jeune femme de 25 ans née à Vodougbé dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mariée à un collecteur des taxes municipales, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants avec une sœur à charge. Obligée de venir en aide à son mari dont le salaire insignifiant n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille, elle mena de petites activités commerciales telles que la vente des pagnes et le commerce de produits de première nécessité sur table grâce à deux crédits successifs de $200 et 450 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés.

Aujourd’hui, Madame T. a ouvert pour son propre compte une boutique de vente de pagne et de boissons liqueurs au grand marché de Hédzranawoé. Pour l’approvisionnement de sa boutique en pagnes de qualité supérieure, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200. Vu l’effort fourni par cette femme analphabète et surtout par la gestion rigoureuse dont elle fait preuve dans son commerce, il n’y a aucun doute que ce nouveau financement soit aussi bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté aucune. Ce qui lui redonnera son second souffle sur le plan économique et contribuera énormément à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy and resell loincloths and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Togoville, Mrs. Massan K. is married and is the mother of two (02) children. Having abandoned her studies very early due to lack of support, she quickly launched herself into the trade of fresh and smoked fish with her aunt. For 11 years, she has led her own project with her first two loans of $150 and $350, obtained and repaid without incident. Very often, she faces a disruption in supply because her loan capital always seems insufficient to satisfy her clientele, which in turn makes her lose customers. A confident woman with a bright future, she deserves to be supported financially in enlarging her business.

To achieve this, Mrs. K. is asking for a new loan of $850 which will allow her to strengthen her business. With this loan, she will be able to stock up on cartons of fish to respond to market demand and thereby contribute to the household expenses with her income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Togoville, Madame K. Massan est une femme mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Ayant très tôt abandonné ses études par manque de support, elle s’est lancée aussi vite dans le commerce de poissons frais et fumés avec sa tante. Depuis 11 ans, elle a initié son propre projet à partir de ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $150 et $350 obtenus et bien soldés. Très souvent, elle fait face à une rupture de stock, car son fonds de crédit paraît toujours très insuffisant pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle, ce qui lui fait perdre de la clientèle. Femme de confiance pleine d’avenir, elle mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour accroître ses activités.

Pour ce faire, Madame K. sollicite un nouveau financement de $850 qui lui permettra de renforcer son commerce. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra s’approvisionner en cartons de poissons pour pouvoir répondre à la demande du marché et ainsi avec elle pourra contribuer aux charges du ménage avec son revenu.

loans.use: To build up a supply of cartons of fish

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
English Translation:
Born in 1966, Madam A. Adjo is a young married woman with one child.  She abondoned her studies after finishing her BEPC.  The BEPC is a test all students take after highschool.

She then started immediately selling fruit products like banana plantains, oranges, sweet bananas and other things.  

Her husband, a travelling salesman, cannot pay all the family bills and Adjo creates a lot of expenses as well.  

So she`s been working selling fruit for 13 years and she drives a good bargain.  Honest and very rigourous, she has already paid back 3 small loans very faithfully.  

Madama A. today is looking for a loan of $750 which will be used to buy inventory and sales which will support the family. 


Original French:
Née en 1966, Madame A. Adjo est une jeune femme mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Abandonnant les études après le BEPC, elle se lance dans le commerce des fruits tels que : la banane plantin, la banane douce, l’orge, l’ananas, et biens d’autres fruits. Son mari, un revendeur ambulant n’arrive pas à subvenir à toutes les charges familiales et Adjo contribue énormément dans les charges du foyer. Elle exerce cette activité il y a 13 ans et son emplacement fait qu’elle fait de bonnes affaires. Honnête et très rigoureuse, elle a su gérer les trois premiers crédits obtenus et remboursés sans incident.

Madame A. sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner de différents fruits en vue d’en tirer plus de revenus et subvenir aux charges du ménage.

loans.use: Buy and sell a wide range of fruits

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel sells cleaning products and other household items. He started off in this type of business by working with a friend for about 3 years. Recently he and his wife decided to start their own business and sell the products out in the neighborhood and from their home. They have 3 children to support with this business. They just moved into this sector of the city after having an unfavorable experience in a different part of the city. They have high hopes for their loan. They will use it to invest in different plastic plates and containers. He hopes he can continue to build on his strong client base.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in different plastic plates and containers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Cedeno sells makeup and other products for the home. She is a door-to-door saleswomen who travels around the community she lives in advertising her products. She started off with the help of her husband who gave her $50 to buy the first batch of cosmetics that included lip stick and eye liners. She sells these products and baby clothing in order to make her business profitable. Maria and her husband have 3 daughters. You can see they live in a home made out of bamboo, but they are very optimistic about the future. She depends on the income from her business in order to provide clothes and food for her children. Her husband is covers the other expenses in the home and is very supportive.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and other products for her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando has 4 years of experience in the food market business. He started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but he has now included many different products into his store. He is seeking a loan in order to begin selling gas tanks. He sees a major business opportunity in his neighborhood because there is not anyone who provides the gas necessary for kitchens. In poor sectors almost everyone uses stove ovens because they are cheaper and most cost efficient. Fernando is confident that with this investment he will be able to make a big difference in the lives of his 3 kids. One of them has already exceeded local expectations by attending college. Fernando hopes that he will be able to provide for the full education of his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Begin selling propane gas tanks

payments.comment: pago su cuota en la totalidad. Agardece  a la comunidad solidaria este credito fue de bien manejado y espera seguir con la misma forma en el futuro. Gracias Kiva.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has owned her small store for about three years. She started off with the help of her husband who provided the first $100 of merchandise for her market. At first she only sold sodas and snacks, but now she has included many other grocery items including dairy products and vegetables. She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in cleaning products and other items for the home. She is confident that her investment will help her business grow. She has 3 children that depend on the business for their schooling and food.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in cleaning products and other items for the home.

loans.name: Doenina

texts.en:
Doenina is a door-to-door saleswoman who offers clothing and other items. She started off by selling earrings and other plastic jewelry. She has been able to expand her business by making investments in clothing and selling these products to the client base she has built. She is seeking the loan because she wants to begin selling home electronics such as blenders and fans. Doenina is married and has 3 children. She depends on the business to provide the education for her kids while her husband covers most of the other household expenses.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking the loan because she wants to begin selling home electronics

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza has a general store where she sells stationary and other office supplies. She learned how to run her store from the experience she gained from helping her godmother at her business. She started off with only pen and paper, but she has been able to grow and include many other products. She is seeking the loan in order to invest in new products that her clients may also want to purchase, like toys and gifts. She will also make changes the physical appearance of her store. She is 41 years old and has 2 children. Thanks to her business she has been able to educate her children and also begin the process of building a home for her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking the loan in order to invest in new products

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is a poultry distributor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He travles to the rural sectors in the country in order to buy the chickens he will later to sell in the city. He sells to many of the people who own stands in the large markets in the city. He also sells to many people who own the very small stores common in this sector. He wants the loan in order to buy dairy products that he can also begin to distribute. Florentino has 2 children who are in school. His business is the only source of income in his old.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He wants the loan in order to buy dairy products that he can also begin to distribute.

loans.name: Elías

texts.en:
Elias owns a small food market in Guayaquil. He started his store with the help of his wife who worked at someone else’s store for several years. They decided to open their store with only fresh fruit and vegetables, but they have been expanding their inventory for several years. They now sell other grocery products and are seeking to introduce office supplies into their product line. The business is run out of their home, and Elias has been modifying a new sector as an expansion of the store for these new products. He and his wife depend on this business to feed and educate their family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in office supplies to sell

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Ms. Abiba K. is around 42 years old. She is a married mother of three children. After giving up her primary school studies at a young age because she did not have enough money, she got into the business of selling yams in Blitta at the age of 14. When she went to Lomé at 16 she helped her mother in this venture. Very soon she had begun her own business using her own money. Her husband is a driver who does not have steady work and must take up his friends\\\' jobs during their time off, so she is responsible for nearly 80% of the household expenses. She is a very careful business manager and has a strong sense of respect for others\\\' property. She has proven herself to be a trustworthy woman by obtaining and completely repaying two loans.

Abiba is now requesting a loan of $950 to continue to build her business. With this loan, she will buy yams and cereals that she will resell for profit. This will increase her income so that she can improve her family\\\'s well-being.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Abiba est une femme âgée de 42 ans environ. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Après ses études primaires qu’elle a abandonnée très tôt par manque de support, elle se lança dans le commerce des ignames déjà à l’âge de 14 ans à Blitta. Arrivée à Lomé, à 16 ans, elle a aidé sa mère dans ce commerce. Très vite, elle initie son propre commerce à partir de ses propres fonds. Son mari est un chauffeur qui n’a pas de travail fixe et obligé de relayer ses amis pendant leur temps de repos. C’est ainsi que près de 80% des charges du foyer restent à sa charge. Très rigoureuse dans la gestion et ayant le sens du respect du bien d’autrui, elle a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et parfaitement bien remboursés.

Abiba sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 pour renforcer ses activités. Avec ce crédit, elle achètera des ignames et des céréales qu’elle revendra avec une marge bénéficiaire conséquente. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus pour contribuer à l’amélioration du bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama A. was born in 1953 in Tchékpo-Dédékpoè (Yoto prefecture). She is a married mother of three children and lives with her husband, who is unemployed, in Lomé-Hédzranawoé. She is an illiterate woman who alone meets her family\'s needs through her charcoal business and by selling water at the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. She has already received two loans that were repaid well within the deadlines. She is gifted with a keen business sense.

She is currently requesting a loan of $900 to build up a sufficient stock of charcoal and to increase her distribution and sales of drinking water. This new loan will allow her to increase the profitability of her business in order to better meet her family\'s needs and to fund her children\'s education.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ama est née en 1953 à Tchékpo-Dédékpoè (P/Yoto). Mariée est mère de trois (03) enfants, elle vit avec son mari sans emploi à Lomé-Hédzranawoé. C’est une femme analphabète qui survient seule aux besoins de sa famille par son commerce de charbon et la vente d’eau au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a eu à bénéficier déjà de 2 prêts qui ont été bien remboursés dans le délai. Elle est dotée d’un sens aigu de gestion de ses affaires.

Elle sollicite actuellement un crédit de $900 pour constituer un stock suffisant du charbon de bois et augmenter sa capacité de distribution et de vente d’eau potale. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d’accroître la rentabilité de ses affaires afin de faire face davantage aux besoins de sa famille et aux études académiques de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy and stock charcoal

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi T. is a young moped and motorcycle mechanic. He is 30 years old and a married father of one child. As he does not have the means to rent a shop, Komi runs his business from the side of the road and is very restricted by the local municipality. The young man\'s business is developing, with a growing number of motorcycles that he cannot all repair because of his workshop\'s small size.

In order to meet the needs of his customers and to be free from the threats of municipal authorities, Mr. T. is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow him to rent and set up a shop to open his garage and attract more customers. The success of this project will bring him more business, thus increasing his income and allowing him to contribute to an improvement in his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Komi est un jeune mécanicien à 2 roues. Agé de 30 ans, il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. N’ayant pas de moyen pour louer un atelier, Monsieur Komi exerce son activité au bord de la rue et est très gêné par la municipalité. L’activité du jeune homme se développe avec le nombre de plus en plus croissant de motos qu’il n’arrive pas à contenir à cause de la petitesse de son atelier.

Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’être à l’abri des menaces des autorités municipales, Monsieur T. sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre louer et aménager un local pour ouvrir son garage pour attirer davantage de clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus qui contribueront à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: To rent and set up a shop to open a garage

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Vogan, Ms. Philomène S. is a married mother of three children. She comes from a family of 12 people, whom she has not been able to see very often. Having inherited her mother\\\'s rice, cassava flour and tapioca business, she began to undertake this venture when she arrived in Lomé. She is on her third loan, which is being easily repaid thanks to the careful management of her business.

She is requesting a new loan of $750 that will serve as the capital to create a large stock of rice, flour and tapioca in order to earn a consistent profit. This will allow Ms. Philomène S. to increase her income, improve her family\\\'s living conditions and ensure her children\\\'s education.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1957 à Vogan, Madame S. Philomène est une femme mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Issue d’une famille de 12 personnes, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Ayant hérité de sa mère le commerce du riz, farine de manioc et du tapioca, elle a commencé par exercer cette activité dès son arrivée à Lomé. Elle est à son 3ème crédit qui est remboursé sans difficulté grâce à la gestion rigoureuse dont elle fait preuve.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce à faire un stock important de riz, farine et tapioca pour en tirer une marge bénéficiaire consistante. Ce qui permettra à Madame S. Philomène d’augmenter sa source de revenu et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stock cereals, rice and tapioca

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.en:
Ms. Tchotcho B. was born in 1950 in Vogan (Vo prefecture). She is a married mother of four children and comes from a large, very poor family. Very early in life she abandoned the banks of her home village to go to Lomé to be with her aunt, a business owner. It was with her aunt that she took a liking to business. She currently runs her own store in Lomé Hédrzanawoé, where she sells pagnes (cloths) and kitchen utensils made of aluminum, glass and plastic. This thriving business was particularly able to grow thanks to three initial loans that she obtained and regularly repaid.

Despite these various financial aides, her customers' demand for certain items is constantly growing, requiring Ms. Tchotcho B. to request a new loan of $1200 to stock her store in order to meet her customers' needs. This woman shows perfect management of her business, which today allows her to meet her family's basic needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Tchotcho est née en 1950 à Vogan (P/Vo). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, cette femme est issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre. Très tôt, elle avait abandonné les bancs dans son village natal pour rejoindre Lomé auprès de sa tante commerçante. C’est chez cette dernière qu’elle a pris le goût du commerce. Actuellement elle détient elle-même sa boutique de vente de pagnes et d’ustensiles cuisine en aluminium, en verre et en plastique à Lomé Hédrzanawoé. Ce commerce très florissant s’est surtout développé grâce aux trois premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus et régulièrement remboursés.

Malgré ces différents apports financiers, la demande de la clientèle pour certains articles se fait de plus en plus pressante obligeant Madame B. Tchotcho à solliciter un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour l’approvisionnement de sa boutique afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Cette femme a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce qui lui permet aujourd’hui de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of cooking utensils and pagnes (cloths)

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama A. was born in 1958 in Lomé as the fifth of eight children in a poor family. This abundance of children prevented her parents from sending her to school, requiring her to work small jobs from a young age. She is a married mother of four children. Her husband also has no education and is without steady employment. It is thus his wife who has opened a small restaurant and who is responsible for all of the family's expenses. This restaurant featuring local dishes was opened thanks to $200 in financial support that was obtained and promptly repaid.

As her customers are increasing in number and becoming more demanding, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $900 to remodel her restaurant, buy a freezer and build a stock of foodstuffs. It is clear that the successful completion of this project will increase Ama's income and will contribute to an improvement in her family's economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ama est née en 1958 à Lomé d’une famille pauvre de huit (08) enfants dont elle est la cinquième. Ce pléthore d’enfants n’a pas permis à ses parents de l’envoyer à l’école, l’obligeant de s’adonner très tôt aux petits commerces. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari, également n’a aucun niveau d’instruction et est sans emploi fixe. C’est donc la femme qui a ouvert un petit restaurant qui fait face à toutes les dépenses de la famille. Ce restaurant de mets locaux a été ouvert grâce à l’appui financier de $200 obtenus et promptement remboursés.

Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus importante et exigeante, Madame A. sollicite un crédit de $900 pour réaménager son restaurant, acquérir un congélateur et constituer un stock de vivres. Il est tout à fait évident que la parfaite réalisation de ce projet augmentera les revenus de Ama et contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille sur le plan économique et social.

loans.use: To remodel her restaurant, buy a freezer and build a stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Ahavé (Zio prefecture), Ms. Adjo G. is a married mother of three children. She has been selling okra, peppers and tomatoes for 20 years. As her husband does not have a stable income and is unable to meet the family\\\'s needs, the majority of the family\\\'s expenses are her responsibility. Serious and honest in the management of her business, Adjo has proven herself to be a trustworthy woman through two loans that were obtained and repaid without incident. She deserves to be supported once again to allow her business to grow and diversify.

To do so, Ms. Adjo G. is requesting a loan of $850 to buy baskets of tomatoes, okra and peppers in order to sell them wholesale to retailers. With the income, she will be able to improve her economic situation and that of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Ahavé (P/Zio), Madame G. Adjo est mariée est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de gombo, piments et tomate depuis déjà 20 ans. Son mari, n’ayant pas de revenu fixe, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins du foyer, ce qui fait que la grande partie des charges familiales se repose sur la femme. Sérieuse et honnête en matière de gestion de ses activités, Adjo a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et bien remboursés sans incident. Elle mérite encore d’être soutenue pour accroître et diversifier ses activités.

Pour ce faire, Madame G. Adjo sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter les paniers de tomates, gombo et piments afin de les vendre en gros aux détaillants. Avec le revenu, elle pourra améliorer sa situation économique et celle da sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of okra, tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ms. Ablavi A. was born in 1971 in Lomé. She is single and has two children. Cereal, French fry and charcoal sales are her sole sources of income to meet the needs of her children, whom she takes care of alone. She is very dynamic and perseverant, leaving herself no time to rest, always engaged in some activity. As she lacks the funds to adequately run her business, she is having difficulty in developing and expanding her activities.

To do so, Ablavi is now requesting a loan of $850 to build a large stock of cereals, make French fries and buy charcoal in order to meet the demands of the market and her customers. In doing so she will be able to earn a substantial income to meet the needs of her children and obtain financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ablavi est née en 1971 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. Le commerce des céréales, de frite et du charbon de bois constitue sa source de revenu pour satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants qui sont laissés à elle seule. Très dynamique et persévérante, elle ne se donne aucun temps de repos et est à tout moment en activités. Manquant de fonds de roulement adéquat, elle a du mal à développer et à accroître ses activités.

Pour ce faire, Ablavi sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $850 pour faire un stock important des céréales, à faire des frites et acheter du charbon de bois afin de répondre à la demande du marché et de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra dégager un revenu substantiel pour subvenir aux charges de ses enfants et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To sell cereals, French fries and charcoal

loans.name: Komi Mawuko

texts.en:
Mr. Komi Mawuko A. was born in 1947 in Kuoma-Adamé (Kloto prefecture). He attended school until the end of middle school but could not continue his studies because of a lack of financial means. After training to be a mechanic, he could not work as one due to a lack of funds to set up a business. He thus began to work in agriculture and runs a farm in Djaglé. His business consists of growing cassava and turning it into \"Gari\" flour and tapioca, which he is easily able to sell at the market. He employs seven workers and sharecroppers.

To meet the growth and development needs of his business, Mawuko is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow him to increase his production capacity and to buy a machine to scrape cassava. This will allow him to increase production and to meet his customers\' demand. This project deserves to be supported now.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi Mawuko est né en 1947 à Kouma-Adamé (P/Kloto). Il a suivi un cursus scolaire jusqu’à l’obtention du brevet et faute de moyens financiers, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études. Après sa formation en mécanique qu’il n’a pu exercer par manque de moyens pour s’installer, il s’est alors lancé dans l’exploitation agricole et gère une ferme agricole à Djaglé. Cette exploitation consiste à la culture du manioc et à sa transformation en farine « Gari » et en tapioca qu’il arrive à écouler facilement sur le marché. Il a à sa charge sept (07) ouvriers et métayers.

Pour les besoins de développement et de croissance de ses activités, Mawuko sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à augmenter sa capacité de production et à acquérir une râpeuse. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande sa clientèle. A l’heure actuelle, ce projet mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: Buying a machine to scrape cassava and food processing activities

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Lomé, Yawovi A. is a trained launderer. He is a married father of two children. Not having had the opportunity to go to school, he began learning the laundry business in Ghana at a young age. When he returned to Togo 20 years ago, he worked as a launderer for several dry cleaning companies for very low wages. Realizing that he was being severely exploited by his employers, he decided to work for himself but is facing extreme financial and material need in starting the business. He has a good reputation in his neighborhood and even in far-away areas, thanks to the quality of his work and his customer service. He has thus succeeded in earning the trust of his customers, who are growing in number along with an ever-growing number of orders. He is very clever and has the mindset of a good business manager. He also realizes that subcontracting is not very beneficial to him, as he only earns 40% of the profits. After researching the area, he has found a good location for his business and is seeking financing to move in.

To do so, Yawovi A. is requesting a loan of $1500 to rent a shop and buy a washing machine and irons. The successful completion of this project will allow him to stabilize his income and improve his family\'s living conditions. Even though he does not yet have his shop, he already employs three apprentices. Such a project deserves to be quickly funded in order to encourage young people to take up this promising profession.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1963 à Lomé, A. Yawovi est blanchisseur de formation. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire des études, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage de la blanchisserie au Ghana. Revenu au Togo, il y a 20 ans de cela, il a exercé ce métier dans plusieurs sociétés de pressing avec des salaires dérisoires. S’apercevant qu’il se fait sérieusement exploité par ses employeurs, il décida de s’installer en son propre compte, mais il fait face à un besoin financier et matériel sérieux pour s’équiper. La qualité de ses prestations et son bon accueil font sa réputation dans son quartier et même des quartiers lointains. Ainsi, il su gagner davantage la confiance de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus important et les commandes sans cesse croissantes. Très ingénieux et ayant l’esprit d’un bon gestionnaire, il se rend compte également que la sous traitance ne lui est pas très avantageux car il ne gagne que 40% de sa marge bénéficiaire. Après une étude du milieu, il a trouvé un bon emplacement et cherche des financements pour s’installer.

Pour ce faire, A. Yawovi sollicite un crédit de $1500 pour louer un local et acquérir une machine à laver et des fers repasser. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de stabiliser ses revenus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Bien que n’ayant pas encore son atelier, il a déjà trois (03) apprentis à son actif. Un tel projet aujourd’hui, mérite d’être rapidement financé pour encourager les jeunes à s’intéresser à ce métier très porteur.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy a washing machine and irons

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, a mother of 3 and age 28, is a used clothing vendor. She sells this clothing and generates some income to care for her children as she is a single parent. She has been trained by the staff in simple business and book keeping principles. She wants a KIVA loan of $625 to improve her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu sells assorted drinks. Her shop is strategically placed and she is able to make sales to a large number of pedestrians who happen to pass by her shop which is located along a major transit route.

She has been trained in the TEACH lending skills program by KSF staff. She believes that when she receives a KIVA loan of $825 she will expand her business activity greatly.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia, a mother of 2, operates a General Store from her home. She sells a variety of products and goods. She has indicated her willingness to relocate due to the rapid expansion of her business. She has been trained in the business development principles of Kraban under the TEACH lending program.

loans.use: Storage Equipment - Refrigerator

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Hajia Comestics Shop is a popular shop which sells good perfumery products to the city dwellers of Sekondi-Takoradi. The products are moderately priced and attract lots of customers, especially during festive occassions such as this yuletide. Owner Ramatu K. wishes to be given a KIVA loan of $975 to open a second shop. She has a business plan based on the TEACH lending skills she acquired.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Isis  Yadira

texts.en:
My name is Isis Yadira, I’m an entrepreneur with a business that sales snacks, located in front of one of the hospitals of my city, I have a very good clientele and experience in this type of business, which produces income to cover my family expenses and other engagements. Right now I need to increase my inventory, because we are in Christmas season and there is increase in demand.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi Nombre el Isis Yadira, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio ve venta de Golocinas, ubicado frente a uno de los hospitales de mi ciudad, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio, ya que estamos en epoca de navidad y la demanda es mayor.

loans.use: To buy dairy, meat, pork, poultry, sausages, oil, vegetables and other food items.

loans.name: Martha Gladis

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Martha Gladis, I have a Pulpería (grocery store) located in the center of my neighborhood, I have a very good clientele and several years of experience in this type of activity, which produces income to support my family expenses and commitments. I need to increase my inventory because we are on Christmas season and the sales are larger.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre Martha Gladis, cuento con una Pulperia ( venta de de productos de Consumo Humano) ubicado en el centro de mi colonia, cuento con buena clientela y tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, necesito surtir mas mi negocia ya que estamos en epoca de navidad y el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy eggs, cooking fat in kilos and pounds, sugar, rice, corn, beans, soap, cheese, poultry, dairy, coffee.

loans.name: Sindia Adalitza

texts.en:
My name is Sindia Adelitza, I have a business that sales used clothes and new underwear, located on my one room house, which produces income to cover my family expenses and other commitments with my providers. Thanks to this business I’m able to provide education to my children and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Sindia Adalitza, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada y ropa interior nueva, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, el que me permite, generar ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, gracias a este negocio puedo dar a mis hijos educación y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: To buy a lot of Mix used clothes and new underwear.

loans.name: Selenia Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Selenio Yamileth, I have a business that sells Home products, located in my one room house in the middle of my community, which produces income to cover my family expenses and other commitments. I have several years working in this business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre el Selenia Yamileth, cuento con un negocio de venta de productos para el Hogar, ubicado en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi comunidad, el que me genera ingresos para mis gastos faqmiliares y otros compromisos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio.

loans.use: To buy glasses, sauce pans, spoons, forks, china, blenders, toasters.

loans.name: Marlen Yolany

texts.en:
My name is Yolany, I’m an enterpreneur, I have a little bread factory at home. I have several years working in this type of activity, thanks to this business I’m able to help cover my family expenses, offering my children better opportunities so they can study. Right now I need to invest more, because is Christmas season and sales are larger.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Yolany, soy comerciante, cuento con una pequeña mini fabrica de pan de casa en mi casa de habitacón, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo comtribuir con los gastos de mi familia, ofreciendo a mis hijos mejores oportunidades para que ellos puedan estudiar, actualmente necesito invertir mas ya que en esta epoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking fat, eggs, wood, margarine, sugar, milk, among others.

loans.name: Lorena  Yamileth

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Lorena Yamileth, I have a business that sales snacks in my one room house, for several years now. I’m happy working in this activity because thanks to it I’m able to help my husband with the family expenses; in the future I would like to get a location because I have a very good clientele.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Lorena Yamileth, cuento con un negocio de venta de Golosinas en mi casa de habitación, desde hace varios años, me siento contenta con esta actividad ya que gracias a ellas puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, en el futuro pienso poner una caceta ya que tengo mucha clientela.

loans.use: To buy poultry, bread, mayonnaise, sugar, fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking fat, meta and other food items.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.en:
My name is Sandra Patricia, I’m an entrepreneur, I have a business selling new clothes, which I deliver by request from my community, I have a year of experience in this type of business, which produces income to help with my family expenses. By this season the sales increase that is why I need to increase my business inventory to offer variety of my products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Sandra Patricia, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante por encargo en mi comunidad, tengo 1 año de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, para esta epoca las ventas aumentan por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants for ladies and gentleman, underwear, make-up.

loans.name: Nancy Celeste

texts.en:
My name is Nancy Lisette, I have a business that sales new clothes and shoes in my one room house, which I deliver to my community, I have several years working in this business, with the income my business produces I’ve been able to take care of my children because I’m a single mother and they depend on me.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre Nacy Lisette, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado en mi casa de habitación, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, con los ingresos que me genera este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos ya que soy madre soltera y mis hijos depende de mi.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, pants for ladies and gentleman, make-up, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Osman Andres

texts.en:
My name is Osman Andres. I am a businessman and operate a business of new clothing and other things, located in the transportation terminal in my city. For many years I have dedicated myself to this type of business, along with my wife. It has given us income to cover our family expenses and commitments. Through the blessings of this business we have bought a house and are improving it, little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Osman Andres, soy comerciante y cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y otros, ubicado en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio junto con mi esposa, el que nos genera ingresos para cubrir nuestros gastos familiares y demas compromisos, con las utilidades que nos da este negocio hemos comprado una casa la que poco a poco iremos mejorando.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, including slippers, jackets, underwear, shirts and blouses, and dresses.

loans.name: Emerson Esael

texts.en:
Hi, I\'m Emerson, I have a business selling new clothes, located in the center of my community. I have done this for years and it generates the income to cover my family expenses and other commitments. Now during the Christmas season I need to build up my business more, because the volume of sales is greater, and I don\'t have enough capital to meet the existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola soy Emerson, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con mis proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que esta epoca de Navidad, el volumen de venta es mayor y no cuento con el capital suficiente para hacerle frente a demanda existente.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, including t-shirts, pants, jackets, skirts, blouses, underwear, backpacks, and other things.

loans.name: Santos Ariel

texts.en:
My name is Santos Ariel. I have a grocery business in the transportation terminal of the city. I have had this business for years and it brings me income to cover the cost of food, education and health care for my family. In this Christmas season the volume of sales is higher and so I need to supply my business in order to offer more variety to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Santos Ariel, cuento con negocio de pulperia, ubicado en la terminal de transporte de esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de alimentanción, educacion y salud de mi familia, en esta epoca de navidad el volumen de venta aumenta por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase food and supplies including jello, apples, grapes, orange juice, toilet paper, canned juice, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.en:
My name is Maria Domitila, I have a small operation making flour tortillas in my house. I have dedicated myself to this business for years and it gives me the income to contribute to the costs of food and education for my son. I am a single mother and with this bueinsss I can give my son what he needs so that he can study, he is now in his third cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre el Maria Domitila, cuento con una mini fabrica de tortilla de harina, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de alimentacion y educacación de mi hijo ya que soy madre soltera y con este negocio puedo darle lo necesario para que mi hijo pueda estudiar, actualmente esta en tercero de ciclo.

loans.use: To purchase flour, lard, baking soda, plastic bags and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.en:
My name is Maria Elba C., I am a businesswoman with a store selling new clothing in the center of my city. I have dedicated myself to this business for years because it gives me income to cover my family\\\'s expenses. Now I need to supply my business because in this season my sales volume is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Maria Elba C., soy comerciantes cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicada en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy pants for women, men and children, skirts, childrens clothes, mens t-shirts, womens blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.en:
My name is Reina de los Angeles I.. My main activity is making corn tortillas. I have done this in my home for many years, and generate income to pay for my family expenses and other commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre el Reina de los Angeles I., mi actividad principal es la elaboración de tortillas de maiz, actividad que realizo en mi casa de habitación, desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime and wood.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
My name is Martina, I am a businesswoman selling new clothing in the center of my city. I have many years experience in this business and it generates income to cover my family expenses and pay my suppliers. Thanks to this business I can give my children an education. Now I need to supply my business because in this season the sales are highers. Later it will be time for school and I need to have supplies for the season.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Martina, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, gracias a este negocio puedo darles educación a mis hijos, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta espoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor, luego vienen las clases y hay que surtir segun la epoca.

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses, slippers, tennis shoes, childrens suits, t-shirts and pants.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
My name is Emelina, I have a grocery located in my house in the center of my community. I have had it for years and it gives me income to contribute to my family\'s expenses. Thanks to this business our income has increased and we can pay for the education of my children. Now my baby is at the university studying media. I need to stock my business so that I can offer my customers more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Emelina, tengo una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi cumunidad, desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para coomtribuir con los gastos de de mi familia, gracias a este negocio nuestros ingresos han aumentando y podemos pagar los gastos de educación mis hijos, actualmente nenemos en educ Media y en la Universidad. Y necesito surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mis clientes mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, soap, chicken, soft drinks, flour, dairy products, bread and candy.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Judith Beatriz

texts.en:
Judith L. M. lives in Merida, Yucatan, and she is a mother of two young children. Eight years ago, she decided to start selling clothes to her family and friends, given her difficult situation as a single Mom. Her first priority has been, and always will be, to ensure her children with the basic necessities and an education. With the help of several loans she has been able to establish and develop her business into a shop in a well known market. The love of her children and her perseverence have enabled Judith to maintain what she has achieved with such great effort.

She now needs to add to her capital to be able to purchase clothing for the different seasons and so to increase her sales. For this she requires a loan of $250 dollars which she will repay within 3 months. Judith and her children need you, to realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Judith L. M. vive en Mérida, Yucatán, es madre de 2 hijos, aún menores de edad. Hace ocho años, ella decidió comenzar a vender ropa con sus familiares y amigos, debido a su difícil situación, pues ella es madre soltera. Su principal interés ha sido, en todo momento, asegurar la educación y necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Con la ayuda de varios préstamos ha podido establecer y hacer crecer su negocio, actualmente vende ropa en un tianguis conocido de la localidad. La entereza y el amor a sus hijos han llevado a Judith a mantener lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha construido.

Ella ahora necesita incrementar su capital para comprar ropa de temporada e incrementar sus ventas, por lo cual requiere un préstamo de $ 250.00 dólares, mismo que será cubierto en un plazo de 3 meses. Judith y sus hijos te necesitan, haz posible la realización de sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Ordonez is 33-years old and she lives in Merida, Yucatan. She is mother to a five-year old girl. She was still in school when her daughter was born and so she was unable to finish her studies. Her situation as a single Mom forced her to look for a way to earn some money to provide for her daughter. For this reason she started to sell clothing in the market, although at first she started selling to neighbours and family. It\'s just over five years now since Elizabeth started her business, with the welfare of her daughter as her motivation.

To increase her sales, she requires a loan of $250 dollars which will be put towards the purchase of clothing wholesale, a loan which will be repaid within three months. Please help Elizabeth and her baby girl - they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth O. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Es madre de una niña de 5 años. Ella se encontraba realizando sus estudios cuando nació su hija, esto impidió que pudiera continuar sus estudios, pues su situación de madre soltera le obligaba a buscar una actividad para percibir ingresos y proveer de lo necesario a su hija. Por ello ella decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa en los tianguis, aunque primero comenzó entre vecinos y familiares. Ya son poco más de cinco años de que Elizabeth emprendió su proyecto, movida por el bienestar de su pequeña.

Para poder incrementar las ventas, ella requiere un préstamo de $ 250.00 dólares, mismo que será destinado para la compra de ropa en mayoreo y cubierto en un plazo de 3 meses. Ayuda a Elizabeth y su pequeña, ellas te lo agrdecederan

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Héctor Oswaldo

texts.en:
Hector M. lives in Merida, Yucatan, is 28 years old and is single. As a young child he helped his mother sell clothing in neighbouring towns. Now, some time later, Hector h as decided to take up the business of selling clothing given his years of experience helping his Mom. Now he has an established business in a market and his goal was to help his Mom with the family\'s expeditures so that she may be able to retire. She has now retired.

Hector needs a loan of $475 to improve his business and remodel the shop (refinishing the floor and the walls). Become part of Hector\'s efforts by helping him develop his business, so that he in turn can help his Mom.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Héctor M. vive en la localidad Mérida, Yucatán, tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero. Él desde pequeño acompañaba y ayudaba a su madre a los pueblos vecinos del estado para vender ropa. Luego de algún tiempo, Héctor decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa, con la ayuda de la experiencia que había adquirido al acompañar a su madre por muchos años. Ahora él tiene un negocio establecido en un tianguis de la localidad y su objetivo ha sido ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la familia, para que ella se retire de trabajar y lo ha logrado.

Héctor actualmente requiere de un prestamo de $ 475.00 dólares para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, realizando una remodelación del piso y las paredes. Vuélvete parte de los logros de Héctor y ayúdalo a crecer para que él pueda ayudar a su madre.

loans.use: remodeling

loans.name: Bartola Icela

texts.en:
In Merida, Yucatan Bartola Gonzalez lives with her husband and her two daughters. It has already been five years since she decided to start her own business, shoe sales, given the difficult economic situation in which her family was found. With the help of various loans she has been able to keep up the busines and help her business with the household costs.
