Her dedication to her husband and children have led Bartola to successfully build her business, that is now helping her daughters pay for their education.

In order to increase her inventory she requires a loan of $200 which will be repaid within 4 months. Help her keep up for what Bartola has worked so hard to achieve and you will also be contributing to the education of her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Mérida, Yucatán, vive Bartola G., su esposo y sus dos hijas. Hace ya cinco años ella decidió emprender un negocio de venta de zapatos ante la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia. Pues su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo. Con la ayuda de varios créditos que ha recibido ha podido mantener su actividad y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su entereza y el compromiso leal con su esposo y sus hijas llevaron a Bartola a construir lo que ahora tiene y así poder costear el estudio superior de sus dos hijas.

Para comprar zapatos y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad en modelos a sus clientes, ella requiere de un préstamo de $200.00 dólares, mismo que será cubierto en un plazo de 4 meses. Ayuda a sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo Bartola ha construido y así colaboraras también con la educación de sus hijas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elsy Del Socorro

texts.en:
Elsy Chacon, her husband and two children live in Merida, Yucatan. Alberto Martinez, Elsy\\\'s husband, once worked in a tailor shop but it has already been 10 years since they have established their own business, with a modest capital and a simple sewing machine. With time and with the support of Admic and the loans provided to them, they were able to purchase four specialized sewing machines, and in doing so they have been able to give their two children the education they needed. With a strong entrepreneurial spirit Elsy and her husband, and now with the help of one of their sons, they have been able to realize their dreams, to have their own well-established tailoring shop.

Now they have a contract to produce uniforms for a large company, and in order to realize this contract they need a loan of $925, which will be paid within 6 months. Please support Elsy and her husband continue on with the progress they have achieved through their dedicated efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsy C., su esposo y sus dos hijos, viven en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Alberto Martínez, esposo de Elsy, trabajó en una sastrería, pero hace 10 años emprendieron su propio pequeño taller, con un poco de capital y una máquina sencilla. Luego, con el paso de los años y con el apoyo de los prestamos recibidos por parte de Admic, pudieron comprar cuatro máquinas especializadas y así han logrado cubrir todas las necesidades y educación de sus hijos. El espíritu emprendedor y la entereza de Elsy y su esposo, así como el apoyo en el negocio de su hijo han hecho posible la cristalización de su sueño, su propio taller de sastrería.

Actualmente ellos tienen un pedido de uniformes para una empresa grande y para poder invertir en ello requieren un prestamo de $ 925.00 dólares, para ser cubierto en un plazo de 6 meses. Haz posible la continuación de lo que con tanto esfuerzo Elsy y su esposo ha construido, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio Canche Hernandez, a married man and father of three children, lives in Progreso, Yucatan. For many years he worked with a carpenter where he learned the trade. Six years ago he went thorugh a difficult economic crisis and the salary that he earned was hardly enough to cover the household costs. It was then that he decided to start his own business, one that he felt he could manage given all the experience he earned throughout the years. With the help of loans he has been able to keep up the business. Eugenio\'s perseverence and personal strength made it possible for them to overcome the difficult financial situation and more so, he has been able to give his family a better quality of life.

Eugenio realizes that he needs a large order of wood to increase his sales, and to cover the costs of this he needs a loan of $650, a loan that will be repaid within 6 months. Please make Eugenio\'s project possible; he and his family need the support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenio Canché H., es casado, padre de 3 hijos y vive en la localidad de Progreso, Yucatán. Durante muchos años trabajo en una carpintería donde aprendió el oficio, hace seis años enfrentó una difícil crisis económica, pues con el salario que recibía difícilmente le alcanzaba cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar. Por todo ello decidió independizarse, pues con toda su experiencia ya había aprendido muy bien el oficio. Con la ayuda de préstamos y la colaboración activa ha logrado mantener su propio negocio. La entereza y fortaleza de Eugenio hicieron posible que enfrentara aquella difícil situación y que actualmente pueda brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Eugenio ha realizado el pedido de un flete de madera para incrementar sus ventas, para poder cubrir éste gasto él requiere de un préstamo de $650.00 dólares, mismo que cubrirá en un plazo de 6 meses. Haz posible la continuación del proyecto de Eugenio, él y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.en:
English Translation:

My Name has been Alba Luzt, I am retailer with a grocery store, located in my house  for several years.  I have many great customers. 

Thanks to this business I can contribute with the family expenses and the important thing is that I take care of my family.  My children work with to me in their free time. 

I need to provide but my business since during Christmas time the volume of sale is greater.

ORIGINAL SPANISH:
Mi Nombre es Alba Luz, soy comerciante cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace  varios años, tengo buena clientela.
Gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que atiendo a mi familia y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre;  necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que en epoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Compra de Pollo, Jabon, azucar, Arroz, Manteca, Frijoles,harina, lacteos y Embutidos

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Juana Francisca, I am a businessperson with a small grocery in my house for years. Thanks to this business I can contribute to my family\'s expenses and pay my suppliers. Now I need to stock my business so I can offer my customers a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Juana Francisca, soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, gracias aste negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mi clientes mejor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, soap, soft drinks, bread, vegetables and other foods.

loans.name: Idalia Marleny

texts.en:
My name is Idalia, I am a businesswoman with a small clothing store in my house, which gives me income to cover my family expenses. In this business I have the help of my children in their free time, and in this Christmas season the volume of sales is greater and the customers make many requests and charges, so I need more capital to invest so I can satisfy the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Idalia, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado ubicado en mi casa de habitación, el que me genera ingresos para mis cubrir los gastos familiares, en este negocio cuento con el apoyo de mis hijos en su tiempo libre y en esta epoca de Navidad el volumen de venta es mayor y los clientes me hacen muchos encargos por lo que necesito mayor capital para invertir y poder satisfacer la demanda.

loans.use: To buy mens shoes, t-shirts, underwear, childrens clothes and womens blouses.

loans.name: Reina Marina

texts.en:
My name is Reina Maria, I have a small business making pastries, called Rosquillas la Riquisima (Delicious Pastries), located in the center of my community. I have good customers, and thanks to this business I can generate income and have my own occupation, and, most importantly, it lets me take care of my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

MI Nombre es Reina Marina, cuento con una mini Fabrica de rosquillas, llamda Rosquillas la Riquisima, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, cuento con buena clientela, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y tener mi propia empresa y lo mas importante que me permite atender a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, lard, flour, sugar, candy and wood.

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Laura. I have a small business making dairy products, located in my house for the past three years. This business generates income for my family and for the costs of educating my children. Right now I have one child in grammar school and another in high school. I have also been able to make improvements to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Laura, cuento con una pequeño negocio de productos lacteos,ubicado en mi casa de habitación, desde hace 3 años, actividad que me permimte generar ingresos para mis gastos familiares y gastos de estudio de mis hijos actualmente tengo en el colegio y el la Escuela, tambien he logrado hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy milk, salt, rennet, soap and wood.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Rosa Maria. My main activity is to make Rosquillas cookies. I have a small local Rosquillas factory in my house which is in the center of my community. Thanks to this work I can generate enough income to contribute to my household expenses and therefore help to achieve a better standard of living for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Rosa Maria, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Rosquillas, cuento con una pequeña frabrica artesanal de Rosquilla, ubicado en mi casa de habitacón en el centro de mi comunidad,gracias a esta actividad puedo generar ingresos y contribuir con los gastos familiares, logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, eggs, corn, milk, butter, firewood and other household items

loans.name: Celeste Haida

texts.en:
My name is Celeste. I have a small general store located in my house which I have been operating for the past two years. It generates enough income for me to cover my family expenses and other obligations. Currently I need to offer a greater variety of products since sales have increased during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Mi nombre es Celeste, cuento con una Pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace 2 años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito un mayor surtido ya que en esta espoca de Navidad el volumen de ventas es mayor.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, butter, beans, eggs, chicken, refreshments, and other goods.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Maria del Carmen. I have a general store located in my home which I have operated for several years. Thanks to this business, we have improved our family income and the standard of living for my family. We have a good customer base because we try to give our customers good service and offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Mi nombre el Maria del Carmen, cuento con una pulperia (venta de productos para consumo Humano) ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, gracias este negocio hemos mejorado el ingreso familiar logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia, contamos con buena clientela ya que tratamos de dar a nuestros clientes un buen trato y ofrecerle variedad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, butter, rice, sodas, beans, soap, corn, meats, dairy products, and other goods.

loans.name: Ninfa Roselia

texts.en:
Hi my name is Ninfa Roselia. I am a merchant with a small general store located in my house named \"Pulperia Genesis\", which I have operated for two years. It generates enough income to cover our family expenses and other obligations. Currently, I need a larger variety of products since demand has increased during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Ninfa Roselia, soy comerciante cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación llamada Pulperia \\\"Genesis\\\" desde hace 2 años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente se necesita un surtido mayor ya que el volumen de venta aumente en la epoca de navidad.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, butter, instant soups, sodas, chicken, dairy products, rice, beans, juices, bread, jams and other products.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Alfredo. I have a local public taxi that I have been operating for several years and which generates enough income to cover my family expenses. With this business I have given my children an education and improved my home. I now need to do some repairs on my vehicle and I do not have the finances to pay for them so I am requesting your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Alfredo, cuento con una unidad de Taxi (transporte de pasajeros en mi ciudad) actividad que realizo desde hace varios años y me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, con esta unidad he dado a mis hijos educación, tambiem he mejorado mi vivienda. Actuamente necesito hacele unas reparaciones al automovil y no cuento con el capital por lo que solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase automotive parts.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.en:
My name is Rosa Beatriz. I have a small general store located in my house named Pulperia Mirian. I have been doing this for several years and it has provided income to contribute towards my family expenses and most importantly it has allowed me to attend to both my business and my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Mi Nombre es Rosa Beatriz, cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia Mirian, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a esta actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir en mi hogar con los gastos de mi familia y lo mas importante que puedo atender mi negocio y a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, butter, coffee, rice, flour, meats, soap, refreshments, juices, dairy products and other goods.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Felix. I am a merchant with a business selling new clothing which is located in the center of my city and is named Mi Pequeña Esperanza. I have been operating this business for several years and it has allowed me to improve the standard of living for my children, especially important considering that I am a single mother. I now need to increase the inventory of my business given that sales have grown this season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Maria Felix, soy comerciente cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad llamdo Mi Pequeña Esperanza, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me ha permitido sacar adelante a mis hijos, tomando en cuenta que soy madre soltera, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To puchase pants for boys, men and womoen; fine skirts, mens shirts, childrens t-shirts and underwear.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.en:
My name is Maria Martina. I have a small business selling firewood which I have been operating for several years. It generates income to support my daily expenses since my husband and I have been on our own now that all of our children are married. With this business we can have an income to satisfy our needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Mi nombre el Maria Martina, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de leña en mi casa de habitación, activadad que realizo desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para mi sustento diario ya que mi esposo y yo ya nos quedamos solos todos nuestros hijos se han casado y con este negocio podemos obtner ingresos para satisfacer nuestras necesidades.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, corn and dairy products

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Socorro. My main activity is to sell firewood and also cosmetics which I distribute through retail sales and special order. I have been operating this business for several years and have a good customer base. Thanks to this business I can generate enough income to contribute towards my family expenses and to meet my obligations with suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre el Maria Socorro, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña y tambien la venta de cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por emcargo, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, cuento con buena clientela, gracias a esta actividad puedo generar ingresos para comtribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: To purchase wood and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Reina  Suyapa

texts.en:
Hello I am Reina Suyapa, I have a small business where I sell new clothes, located in the center of my community. I have several years experience working at my business, which creates earnings to cover supplier costs and the cost of food, education and health for my family. Now, my future plans are to rent a site near the fixed marketplace so that I will not have to regularly carry my products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola soy Reina Suyapa, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa Nueva, ubicado en el el centro de mi comunidad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los compromisos con los proveedores y gastos de alimentación, Educación y salud de mi familia. Actualmente mis planes futuros es poder alquilar un local donde la mercadaeria quede segura y no tenga que estar acarriandola a diario.

loans.use: To buy men\'s shirts, women\'s blouses, men\'s and women\'s pants, underwear and women\'s skirts.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ermin Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Ermin Antonio, I have a small grocery store, located in my own home, called \\\"Pulperia Ermin.\\\" I have a lot of experience in this trade, which creates enough income to cover family expenses and other obligations. I also help my parents, as they are older and need my support. Now, I need a wider variety of products, as my business is well located and I have many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ermin Antonio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia \\\\\\\"Ermin\\\\\\\" tengo mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromiso, tambien puedo ayudar a mis padres ya que ellos estan bien mayores y necesitan de mi apoyo. actualmente necesito mayor surtido ya que el lugar en el cual esta ubicado mi negocio es muy bueno y tengo muy buena clientela.

loans.use: To buy rice, sodas, butter, beans, flour, soap, bread, sausages, milk, pork, beef, and chicken.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.en:
Hello my name is Juan Crisostomo, I have a small family business that manufactures items made from reed-grass, such as: lamps, baskets, rugs, picture-frames and others. I have several years experience in this trade, which creates income enough to cover family expenses. I also have the help of my son and my wife in the business. Now I need more investment as the \"coffee season\" is approaching and I have a high demand during this time and I do not have enough capital to satisfy my clientel.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi Nombre es Juan Crisostomo, cuento con una micro empresa familiar de manufactura del Carrrizo tales como: Lamparas, canastas alfombras, cuadros y otros, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, tambien cuento con la colaboración de mis hijo y mi esposa este negocio. actualmete necesito mayor inversión ya que se aproxima la temporda de cafe y tengo mucha demanda para esta temporada y no cuento con el capital para poder satisfacer la clientela.

loans.use: Buy reed-grass.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
My name is Jacinto, I own a small corn granary, loacted in my house. I have several years experience in this trade and it creates income enough to cover family expenses and other obligations. Thanks to the income of the granary, I have been able to give an education to my children and to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Jacinto, cuento con un molino de moler maiz en mi casa de habitacioin, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos, gracias a los ingresos de este molino he podido darle educación a mis hijos y mejorar mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy a band, a chute, a bar and a collection bin.

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en: Moldova is an agriculture based country. Most people in rural areas rely to a large extent on production of some agricultural good as a source of income. Gheorghe B. is a farmer in pork meats who lives in the tiny village of Cabaiesti, which practically has no infrastructure whatsoever and is hard to even reach with public transportation. What has been missing in many agricultural sectors has been sufficient value-added processing, especially among small producers, like Gherorghe who often lack the resources to take those additional steps. Harvests are usually sold in bulk and without much differentiation or additional input. More recently, however, even small farmers began noticing the profitability of further processing, experimenting with various forms of conservation and enhancement. Gheorghe began a small-scale operation drying of plums to try to supplement the income generated by his pork raising activity, which has fallen dramatically due to lower pork prices. Gheorghe still has 8 pigs and many piglets which he will continue to raise as he begins his new venture. He has one half hectare of orchard himself and wants to buy more plums from others to dry and subsequently sell in bulk to wholesalers in the city. Gheorghe has a positive outlook and hopes that this new venture will add to his earnings from his pork business. To realize these plans, he needs a loan to purchase 1 ton of plums for drying and 5 tons of concentrated feed to nourish his pigs during the winter months.

loans.use: To buy feed for his pigs and plums to dry

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en: The pictures and stunning town of Sipoteni is favorable for the A.’s store, located on the hillside overlooking the regional center of Ungheni, which is on the border with Romania. Most people from higher up the hill and those directly below welcome the option of a nearby grocery store as a source of food and household supplies that doesn’t require a descent into the lower part of town. Starting in 1995, the store began serving the local people, originally offering mostly snack foods and beverages and developing from there to carry more goods. They want to have a better variety of perishable products (milk products and frozen goods), but first need another refrigerator/freezer case to store and display them. Gheorghe would also like to expand his grocery store into a comfortable relaxing bar. He is planning on   providing outdoor seating for customers in the spring and with this loan is planning to construct a covered porch and a separate window for patrons to order from instead of coming inside every time for a new drink.  He would like a loan to finance the purchase of the needed construction materials and the refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail is 31 years old with an entrepreneurial spirit.  Everyone in his village of Cabaiesti, and most rural areas throughout Moldova grew up around farm animals.  Most families in rural Moldova will have a small garden behind their house, chickens, possibly a few cows or a pig and maybe a horse for a carriage to help with daily activities and transportation (Most of these houses do not have running water, gas or plumbing and rely on an outhouse as a toilette). Mihail’s family has always had a small farm, but he has not been involved in more commercial production. He would like to start now, having seen others in the area become successful entrepreneurs in raising animals. His brother owns a large barn formerly used in a collective farm, which, is already outfitted with most of the necessary equipment he needs and is an ideal location for Mihail’s planned business. The operation would encompass 30 sheep, which would be used for milk production, cheese making called Brinza, as well as for wool, and 10 calves, which would be raised in part for reproduction and in part for meat. Mihail already has land on which he grows wheat and hay, which will serve as good feed for all the animals. He has thought through the market prices for the various products he will have and is aware of the risk involved should they change, but believes he will be able to make a decent profit. He needs a loan to purchase the animals and begin his new farm!

loans.use: To buy 30 sheep and 10 calves

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en:
The central region of Moldova is known to produce the highest quality of fruits throughout Moldova; grapes, tomatoes, plums, cherries, apples and of course the juiciest watermelons you can eat are all grown in this region of Moldova. Gheorghe O. lives in the town of Sipoteni, rather than joining the many farmers already involved in production, he decided to take a further step and begin processing the produce into a higher value good. The main focus and cash crop of his business is drying plums into prunes, but his equipment can be used for many different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Gheorghe also produces dried apples, eggplant, squash and tomatoes to name a few.  For this he uses a high efficiency drying machine, powered by a gas furnace and multiple fans. It takes only one and a half hours for a batch of fresh produce to dry completely. After dehydration, the goods can be stored, packaged and shipped much more efficiently and obviously brings higher prices. His products are sold around Moldova and are bought by wholesalers as well. 
The scale of the operation has really grown lately, now having reached a level of production of 300 kilograms of fruit or vegetables per shift. The process of cleaning, de-seeding, and drying requires about a dozen workers per shift for this volume (these workers are all women from a local village), so his company currently employs 25 people. Gheorghe now needs a short term loan to fund the purchase of the last harvest of plums to fill a large order. His business is an ambitious one; the kind that holds much promise for helping Moldova develop into the future.

loans.use: loan to fund the purchase of the last harvest of plums to fill a large order

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara K. is a single mom, she has one child. She takes care of her elderly mother who lives in Belarus. Her mother is very sick and her health situation is getting worse, so Tamara often has to travel there. Tamara is a Technical school graduate. She is in the business of selling office supplies, cards, souvenirs, etc. Every holiday gives Tamara a great chance to get extra sales and keep her business stable. Tamara has been in this business for quite a while. She knows all the wholesale distributors and that helps her get high quality products at reasonable prices. Her good managerial skills help her be a successful salesperson. Tamara has been a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2003. She usually takes small loans. She has received and repaid 11 loans so far. Tamara has never had a single late payment since she started working with “Nadiya Ukraine”. The amount of the last credit she received was $500. Tamara needs $600 to re-stock her inventory for the holiday season. Since she does not charge high prices, she has many loyal clients who trust her and keep coming to buy presents and souvenirs at her kisok. The loan will give Tamara’s business a good economic boost and will help meet the high demand for her products this holiday seaason. Moreover, the loan will give Tamara a chance to buy cards, calendars, candles, photo frames, mugs, organizers and journals, etc. These warm-hearted gifts will definitely become smile-producing affirmations of love and care and will rejuvenate people’s souls, minds and strength this holiday season.

Тамара Олександрівна живе сама. В неї одна дитина. Вона також дбає про стареньку матір, яка живе в Беларусії. Мати Тамари Іванівни – дуже хвора, стан її здоров’я постійно погіршується. Саме тому Тамара Іванівна досить часто їздить до неї. Тамара Іванівна має середньо-спеціальну освіту. Вона продає канцтовари, листівки, сувеніри тощо. Кожне свято дає Тамарі Іванівні чудову можливість заробити та забезпечити стабільність для її бізнесу. Вона займається торгівлею вже досить довго. Вона знайома з усіма оптовими дистриб’юторами і це допомагає їй придбати високоякісні товари за помірними цінами. Чудові організаторські здібності Тамари Іванівни допомагають їй бути успішною в торгівлі. Тамара Іванівна працює з „Надією України” з 2003 року. Зазвичай вона потребує невеликі суми для кредитів. Вона вже отримала та сплатила 11 позик. В Тамари Іванівни не було жодного прострочення за весь час роботи з „Надією України”. Розмір останньої позики, яку вона отримала в „Надії України” становив 500 доларів. Тамара Іванівна потребує 600 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів. Ціни в неї ніколи не бувають занадто високими, а це допомагає їй зберегти постійних клієнтів, які довіряють їй та приходять по подарунки й сувеніри саме до неї. Позика сприятиме розширенню бізнесу Тамари Іванівни та допоможе задовольнити усі потреби клієнтів під час новорічних свят. Окрім того, позика надасть їй шанс закупити листівок, календарів, свічок, рамок для фотографій, чашок, записників тощо. Усі ці чудові товари обов’язково подарують багатьом людям багато посмішок та любові, а також зможуть відновити сили й натхнення в серцях рідних та близьких під час теплих святкових днів.

loans.use: To increase inventory for holiday season

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is divorced. She has two grown up children: a son and a daughter. She is a Technical school graduate. She studied industrial manufacturing in college. After school Tamara worked at the factory as a production engineer. The money she earned wasn’t enough to feed her family. That is why Tamara decided to start her own business and become self-sustainable. Tamara sells a range of clothing for women, paintings and souvenirs at one of the local outdoor markets. She is very open-hearted, sociable and polite. She has been a salesperson for several years and is very good at her business. Tamara has been a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2005. She received and repaid 6 loans without any delinquencies. She has perfect credit history in “Nadiya Ukraine” and good reputation among other market vendors. Tamara wanted to get a loan of $600 which she will invest in increasing her inventory and purchasing new clothing items in bulk. She wants to buy warm sweaters, pullovers, jerseys and jackets for the cold winter season in Ukraine. This will help her meet the needs and demands of her customers. Tamara would also like to purchase watches, perfumes and a variety of souvenirs which always sell well before this holiday season. The loan will give Tamara a chance to expand her trade and increase sales. Tamara will be able to use the profits to invest in her family’s welfare and further growth of her business.

Тамара Володимирівна – розлучена. В неї двоє дорослих дітей: син та дочка. Тамара Володимирівна має середньо-спеціальну освіту. Закінчила Запорізький індустріальний технікум. Працювала технологом на заводі. Грошей, які вона заробляла, не вистачало для того, щоб нагодувати родину. Отже, Тамара Володимирівна вирішила почати власну справу та стати самостійною. Тамара Володимирівна продає різноманітний одяг для жінок, картини та сувеніри на одному з місцевих відкритих ринків. Вона – дуже щира, привітна та ввічлива. Вона торгує вже декілька років й досягла певних успіхів. Тамара Іванівна працює з „Надією України” з 2005 року. Вона отримала та сплатила 6 позик без жодних проблем. В „Надії України” в неї чудова кредитна історія, а також гарна репутація серед інших підприємців на ринку. Тамара Володимирівна хотіла ю отримати позику розміром в 600 доларів для того, щоб інвестувати гроші в закупівлю товарів та нового одягу для продажу. Вона хотіла б купити теплі светри, пуловери, кофти та куртки, які стануть у пригоді під час холодної пори року в Україні. Позика допоможе Тамарі Володимирівні задовольнити потреби покупців. Вона також хотіла б придбати годинники, парфуми та різноманітні сувеніри, які завжди користуються попитом під час святкових днів. Позика допоможе Тамарі Володимирівні розширити торгівлю та збільшити обсяги продажів. Вона зможе використати зароблені гроші для того, щоб потім інвестувати їх в добробут родини та подальший розвиток її бізнесу.

loans.use: To improve assortment of new clothing items

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 37 years old IDP and father of 2 children. He is from the occupied Jabrayil region of Azerbaijan. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is Homeless and staying in a worker\\\'s hostel in Sumqayit city. Saleh opened his business in 2000. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family\\\'s food and important consemption needs.
In 2004 Saleh borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded his business considerable reaching in income. He opened fruit counter in the central market of Sumgayit city.
Now, he want to borrow $800 loan to open a vegetable section of his counter and purchase digital scales, though this, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase digital scales and expand his business

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay was born in 1968 in Kalbajar town. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar, married , has 3 children. He with his family settled in Absheron region Sulu-tepe town. He has been engaged in this business for 5 years and it allows him to support to his family. 
Having borrowed the loan $300 he bought 4 wheels, 1 accumulator, 1 carburet(t)or.
Now he needs a loan $800  for the capital repairs of his car

loans.use: The capital repairs of his car

loans.name: Nureddin

texts.en:
Nureddin is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Xodjali. He settled with his family in Absheron region Binegedi shosse. He is 24,  married,  has a child. He is hard worker, has own grocery.  In the beginning his business he sold the greens. He borrowed the loan amount of $400 to be engaged in sale of greens. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1000 to start the sale of agricultural produce. 
He applies for the loan $1800 to expand the area of his grocery  and to increase  the agricultural produce assortments

loans.use: To expand the area of his grocery

loans.name: Narish

texts.en:
Narish has an ability to buy the best  perfumery. Her clients are very pleased to buy the  perfumery from her shop. She is very polite with all her clients. Narish settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town. She is 44 year old, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Jabrail region . She supports to her family to be engaged in this business for 7 years. 
Narish decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to busy with retail trade. 
For the second time she borrowed the loan of $600 and varied the perfumery.
For third time she borrowed the loan $1000 in order to rent the shop.
Now she wants to open her own  perfumery. She is optimistic that her business will improve.

loans.use: To open her own  perfumery

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida and her 6 children settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town. She is 56 year old, widow, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Muganli village.
Having borrowed the loan $400 she bought the sewing-machine. She has been engaged in this business at her own home for 14 years. Buying the sewing-machine she thought that it is time to start business, but  she did not enough money and she decided to borrow the loan of $800 and bought the genuine leather and started her business. The third time she borrowed the loan amount of $1200 to sew on a machine the genuine leather jackets, genuine leather clothes for the women. She has not a tailor’s shop. She has  a lot of clients and her home is not comfortable for her business. These problems disturb her to improve her business. 
She needs the loan of $2000 to open her own tailor’s shop.

loans.use: To open the tailor’s shop

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
He started his business as a taxi driver. In spite of the fact that he is taxi driver he is interested in the sale of genuine leather  goods. He borrowed  the loan $300 in order to repair his car. Then he decided to apply for a loan $600 in order to start his new business. In the beginning his business he drove some small retail trade. He has been engaged in this business  for 10 years. He likes both businesses and he can not leave one of these businesses. He borrowed the loan amount of $1000 for the extensive repairs of his car. 
He needs $1800 to change the car with the lorry in order to transport  of the  genuine leather  goods from the regions  and to improve the sale of the genuine leather  goods. Elman is married, has 3 children. This 59-year-old businessmen is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam. He and his family settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town.

loans.use: To buy the lorry

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar lives in Baku city Bulbullu settlement . He is 47, married, has 2 children. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
He has his own live farming (cattle)and own butcher shop.
He borrowed a loan amount of $1000 and bought 2 cattles. 
He needs $2000 loan to buy the deep-freezer in order to further develop his business.

loans.use: To buy the deep-freezer

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
He sells the cereals . Avaz has been engaged in this business for 9 years.. In the beginning he did not have enough money to start his business. Having borrowed the loan of $400 he began to retail trade the cereals. After improving his business he decided to borrow the loan $600  for the second time and he built the shop . 
Day by day his business get better. He became the well known businessmen. He was not satisfied with his incomes. He borrowed the loan amount of $1000 to vary the assortments of the produce and repaired his shop. He is very hard worker. In spite of his progress in his business he did not stop and continued to improve his business. It is dificult for him to transport the produce from other regions to his shop. 
He requests for the loan of $2000 to solve this problem. He wants to spend this loan to buy the lorry for the produce transportation from the regions. 
Avaz is married, has 4 children. This 46-year-old businessmen is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Khankandi. He and his family settled in Absheron region Binagadi shosse.

loans.use: To buy the lorry

loans.name: Aferin

texts.en:
This woman supports to her family alone because she is widow. She is 41, has 5 children, widow . She began to sell the carpets 14 years ago. In the beginning in her business she borrowed $400 to buy 2 carpets. The second time she borrowed the loan 800$ and bought 20 Turkish carpets.
Now she needs a loan $1500 to open the own shop in the (trade) fair.
She is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Jamilli village. Aferin and her 5 children settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town.

loans.use: To open her own shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a divorcee with two sons . She runs a retail shop selling women cloths in a busy area of Ilala district  in Dar es Salaam. She has employed one  person in her business.She is planning to add the size of the stock of the clothes.She buys these clothes from wholesellers and resale them in retail.The plan need some USD 400 funding. In addition, the loan will help her increase her working capital and prevent stockouts.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: María Aracelly

texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising, friendly and hard working woman. She started her business a few years ago operating a corner store. Mari notes that recently some government offices have been built across from her corner store and it has increased her customers. Nonetheless, Mari has not been able to keep enough stock in her store to meet the demands of her newly expanded clientele, for which she needs a loan of $475.

She has 4 children who are the source of her motivation to keep moving forward and to achieve a better quality of life. Mari and her children need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer emprendedora, amigable y muy trabajadora, ella inició su negocio hace ya algunos años, este consiste en la venta de abarrotes por lo que actualmente Mari ya tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes, ella comenta que hace poco se instalaron algunas oficinas de gobierno en frente de su tienda, por lo que esto la a impulsado a tener una mayor clientela. Sin embargo, Mari no cuenta con la capacidad de productos para cubrir con el incremento de su demanda, por lo que ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y hacer frente este incremento.

Ella tiene 4 hijos, quienes son su inspiración para seguir adelante y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida, Mari y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bernardo Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto is a person with strong ties to his family. He lives in Mérida Yucatán and works in the sale of aluminum. His business has allowed him to cover the expenses of his wife and 2 sons over the years. However, he has wanted to give his business a push to the next level. Doing so will require economic capital.

Humberto requires $925 USD to buy large quantities of aluminum materials so that he can buy the aluminum below market price, earn a profit and generate the income that continues to pay his family expenses. He needs your support and appreciates your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Humberto es una persona muy entregada a su familia, vive en Mérida Yucatán y trabaja en la venta de aluminio, esto le ha permitido a través de los años cubrir con los gastos de sus 2 hijos y su esposa a través de estos años; sin embargo el ha querido impulsar su negocio lo cual necesita de capital económico para lograr este impulso.

Humberto requiere de $925 USD para comprar material de aluminio en grandes cantidades, esto genera que el precio al que el lo compra sea mas bajo al de mercado, por lo que esto le genera una ganancia y de esta manera el también genera un ingreso para seguir cubriendo los gastos de su familia. El necesita de tu apoyo y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alvaro Gregorio

texts.en:
Alvaro lives in Mérida Yucatán and started his business with the aim to cover his personal expenses and pay for his studies. Currently Alvaro is not married, nor does he have a family, however, he wants to finish college now that he finds himself in the 4th semester of the BS program in Administration. He has lots of enthusiasm and is eager to meet his goals. Alvaro needs a loan of $925 USD to buy the ingredients that will allow him to continue selling his hamburgers, hot dogs and tacos.

For Alvaro this is the only way to earn an income and continue studying. You can support him and make it possible for him to finish college. He appreciates your support and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Alvaro vive en Mérida Yucatán inició su negocio con el propósito de cubrir sus gastos personales y sus estudios, actualmente Alvaro no esta casado ni tiene una familia, sin embargo el quiere terminar la universidad ya que se encuentra cursando el 4 semestre de la Licenciatura de Administración. El tiene mucho entusiasmo y ganas de lograr sus metas, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar insumos que le permita seguir vendiendo sus hamburguesas, hot dogs y tacos.

Para Alvaro este es el único medio para obtener un ingreso y continuar estudiando, tu puedes apoyarlo y hacer que finalice la universidad, el agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: José Irene

texts.en:
Don José is a very friendly and very optimistic person. His work is a little strange, but it has allowed him to earn an income over the years and cover his family´s expenses. His work consists of the preparation of spices and condiments for meals; Don José has more than 10 years of experience in the production of these products.

Don José needs a loan of $475 USD to buy the raw materials that allow him to continue making his products. He plans to pay back the loan within 4 to 8 months. This way he hopes to give his business a push by increasing his production. He appreciates your support and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Don José es una persona muy amigable y muy optimista, su trabajo es algo extraño, pero este le ha permitido obtener un ingreso a través de los años y cubrir con los gastos de su familia. Consiste en la elaboración de especias y condimentos para las comidas, por lo que Don José tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la producción de estos productos.

Don José necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir haciendo sus productos, en un término de 4 a 8 meses planea regresar el préstamo y de esta forma el espera impulsar su negocio con una mayor producción; el agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Elíaz Beato

texts.en:
Don Juan is a very optimistic and hard working person. He works making handcrafted artwork after learning this vocation from his father, who did the same type of work, more then 28 years ago. Don Juan is currently teaching his children to make handcrafted items. As a result, his business has not only allowed him to cover his family´s expenses, but also has been a way for the family to stay together.

Don Juan sells his products in some restaurants in the tourist area of Cancún and comments that he has had a lot of demand for his handcrafted articles but does not have the capital to invest so that he could generate more income. He needs $925 USD to buy raw materials. You can help Don Juan and his children who depend on his business. They appreciate your kindness and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Don Juan es una persona muy optimista y trabajadora, el se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, aprendiendo este oficio hace mas de 28 años por medio de su padre, quien se dedicaba al mismo trabajo; actualmente le Don Juan le enseño a sus hijos ha elaborar estas artesanías por lo que su negocio le ha permitido no solo cubrir con los gastos de su familia, sino que también ha sido un medio para convivir entre ellos.

Don Juan vende sus productos en algunos restaurantes de la zona turística de Cancún y comenta que ha tenido mucha demanda por sus artículos pero no cuentan con el capital para invertir en sus artesanías y generar más ingresos. El requiere de $925 USD para comprar insumos, tu puedes ayudar a Don Juan y a sus hijos que dependen de este negocio. Ellos agradecen tu cariño y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Secundino

texts.en:
Don José is a responsible and hard working man. He launched his own business in response to the need to offer an education and a better quality of life to his children. His business consists of the crafting of handmade items which are sold in the tourist areas and in restaurants. Currently Don José wants to give a push to his business, since the demand for his products has increased. To do this he needs the raw materials to produce more crafted items.

He needs a loan of $925 USD to buy raw materials to increase his capacity of production. Don José doesn´t work alone; he has 3 young men working in the same business. You can help them and give Don José´s business a push to the next level. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Don José es un hombre responsable y trabajador, ante la necesidad de ofrecer una educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida, Don José emprendió su propio negocio. Este consiste en la elaboración de artesanías las cuales son vendidas en las zonas turísticas u restaurantes. Actualmente Don José quiere impulsar su negocio, ya que la demanda por sus productos ha ido en aumento, por lo que necesita de materia prima para producir una mayor cantidad de estas.

El necesita un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar materia prima y tener una mayor capacidad de producción, ya que Don José no trabaja solo, tiene 3 jóvenes varones que trabajan en el mismo negocio. Tu puedes ayudarlos e impulsar el negocio de Don José, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.en:
Jose Eduardo is a married man living in Merida, Yucatan. He has been working with a well-known auto company but his income is not enough to cover the basic household costs, which is why he decided to start his own car washing and lube business. He at first started with a small vaccuum cleaner and a grease gun, and with a few loans he has already developed and grown his small business. With constant effort for his struggles Jose has been able to reach his goals and he has given his wife and his unborn children a better quality of life.

Jose needs a loan of $475 for the purchase of raw materials purchased wholesale, such as, car deodorizers, liquid soaps and cleaners, etc. He plans to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. Help Jose secure the future of his family. They will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

José Eduardo es casado y vive en Mérida Yucatán, hace algunos años trabajó para una conocida agencia de autos en el país, sin embargo el salario que recibía no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su casa, es por ello que decidió iniciar su propio negocio de lavado y engrasado de autos. En un principio comenzó con una pequeña aspiradora y una pistola de presión, con algunos créditos que ya ha recibido logró hacer crecer su negocio. La lucha constante y el esfuerzo ha sido lo que ha permitido a José lograr sus metas y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y así también asegurar el porvenir de sus futuros hijos.

José requiere e un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar insumos de calidad y a mayoreo, tales como; aromatizantes, limpiadores líquidos para pulir, etc. El planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 6 a 12 meses. Ayuda a asegurar el futuro de la familia de José, ellos te estarán agradecidos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.en:
Manuel is a tenacious and engaging person, and he lives in Merida, Yucatan with his wife and two children. For some time he sold newspapers but his income was not enough to sustain his family, so he looked into starting his own business selling fast tood. In his neighbourhood there were no other vendors selling fast food and he saw a great demand for such a business. Now some time later, Manuel has achieved his goal and his business is stable and still growing. He purchased a motorcycle to be able to offer home delivery to his clients but it\'s in need of some repairs, for which he needs a loan of $475, to be rapaid within 6 to 12 months.

With the support of his family, Manuel has been able to reach his goal, but now he needs your support. Become an important part of successes of the Cardenas family. They thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Manuel es una persona con mucha tenacidad y bastante emprendedora, el vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, con su esposa y dos hijos. Por algún tiempo él se dedicó a la venta de periódico, sin embargo al ver que lo que ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a su familia vio la oportunidad de iniciar un negocio de comidas económicas. Pues no había en su localidad un establecimiento similar y la gente lo estaba requiriendo. Después de un tiempo Manuel ha logrado su objetivo y ahora su negocio es estable, pero el quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que compro una motocicleta para ofrecer servicio a domicilio, pero requiere de mantenimiento y reparación, por ello necesita un préstamo de $475 DLLS, para poder ser cubierto en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses.

Con el apoyo de su familia Don Manuel logro su objetivo, ahora el requiere de tu apoyo, conviértete en parte fundamental de los logros de la familia C., ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Bicycle repair

loans.name: Gelmy Guadalupe

texts.en:
Glemy Sanchez and her two daughters lived through some very difficult times after her husband\\\'s passing, especially because he was the sole supporter of the family. In this situation she had to be brave and strong in order to provide for her family, and to do so, she decided to start a small business selling chickens with the help of a starter loan. Even so, the income she generated was not enough to cover the basic necessities of her family, so she decided to expand her business to sell corner store items and soft drinks. She now requires a loan of $925 to stock her inventory and henceforth increase her sales.

Please help Glemy and her family. They were able to overcome difficult times but now they need your support to continue on. With your help they will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Glemy S. y sus dos hijas vivieron momentos sumamente complicados tras el fallecimiento de su esposo, quien era el único sostén de la familia, ante ésta situación ella tuvo que adoptar valor y fortaleza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Por todo ello Glemy decidió emprender, con ayuda de un préstamo, un negocio de venta de pollos, con éstos ingresos aún no alcanzaba a cubrir las necesidades básicas, por lo que decidió también ofrecer abarrotes y refrescos. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $925.00 DLLS, para poder comprar más mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas.

Ayuda a Glemy y su familia, ellas pudieron vencer difíciles momentos, ahora ellas te necesitan para continuar, sólo con tu apoyo lo lograrán.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agostinha

texts.en:
Agostinha Mucomo, 38 years old, native of Mudada, District of Matutuine, is a mother of 4 children and currently divorced. She was in school through the sixth level, but couldn't continue with her studies due to marriage. She separated from her husband about three years ago. They both lived in the city of Maputo and after the separation she returned to her parents' house. With their help, she built a small establishment where she was lacking capital, so through information from her mother, who was already a client of Hluvuku quite a while ago, she was instructed in how to proceed with a loan request. With the courage of an entrepreneur, she directed herself to Hluvuku where she obtained her first financing. From then until now, she has been able to achieve stability in the business and was able to invest in improvement for the small establishment.

With this loan, she intends to acquire more merchandise and a refrigerator to preserve fresh products.

She acquired her business experience in the city of Maputo, where she sold basic goods in the informal market. She currently employs two young mothers and sustains four children.

She plans to expand the commercial establishment, have her own home and buy her own vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva Volunteer

Localização : Bela Vista

Cliente : Agostinha M.

Sector : Comercio

Montante : 13.000,00Mtn (500 US$)

Aplicação : Compra de congelador

Inicio : 18/12/2006

Período : 12 Meses

Agostinha M. , de 38 anos de idade , natural de Mudada , Distrito de Matutuine, mãe de 4 filhos e actualmente divorciada, tendo escolarizado até sexta classe, não seguiu mais com os estudos devido ao casamento, separou-se do marido faz cerca de três anos, ambos viviam na cidade de Maputo e depois da separação voltou para casa dos pais e com ajuda destes construiu um pequeno estabelecimento onde lhe faltou capital de trabalho, dai por informação da mãe que já era cliente da Hluvuku a bastante tempo foi instruída como proceder para solicitar empréstimo e ela sem com coragem de empreendedora dirigiu-se a Hluvuuku onde teve o primeiro financiamento. De lá para cá conseguiu uma estabilidade no negócio e conseguiu investir no melhoramento do pequeno estabelecimento.

Com este empréstimo tenciona adquirir mais mercadorias e um congelador para conservação de produtos frescos.

A experiência de negócio adquiriu na cidade do Maputo, onde vendia produtos de primeira necessidade no mercado informal. Actualmente emprega duas jovens mães e sustenta quatro filhos.

Perspectivas , ampliar o estabelecimento comercial, ter casa própria e comprar viatura própria.

loans.use: Refrigerator acquisition

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta C. is 45 years old and a native of Macassane, Matutuíne District, Maputo Province. She was educated according to her parents' conditions, that is, she couldn't have any formal education or attend any school, but she was educated under the cultural conditions of the family and the area where she lived. She got married at age 18 to her only husband, with whom she had three children. They are currently separated and she says that she's been divorced for 15 years. After the separation from her husband, she worked with two companies, one a chicken breeder. During the 16 years of war between Frelimo and Renamo, she took refuge in the Kingdom of Swaziland, where she worked at a wood processing company as a peeler until 2003, and then the company went bankrupt and she was given severance pay. With that, she returned to Mozambique, having built a commercial establishment, and then she didn't have enough funds to acquire stock and through her sister found out about HLUVUKU.

The first loan was for the purchase of basic goods, so she was able to grow up to now.

With this loan, she plans to acquire a means of transportation to make purchases for her establishment, while also being able to transport goods for other merchants in her area, since Macassane is 50 km away from the city of Maputo. Mrs. Marta's business provides an excellent service for 75 families in Macassane and created 3 jobs, including her own, a driver and a driver's assistant.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, a Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Macassane - Salamanga

Cliente : Marta C.

Sector : Comércio

Montante : 50.000,00Mtn (1,923.00US$)

Aplicação : Compra de viatura

Inicio : 18/12/2006

Período : 14 Meses

Marta C. de 45 anos de idade, natural de Macassane, Distrito de Matutuíne, Província de Maputo, educação segundo as condições dos seus pais ela não pode ter nenhuma educação formal isto é não frequentou nenhum ensino, tendo sido educada sobre as condições culturais da família e da zona, casou aos 18 anos com o seu único marido com qual tiveram três filhos, neste momento separados, diz que a mais de 15 anos que é divorciada, qual depois da separação com marido trabalhou duas empresas , sendo uma de Criação de frangos, durante a guerra dos 16 anos entre a Frelimo e Renamo refugiou-se no Reino da Suazilândia, onde trabalhou numa empresa de processamento de madeira como descascante até ano 2003, depois a empresa veio a falir e foi indemnizada e com o valor regressou para Moçambique tendo construído um estabelecimento comercial, depois ficou sem fundos suficientes para aquisição de meios circulantes e através da sua irmã soube da existência da HLUVUKU.

O primeiro empréstimo foi para a compra de produtos da 1ª necessidades assim foi crescendo até ao presente momento.

Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir um meio de transporte para efectuar as compras do seu estabelecimento e ao mesmo tempo poderá fretar a mesma para outros comerciantes da zona, pois Macassane dista 50 Kms da cidade de Maputo. O negocio da Sra. Marta providencia um serviço excelente para 75 famílias de Macassane e criou 3 postos de trabalho, incluindo ela própria, um motorista e ajudante do motorista.

loans.use: Car acquisition

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Elidja N., 26 years old, is a native of Salamanga, Matutuíne District, Maputo Province and is married and the mother of two children. She attended school through fifth grade. For various reasons, she separated from her first husband, and returned to her parents' home, starting a type of business where she walked about selling clothes. She did not have enough funds available to make the business viable, and turned to HLUVUKU's financial services in 2001.

With financing, the results were encouraging, having acquired, repaired and equipped a market-type commercial establishment.

She currently employs four people, including herself. She has two children depending on her, as well as her parents and five nephews whose parents died as victims of HIV/AIDS.

With this loan, she is trying to increase her working capital in order to respond to the shopping for basic goods needed during the holiday period that is approaching, Christmas and New Year's. This establishment benefits around sixty (60) families residing in the village of Salamanga.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Vila de Salamanga

Cliente : Maria Elija N.

Sector : Comercio

Montante : 47.000,00Mtn (1,808.00US$)

Aplicação : Compra de produtos primeira necessidade

Inicio : 30 de Novembro de 2006

Período : 16 Meses

Maria Elidja N. de 26 anos de idade, Natural de Salamanga distrito de Matutuíne, Província de Maputo, Casada maritalmente e Mãe de Dois filhos, frequentou a escola até quinta classe, por motivos de vária ordem separou-se do primeiro marido, regressada a casa dos pais iniciou negócio de tipo ambulatório de venda de roupa (vestuário), esta não dispunha de fundos suficientes para viabilizar o seu negócio, tendo recorrido aos serviços financeiros da HLUVUKU em 2001.

Com os financiamentos os resultados foram encorajadores tendo adquirido, reabilitado e equipado um estabelecimento comercial tipo mercearia.

Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, incluindo ela própria, dela dependem dois filhos, seus pais e cinco sobrinhos cujos pais morreram vitimas de HIV/SIDA.

Com este empréstimo tenciona aumentar o capital de trabalho de modo a responder a procura de produtos de primeira necessidade durante a quadra festiva que se aproxima, Natal e Fim do Ano. Este estabelecimento beneficia cerca de sessenta (60) famílias residentes na vila de Salamanga.

loans.use: Increase food stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 28 years old, married with no kids.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She has four dependants including her parents.Agnes runs a tailoring business in a busy area of Ilala district.She attended a tailoring business offered by Vocational Education Training Authority(VETA) in Dar es Salaam.She has employed two assistants to help in her business.She makes and sell both men and women clothes.She is a good designer for female clothes,with this endowment she has regular customers as well as new ones.She came to notice that used clothes can also fetch a good market if they get repaired before being sold.She is in a plan to buy used clothes from wholesellers for resale after being repaired.She also want to add stock of sewing and tailoring materials.To make her plan work she is in need of USD 550

loans.use: Adding stock of sewing and tailoring materials

loans.name: Agust

texts.en: Agust lives in Lumo  area of  Dar es Salaam.He is married with two children who are in primary school.Agust owns a shop selling different consumable items,especially food .He is in a plan to expand his business.Limited with his narrow capital base,Agust fail to cope with demand from his clients.He sees this as a lost opportunity,which need to be utilized.From his own savings he can contribute 10% of the expansion project.He still need USD 400 to facilitate his plan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is married with five children.Two are in secondary school and other two are in primary school. He lives in Vituka in Temeke District of Dar es salam. Ally sells maize in retail. He buys the maize in large quantities from nearby regions, stock them and resell them in retail. Ally is planning to improve his business by having enough stock of maize especially in this rain season. Because roads to up country are not easily passable during rain seasons,it is better to have enough stock now.
  Extra stock demands some more packaging materials, carriage costs and storage costs.
To make his plan work Ally is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esperansa

texts.en: Esperansa is married and have two children. One of his sons is in Secondary school.  Esperansa lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.  She runs a vegetable stall outside her house.  She has been in this business for more than three years now.   Esperansa grows vegetable herself and sell them in her stall. In this  rain season she is worried about insects and other microorganisms attacking vegetable growing. She need a sufficient  stock of  insectisides and a spraying pump.  To facilitate this plan she is in need of USD 400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is married with two children.She lives in Lumo,adjacent to the Dar es Salaam International Airport(DIA),in Dar es Salaam.Khadija is self employed and own a shop near her residence.Khadija is a housewife and has only a primary education.With the help of her husband she managed to open the shop.The shop sells different consumable items.Mainly food items,which have high turnover.The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.She would like to expand her business by adding a stock of items in the shop, so that she can meet costs of educating her children and help her husband in raising the family.The shop employs herself and her sister.To expand her business she needs USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Margreth

texts.en: Margreth is married with six children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She keeps cows for milk production.She has employed two assistants to help with the cows.She usually faced with the problem ferrying milk from the production area to where the market is.She want to buy new bicycles and vessels that will facilitate  milk supply.This will help her make more sales and therefore increase income.She is in need of USD 550 to buy bicycles and milk storage vessels.

loans.use: Buying bicycles and milk storage vessels

loans.name: Nshingia

texts.en: Nshingia is 40 years old,married with three children.Two are in primary school ,one in secondary school. She has only primary education because her parents could not meet her education costs.Nshingia is an achievement oriented kind of person.After being married,she could not stand being a mere housewife.She joined some credit associations and with the help of her husband she managed to open a shop.The shop sells different consumable items,especially cold drinks.Cold drinks in her shop has higher turnover,the shop is located near a recreation center.Her shop location provides her with high demand,especially during working hours.She is in a plan to increase the size of stock of cold drinks so as to prevent against stockouts.Stockouts are not desirable in business.She also want to add another fridge to keep these drinks cold.The expansion strategy requires addition funding of USD 750.

loans.use: buying a fridge,add stock of cold drinks,

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with two children. She keeps chickens (layers).It is now a sixth year since she started this business.She recently managed to get a tender to supply eggs to various kindergartein schools in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.From her own business she can not have enough eggs  to supply these schools.In order to keep her customers Rose buys these items from other poultry keepers and resell them to these schools,out of which she earns a small margin of profit.She realized that if she could produce herself these eggs she could earn super profit. She is in need of USD 1000 to expand the business to meet the demand from these schools.From the loan amount she will add a flock of chickens,expand chicken hut,add more trays and medicines for chickens especially in this rain season.

loans.use: Increase chickens number and expanding chicken hut

loans.name: Si Neoun

texts.en:
K. Si Neoun is a 26 year old wife and mother. She has one young son who stays at home, and a daughter who goes to school. K. Si Neoun does manicures and pedicures and earns about $2.50 a day from this. Her husband drives a car for a company and earns a salary of $100 per month. 

K. Si Neoun has requested a loan for $1,000 to purchase a small stall in the market where she can do manicures and pedicures. She believes this will allow here to have more consistent customers, and raise her family\'s income. In the future she would like to start a training school where she will train others how to do manicures and pedicures.

loans.use: Purchase stall in market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Yiai would like to buy 3 steers for her project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Parinko would like to buy 3 steers for her project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy 3 extra steer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Latoi would like to buy three more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Yupaso would like to buy 3 steers for her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Julia would like to pay school fees for her grandson.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy polythene bags, cake wrappers, and sweater threads

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has a small diner where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When he first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. Edison wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He moved to Guayaquil from Manabi in search of better opportunities. He is married and has two children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Edison wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Simón

texts.en:
Simon has a small chicken farm in the backyard of his home. Prior to starting his own operation, he worked at a chicken farm for about 8 years. With about $400 of savings he was able to buy chicks and feed. He has been working on his own for the last 4 years. He has made a living by selling the chickens he grows to the small local markets and vendors. He wants to invest in more chicks and feed at wholesale quantities. He hopes that he can soon begin providing to larger super markets and restaurants who will demand more poultry. Simon depends on this business to support his wife and his son.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He wants to invest in more chicks and feed at wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and has 2 small children. She and her mother run a restaurant that is very popular in their neighborhood. Maria has been in the restaurant since she was very young because her mother always ran similar businesses. Now they are business partners and are having great success. Maria is also a saleswoman who sells shoes, clothes and home products. She sells to many of the clients at her restaurant and she also travels into large markets in the city to make her sales. Maria has not had much luck with the father children. The father of the first left her shortly after finding about the pregnancy and the father of the second passed away two months after the child was born. Although Maria faces the difficult challenge of being a single mother, she is hardworking and optimistic.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in food for her restaurant and other products to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has been working as a dentist for over 19 years. After receiving and repaying her first loan with Kiva and Mifex, she is requesting a second loan in order to invest in a new dentist chair and other equipment. The capital has helped her business because she has better quality materials and tools. She is slowly seeing that her client base has become larger and more satisfied. Her offices are located in the city although she lives in Duran, a poor community on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Carmen also works for a foundation several days a week, offering her dental services at much more affordable prices to the local community. She has 4 children who her and her husband must support.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase a dentist chair and other equipment

payments.comment: Su crédito es cancelado por cuanto Carmen tiene otra deuda por la compra de un carro para el uso personal y tiene cuotas de amortización fuertes que cumplir a un banco local.

loans.name: Telmo

texts.en:
Telmo owns a small store that he runs with his wife. He has been selling various articles for about 14 years. The store is located in a section of his home. His wife attends to the store during the day while Telmo sells fruits and other articles from a tricycle cart. He needs the loan in order to restock the store at his home. He is recovering from a recent surgery he had on his gull bladder that has not allowed him to have the money to reinvest in his store. He and his wife have twins together. They are hoping that with this loan they will be able to reactivate the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He needs the loan in order to restock the store at his home.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela owns a small market where she sells basic groceries. She has only been running the business for a year, but it plays a major role in the household. Four months ago her husband had an operation that required that all the profits from the business go to his medicine. Angela and her family need the loan in order to allow them to invest in the business. Currently the business is run out of the home where she, her husband, and their three kids live.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase products in order to restock her business

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.en:
Cristóbal has a workshop where he does metal work and refrigeration repair. He makes metal doors, gates and windows that are very popular in the community because they provide safety. He also works on refrigerator, automobiles and air conditioner repair. He learned the trades from his father and uncles who were in similar lines of business. He will use the loan in order to buy raw materials for his business. He runs the business out of his home in the backyard. Cristobal has six children he must try to support. His current wife helps him at the business and also has a small business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He will use the loan in order to buy metal and refrigeration fluid

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania has a small store where she sells a variety of items. Her products include shoes, clothes, cleaning products and even toys. She also has a partnership with her mother who lives in rural Ecuador. Tania buys many of her products wholesale and she also distributes to her mother’s store. Her business is doing well but she is in need of more capital in order to continue investing in different types of products that will allow her to increase her profits. She and her husband have two children, one of which has a mental disability. The business has allowed her to provide her son with therapy and medicine.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk to sell from her store

loans.name: Titi
