texts.en: Titi is a housewife, married 26 years ago.She has three children,two of which are in secondary school and one is in primary school.Titi is educated up to primary school.She couldn’t succeeded joining secondary school due to poverty.Her parents could not afford her school costs.Backed with her need for achievement behaviour she joined various women empowerment groups.Out of which she managed at  first to open a small shop selling cold drinks.Her enthusiastic behevaviour made her think she have not meet her objective.She struggled more and more.Titi now owns a shop selling cold drinks in wholesale.The business has high turnover in Dar es Salaam because of high hot weather throught the year.She now sells different kinds of cold drinks to other entrepreneurs.She currently noticed that some drinks have higher turnover than others.She want to have enough stock of these. She need a capital boost of USD 1000.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old.Both of her parents has passed away.She is not married ,but she takes care for her two brothes and a sister.She runs a  hairdressing business in a small premise in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She has employed one assistant in her business. She usually faced with shortages related to materials for her business.Also the current premise she rented is very small that it cannot accommodate six customers at a go.She is in a plan to look somewhere where she can get a bigger premise at a reasonable price.She experienced most difficulties relating to this small premise during x-mass.This condition made her lose so many customers.She want to improve this condition by renting another premise with enough space and adding sufficient amount of hairdressing materials,sitting chairs,a fan and a television set to entertain customer while in a waiting queue.To effectively implement her plan  she need an additional working capital of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 33 years old ,married with three children.She lives in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She runs a food vending business to mostly fishermen along the shores of Indian Ocean in Kigamboni area.She has been in this business over 12 years.The profit earned from her business is very small.She has experienced minimal improvement over years.Last year she attended business and entrepreneurship training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO).From lessons she learned ,she noticed the non-improvement over the years were caused by her ignorance of how to handle her business effectively.She now want to improve the business by adding food supplying vessels,food wrapping materials for take-aways,hygienical food display cages and plastic sitting chairs and tables.Fatma has high credibility with lending institutions.She promised to repay in fully the amount to be loaned to her.She is in need of USD 550 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with three children.She runs a  hairdressing business in a business center  of Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She has employed two assistants in her business. She usually in short of hairdressing materials and hair drier equipments.She experienced most difficulties relating to  stockouts two days before x-mass.Most of the shops selling hairdressing materials were out of stock during x-mass.She hadn’t enough stock either.This condition made her lose so many customers.She want to improve this condition by adding sufficient amount of hairdressing materials,sitting chairs,a fan and a television set to entertain customers while in a waiting queue.To effectively implement her plan  she need an additional working capital of USD 550.

loans.use: Buying hairdressing materials,driers,towels, a fan

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and 4-yeard old son in Monclova, Coahuila. About a year ago her family was faced with many challenges, especially because her husband could not find a job. Their family in the United States came through for them with clothing and toys to sell to be able to earn some money to cover their necessities. This was the beginning of their small business, and now they require a loan of $200 to purchase more inventory through their family in the U.S. The loan will be repaid within 3 to 6 months.

Help Claudia keep up her business and secure a better future for her baby boy. Your help is very much appreciated.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, vive Claudia, con su esposo e hijo de 4 años de edad. Hace un año su familia enfrentó severos problemas, pues su marido no encontraba empleo, frente a ésta situación sus familiares, quienes son residentes en Estados Unidos, comenzaron a enviarle ropa y juguetes para que los pudiera vender y así poder cubrir las necesidades que tenía. Es así como comenzó su propio negocio, y ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 dólares para poder seguir comprando mercancía por medio de sus familiares, mismo que piensa cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

Apoya a Claudia para que pueda seguir ayudando a su esposo y asegurar un mejor futuro para su pequeño, en tus manos ésta el poder hacerlo, sólo hace falta que te decidas, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juanita Lluvisela

texts.en:
Juanita is an engaging woman and a hard worker. She is a single Mom of two kids aged 4 and 2 years old. Given her situation she needs a steady income to provide for her children. Their father does provide them with some child support, although irregularly, and she cannot depend on that to cover the costs of her family. For all of this she has decided to start a small business selling office supplies. Very close to their home is a school and there are no other stores like her nearby so she anticipates success in her small business. Juanita will continue to work arduously for the future of her children.

To purchase more inventory and offer a greater selection in her store she needs $250, of which she plans to repay within three months. Juanita and her two young children need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de dos niños de 4 y 2 años de edad, frente a su condición ella nececita de un ingreso seguro para sus pequeños, pues el padre de ellos sólo les da apoyo económico eventualmente y con esto no es suficiente para poder cubrir con todos los gastos. Por todo ésto ella decidió abrir una papelería, pues muy cerca de hogar se encuentra una escuela y no hay competencia alguna, por lo que de ésta manera garantizaba el funcionamiento de su pequeño negocio. Luego de un tiempo, Juanita continúa trabajando arduamente por el futuro de sus hijos.

Para poder tener más completa la papelería y aprovechar para vender regalos por la temporada, ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 dólares, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 meses. En tus manos ésta el bienestar seguro de los pequeños de Juanita, apóyalos, no los dejes solos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
The name of Maria del Carmen\'s corner store in Monclova, Coahuila is “Miscelánea Juanita”. She is an entreprising and tenacious woman. She is married and is mother to one girl. Three years ago she started her small business to cover the costs of her daughter\'s education, because her husband\'s salary was not enough. At first her store carried only a small variety of items but with time her business grew and continues to grow. But now she needs a loan of $250 to keep up the business, a loan that will be repaid within 3 to 6 months.

The loan will go towards the purchase of inventory so that she may offer a greater variety in her store and therefore increase her customers and sales, especially during the holiday season. It hasn\'t been easy to get this far, but Maria del Carmen has worked hard. Now she needs your support to help her send her daughter to school.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Miscelánea Juanita” es el nombre de la tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en la localidad de Monclova Coahuila, de Doña María del Carmen, una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz. Ella es casada y tiene una hija, hace ya 3 años que inició con el negocio frente a la necesidad de cubrir los costos de la educación de su hija, pues con el sueldo de su esposo esto no era posible. En un comienzo ofrecía una pequeña cantidad de productos, pero con el paso del tiempo el negocio ha ido creciendo y para poder continuar así ella necesita de un crédito de $250 DLLS, mismo que será cubierto en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

El destino del crédito será para tener un buen surtido en el negocio y comprar todo lo necesario y de ésta manera incrementar sus ventas, aprovechando la temporada del año. No ha sido fácil la realización de éste proyecto, Doña María del Carmen ha tenido que luchar mucho para lograrlo, ahora ella requiere de tu ayuda, no la dejes sola y haz posible la culminación de los estudios de su hija.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli, her husband and their three children live in Monclova, Coahuila. With the prime goal of helping her husband with the family costs she opened a shoe and clothing store some 12 years ago, a good match for her because she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. Throughout the years Araceli has kept up her business with much effort and dedication. And through this business she has been able to provide education for her three children.

In order to keep the business growing she needs a loan of $925 to purchase seasonal clothing and shoes. She plans to repay the loan within three months. It is important for Araceli and her family to have your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli, su esposo y sus tres hijos, viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Con él propósito fundamental de ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar, hace 12 años que ella comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, aprovechando el tener gusto y facilidad para las ventas. A lo largo de estos años Araceli con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido su negocio, y de ésta manera también ha logrado costear el estudio de sus hijos, pues los tres son estudiantes.

Para seguir creciendo ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 dólares para poder comprar ropa y zapatos de temporada, planeando cubrirlo en su totalidad en un plazo de 3 meses. Es importante para Araceli y su familia el apoyo que tú puedes brindarles, vuélvete parte de sus logros.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en:
Four years ago Braulio was left unemployed. The difficult situation led him to find an alternative source of income to support his wife and daughter. He is an iron-smith and he knew that he would be able to earn more money on his own than working for a compmany, so he took the decision to start his own business. Today Braulio has a number of contracts that he still has to complete but he needs raw materials, for which he will use the loan he asks of $250. With this loan he will be able to keep up with his small business and keep on supporting his family.

His fortitude and his will to come out on top have caused Braulio to fight for his family, without ever giving up against obstacles. Help him continue with his business. He needs your and your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace cuatro años, Braulio se quedó sin empleo, la difícil situación lo llevo a buscar una alternativa, pues tenía que mantener a su esposa y a su hija. El es herrero y sabía que por su cuenta podría ganar más que trabajando para una empresa, y ante su despido, tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio. Ahora Braulio tiene trabajos pendientes por realizar, pero le falta dinero para comprar los insumos que requiere, por lo que solicita un préstamo de $250 dólares y así poder seguir con su pequeña empresa y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

La entereza y las ganas de salir adelante, han hecho que Braulio luche por su familia y no se deje vencer por las adversidades. Ayúdalo a continuar con su proyecto, él ahora nececita de tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a young man of 21 years, a native resident of Monclova, Coahuila. He is very engaging and has a strong will to succeed in his life, reaching his goals one at a time. His primary objective is to finish his studies. He needed a job that would afford him the time to study but also earn him money at the same time. A friend of his suggested to him that he might sell used clothing. One year later, his business has been a great success.

Juan Pablo needs a loan of $200 to keep up with his business and reach his goals. Become part of Juan Pablo\'s success and help him finish his schooling. He will be able to secure a better future for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Pablo es un joven de 21 años de edad, originario de la localidad de Monclova Coahuila, muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, logrando cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto hasta el momento. Su principal objetivo es concluir con éxito sus estudios, por lo que necesitaba de una actividad que le permitiera estudiar y generar ingresos a la vez, uno de sus amigos le comentó que la venta de ropa usada era un buena oportunidad para lograr lo que el buscaba. Así que hace un año empezó con dicho negocio, dejándole buenos resultados.

Ahora Juan Pablo requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS para poder seguir con su proyecto y lograr las metas que el mismo se ha propuesto, se parte de la realización de las metas de Juan Pablo y ayúdale a concluir con sus estudios y asegurar un mejor porvenir para él y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en:
Noemi is a single woman, engaging and productive, living in Monclova, Coahuila. Some time ago she bought a small house on credit. She needed an additional income to cover the costs of her home, so she started a smalll business selling shoes through catalogue. She started the small business about a year ago and she has seen great success. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory to meet demands during this high sales season.

Noemi needs your support to keep her business growing. She needs a loan of $200 which she plans on repaying within three months. Be part of her success. She thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, vive Doña Noemí, una mujer sola, pero muy emprendedora y productiva, hace algún tiempo compró a crédito una pequeña casa y adquirió otros compromisos. Ella necesitaba de ingresos extras para poder hacer frente a sus gastos, por lo que vio la oportunidad en la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Hace un año que comenzó con el negocio y le ha dado buenos resultados, pero ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más zapatos, pues en ésta temporada los pedidos de los clientes aumentan en grandes cantidades.

Apoya a Doña Noemí en su proyecto y ayúdala a seguir creciendo, ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS, mismo que tiene planeado cubrir en un plazo de 3 meses, se parte de sus logros, ella te lo agradecederá.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a highly intelligent person and a hard worker. She started her business more than 7 years ago when she faced was faced with a separation from her husband. She needed to provide for her family and she found herself to be the sole bread winner. Carmen has three beautiful daughters, of which all have expressed their want to study. Today Carmen keeps paying for all of her daughters\' studies. She needs support to make her business grow and to keep paying for her family\'s expenditures.

She needs $700 to buy inventory to meet the high demand during this holiday season. For Carmen this is her only source of income and she needs your support and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una persona muy inteligente y trabajadora, inició su negocio hace más de 7 años ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia debido a que se separo de su esposo y ella enfrento sola la responsabilidad de cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Carmen tiene 3 mujeres muy hermosas y todas han podido estudiar la universidad. Actualmente Carmen sigue costeando la educación de sus hijas, sin embargo necesita de un apoyo para que su negocio crezca y ella pueda seguir cubriendo estos gastos familiares.

Ella requiere de $700.00 DLLS para comprar mercancía que le permita atender la alta demanda que tiene debido a estas fechas navideñas, para Carmen este es el único trabajo con el que cuenta, por lo que ella necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is an engaging and responsible person. He has a beautiful family which are his cause of motivation to work hard at a print shop. But throughout the years Daniel acquired much experience and he came up with the idea of starting his own business. Today he has his small business that grows slowly and one step at a time. But he needs a loan of $1100 to buy all the necessary items and inventory that he needs to increase production of his print shop.

Daniel has mentioned that during this holiday season the demand for products increases and so he needs your support and generosity to keep up. With this he will be able to earn an income to cover the necessities of his family. He thanks your for your kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniel es una persona emprendedora y responsable, tiene una hermosa familia la cual es su inspiración para trabajar duro todos los días; hace ya mas 10 años el trabajaba para una imprenta, sin embargo a través de los años Daniel fue adquiriendo experiencia, esto le trajo la idea de independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio. Actualmente su negocio sigue creciendo poco a poco, sin embargo necesita de un apoyo de $1100 DLLS para comprar material que le permita aumentar la producción de su imprenta.

Daniel comenta que en estas fechas navideñas la demanda por sus productos aumenta, por lo que necesita de tu ayuda y generosidad para seguir trabajando, ya que de esta forma el obtiene un ingreso que le permite cubrir con los gastos de su familia. El agradece tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ingacio lives in the outskirts of Monterrey, Neuvo Leon. He makes and sells Mexican style tacos. He started his business more than 9 years ago with the sole priority to generate an income to cover the family costs. Ignacio has a beautiful family with four childreen and his wife, which is a terrific responsibility to support then and offer them a better quality of life.

Today, one of his children helps him with the business. He prides himself in being able to share the experience with this family. He requires a loan of $925 to buy ingredients to increase their production. Lately there has been a jump in the demand for their food and he sees and opportunity to make his business grow. He and his family thank you for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ignacio vive en los márgenes de Monterrey Nuevo León, trabaja en la producción y venta de tacos mexicanos, inició su negocio hace más de 9 años con el único propósito de generar un ingreso y cubrir los gastos de su familia. Ignacio tiene una hermosa familia compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposa por lo que el se siente con una gran responsabilidad de sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Actualmente uno de sus hijos le ayuda en el negocio, esto hace que este se haya convertido en un medio mas para convivir con toda su familia; por lo que Ignacio requiere de un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar la producción de sus comidas, ya que últimamente sus ventas han aumentado y necesita aprovechar la oportunidad de hacerlo crecer. El y su familia agradecen tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana G. is 52 years old. She is married and has two sons who live in Varna now. Her husband is unemployed. Jana has a master degree in economics and has a long professional experience as an accountant. In 1995 she loses her job and starts her own accountant services business. Now she consults over 85 small and medium companies. This business is the only source of income for Jana and her family. Jana G. needs a 1600 loan to buy some new office furniture and a computer for her business.

loans.use: To buy some new office furniture and a computer

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin K. lives in the town of Alphatar, which is 35 km. away from Silistra. He is 45 years old and has two daughters. Valentin has worked as technician in a state company for more than 15 years but 5 years ago he starts his agricultural business. Valentin grows 150 decares lavender. Two years ago he builds a small workshop in which he distils lavender oil. This oil is used in pharmacy and perfumery. This $ 2000 loan Valentin K. will use to grow another 100 decares of lavender.

loans.use: To grow 100 decares of lavender.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela P. is 41 years old and lives in Silistra with her husband and her son. Till 1993 she works as a seller in many company in Silistra and then she and her husband open a small grocery store. But soon a large supermarket was opened in the neighborhood and Daniela and her husband had to close their grocery. So in 2003 Daniela\'s husband becomes a taxi driver and she opens a clothing shop. Daniela has a rich experience in retail and the shop is always very good supplied. Now Daniela P. needs $ 1 700 loan to make repairs on her shop and to buy new equipment.

loans.use: To make repairs on and to buy new equipment

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta  B. is 38 years old. She is married and has a boy who is 8 years old. In 1992 her husband Rosen buys a truck and starts transport business. In 2004 he opens a shop for baby clothes and accessories and names in \"The Happy Baby\" but Rosen is occupied with transport and Violeta  starts to develop this new business. The shop is small but is on a busy street and is the only specialized shop for baby goods in the town. Rosen and Violeta want to buy a car to supply their shop and need $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a car to supply the shop

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis Niazy is 23 years old. He still lives with his mother and they both keep a small bakery named \"Delicious World\". They started this business four years ago when Denis graduated high school. The bakery is a part of a big grocery store and is right to three of the schools in the town. So their customers are mostly students. Denis and his mother produce and offer refreshments and soft drinks. They need a new dough-kneader and an oven and apply for a $1300 loan

loans.use: For a new dough-kneader and an oven

loans.name: Reshat

texts.en: Reshat M. was born in Varna but lives in Silistra since he was 10 years old because his family moved there. He is 47 years old and has worked as a constructor for over 10 years. In 1996 because of the political and ecomic crisis in Bulgaria he left the country and went to  Germany where he has some relatives. There he worked in a fruit and vegatable grocery and when in 2001 came back to Bulgaria he decided to open such a grocery in Silistra. His grocery is in one of the biggest quarters in the town and is always very good supplied. Now Reshat M. applies for a $ 1200 loan which he will spend on a new electronic balance.

loans.use: For a new electronic balance.

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan H. has more than 20 years working experience in a scrap remaking company. He is 50 years old, married with two daughters. One of them lives in Germany now. Seven years ago he decided to start to do this business for him. So he found a paper scrap station. All used paper he reduced and started to produce napkins and toilet paper out of it. During the years the business is growing up and now Jordan has modern equipment for reducing paper. Because the increased capacity Jordan H. needs to buy a motor truck for load and unload activities. The loan amount is $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a motor truck

loans.name: Karamfilka

texts.en: Karamfilka O. (47) is a single mother of two kids. She has a special economic education on \\\"Selling consultancy\\\" subject and used to work in the state \\\"Valentina\\\" Trade Center for more than 10 years. After the company was closed Valentina got herself unemployed for two years. Then she started to think of founding a little business. Four years ago she opened a shop for clothes and underwear. Because of her previous selling experience and the quality of the articles her shop is very popular in the town. Karamfilka O. wants to purchase new trading equipment and a new shop window and needs $ 1 500

loans.use: To purchase new trading equipment and a new shop window

loans.name: Zlatka

texts.en: Zlatka S. is 37 years old, married with two children. She is running her business since 1996. Then she and her husband were unemployed and because he was a electronic technician they decided to start selling and repairing of cashing machines and other electronic appliances. This period was hard because of the economic and political changes in the country but bacause of their previous experience and contacts they managed to strengthen their position as one of most popular companies selling this kind of services in Smolian and region. Now this is a family business and their two children work in the company as well. Zlatka S. and her husband need a new repairing stand for testing and adjustment of electronic apliances. The loan amount is $ 2000.

loans.use: For a new repairing stand for testing and adjustment of electronic apliances

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en: Miroslav F. lives in Smolian. He is 33 years old and after graduation starts to work as a taxi driver in a taxi company in the town. Miroslav spends three years there and decides to found his own taxi company. At the beguinning he has only one car and now two years later he is an owner of three taxi cars. Miroslav works with his sister, his girlfriend and some of his colleagues from the previous company. Now Miroslav F. wants to purchase and equip one more taxi car and needs $ 2000.

loans.use: To purchase and equip one more taxi car

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en: Nikolai T. used to work as a switchman in railroad transport but because of the eye sickness of his wife he has to quit to look after her. So he builds a cowshed in his house yard and starts farming business. Now Nikolai breeds 25 cows and several calves. This business is the only source of income for the family and this income is important because the magical treatment of Nikolai\'s wife is very expensive. Tikolai T. applies for a $ 900 loan to purchase a central milk conducting system.

loans.use: To purchase a central milk conducting system

loans.name: Apostol

texts.en: Apostol H. was born in Asenovgrad but many years he and his wife lived in the near big city Plovdiv. He was a fireman and she worked as a constructor in a factory producing typing machines. After his retirement Apostol and his wife moved to Asenovgrad where he started own farming business. Apostol breeds 40 cows and 15 calves. A great help in this business give his two sons. Apostol H. wants to equip a milking hall and needs $ 1 800.

loans.use: To equip a milking hall

loans.name: Nedko

texts.en: Nedko G. is a musician but he and his wife Vildana were unemployed for a very long time. So they decided to open a small grocery in Smolian and to start own business. As the time goes by Nedko starts to supply mostly meat and meat products and the grocery becomes a butcher\'s shop. Now he is one of the most popular butchers in the town and has lots of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. Soon he starts to make deliveries to his most attractive clients. Now his two sons work in the family business too. Nedko Garberski and his family need to buy a new professional meat freezer for  their butcher\'s shop. The loan amount is $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a new professional meat freezer

loans.name: María Elena

texts.en:
Maria is married and has three daughters aged 17, 16, and 12 years of age. They live in Escobedo, Neuvo Leon. Her husband\'s salary was not enough to cover the family\'s expenses so she decided to start selling shoes to earn extra income, although she still found the time to care for her family. Now Maria continues on with her business that she started now almost three years ago, and through her business she was able to help with her daughters\' tuition fees.

The love of her family and the unconditional support of her husband made Maria\'s efforts possible and she was able to cover the basis necessities for those she loves the most. She now needs a loan of $200 to meet the high demand during this busy holiday season. It\'s in your hands to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora María es casada y tiene tres hijas de 17, 16 y 12 años de edad, viven en la localidad de Escobedo, N.L. El sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir con los gastos familiares, por lo que ella decidió comenzar a vender zapatos por catalogo, para poder obtener ingresos extras y al mismo tiempo no desatender a su familia. Ahora María sigue con ésta actividad que inició hace casi tres años, y esto ha contribuido a poder cubrir las cuotas escolares de sus hijas.

El amor a su familia y el apoyo incondicional ante su esposo hicieron posible que María luchará para cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus seres más queridos, ahora ella requiere un préstamo de $200 DLLS para poder hacer frente a los fuertes pedidos de la época. Apoyalarla esta en tus manos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica is mother of two young children aged 10 and 3 years of age, and they live in Escobedo, Neuvo Leon. Her husband is a laborer and his income is very modest. They have faced many economic difficulties, the reason why Veronica wanted to help and ease their situation by selling candies and snacks. It is already 8 years now that she started her small business and it has grown a little at a time. Thanks to her efforts she has b een able to provide for her children and has given them an education. Now she needs a loan of $200 to keep up the business.

She will use the loan to stock her supplies and vary the products she sells, and therefore increase her sales. She plans on repaying this loan within 3 months. Veronica needs your support. The family thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Escobedo Nuevo León vive Doña Verónica, madre de dos pequeños de 10 y tres años. Su esposo es obrero y su sueldo es muy bajo, por lo que presentan muchas dificultades económicas, es por ello que Verónica pensó en ayudar a resolver un poco éste problema vendiendo dulces, frituras y golosinas. Ya son 8 años desde que inició ésta pequeña empresa y ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Gracias al esfuerzo que ella ha realizado ha podido brindarle a sus hijos sustento y educación, pero ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 DLLS para poder continuar.

Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar más variedad y cantidad de mercancía y de ésta forma poder incrementar sus ventas, ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un lapso de 3 meses. Es momento de apoyar a Verónica en esté proyecto, decídete y contribuye al bienestar de su familia. Ellos de te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Sixteen years ago Rosaura decided to start selling cosmetics and shoes by catalogue given their difficult economic situation. Her husband\'s income as a driver was modest. They have 4 children that need an education. Through this business the family\'s welfare has been established and an education for their children has been secured. Strength, enthusiasm, and perseverence are the qualities that define Rosaura and, with the support of her family, she has been able to achieve her goals.

She requires a loan of $250 to purchase more items for resale, to increase her sales. You have the power to help her and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 16 años Rosaura decidió comenzara vender cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo, debido a las dificultades que enfrentaban por el poco sueldo que su esposo, quien es chofer, percibía. Pues tienen 4 hijos quienes requieren de educación. Esta actividad ha ayudado mucho al bienestar de la familia y asegura la educación de sus hijos. Fortaleza, entusiasmo y perseverancia son cualidades que definen a Rosaura y ella con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado lo que se ha propuesto.

Ella esta requiriendo de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía y de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.en:
Dora is a tenacious and enthusiastic woman. She divorced almost six years ago and her husband has not helped her and their three young children with the family expenses. In this difficult situation and wanting to put her children first, she decided to start making and selling food (traditional Mexican food: menudo and tamales). With her small business she earned enough income to provide for her children and it gave her enough time to look after them as well. The adversities in Dora\'s life did not stop there but she continued to persevere, fighting for the welfare of her children. She is requesting a loan of $475 to buy ingredients, raw materials, and utensils to meet the demand.

With this loan Dora will be able to increase her income, but she needs your support. Help her give her children a better quality of life and an education. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora es una mujer muy tenaz y entusiasta, ella es divorciada desde hace más casi 6 años, su ex esposo no ha contribuido con los gastos de sus tres pequeños, quienes aún son menores de edad. Ante esta difícil situación ella decidió sacar adelante a sus hijos y comenzó a elaborar comida para vender (menudo y tamales), pues con esta actividad tenía ingresos y además podía cuidar a sus hijos. Las adversidades no detuvieron a Dora y ha luchado fuertemente por el gran amor a sus hijos. Ella ésta solicitando un crédito de 475 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos e instrumentos necesarios para hacer frente a los pedidos que se le presentan.

Con éste préstamo Dora podrá incrementar sus ingresos, ella requiere de tu apoyo, no la dejes sola y ayúdala a darle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos, ellos de te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Four years ago Hugo started a small beauty parlor in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon because it was very difficult to find a job paying enough money to cover his basic necessities. His business requires a number of upgrades and improvements, for example, the building is very small and he doesn\\\'t have all the tools he needs. For this, Hugo requests a loan of $200. He will buy a chair and other materials and products he needs to make his business grow and to increase his income.

He plans on repaying the loan within 3 to 6 months. He needs your support. He is very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hugo hace 4 años inició con una pequeña estética, en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, debido a que era muy difícil encontrar un empleo que pudiera darle un salario que cubriera todas sus necesidades. Sin embargo su negocio presenta muchas carencias, pues el espacio que tiene es muy pequeño y tampoco cuenta con las herramientas necesarias, por lo que no ha podido crecer mucho desde su comienzo. Por ello Hugo requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS, para poder comprar un sillón y otras insumos que requiere para hacer prosperar su negocio y generar más ingresos para sus necesidades diarias.

El planea cubrir el monto total de su crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, solo hace falta que tu te decidas a apoyarlo y volverte parte de sus logros, el te lo va agradecer. Apóyalo, no lo dudes.

loans.use: Purchase armchair

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.en:
Berta Alicia lives with her three children and husband in Escobedo, Neuvo Leon. Three years ago she started selling shoes and catering to help her husband with the family\\\'s expenses, as her husband\\\'s income was not enough to cover the basic necessities (such as education). The perseverence that defines Berta is what has made it possible to continue on with her business since the beginning - her motivation is the love of her children and her husband.

She needs a loan of $250, of which she will repay within 3 months. With it she will be able to meet her clients\\\' demands, increasing her income and improving her family\\\'s quality of life. You can help her with her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta Alicia vive en Escobedo N.L con sus tres hijos y su esposo. Hace 3 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos y comidas para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar, ya que con el sueldo de éste no les alcanzaba para hacer frente a los requerimientos básicos, como educación, de su familia. La perseverancia que define ha Berta es lo que ha hecho posible que ella continúe con la actividad que hace tiempo inicio, impulsada por le amor a sus hijos y esposo.

Ella ahora necesita de un préstamo de $250 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un periodo de 3 meses. Con éste ella podrá hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes en ésta época e incrementar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Tu puedes contribuir a esta causa, la decisión esta en tus manos, apóyalos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Violeta Deyanira

texts.en:
Violeta is mother to two young children. Her husband is a laborer and they all live in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Her husband Juventino\\\'s income was not enough to cover all the household costs, which is why 5 years ago she decided to start selling shoes by catalogue. And having seen success in the business she has continued on until today. Violeta\\\'s objective is to contribute and support her husband and to be able to secure a better quality of life and an education for her children.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to expand her business by purchasing more inventory and meet the demands of her clients, and reinvest some of her earnings back into the business. Become part of the family\\\'s successes. They are very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Violeta es madre de dos pequeños, su esposo es obrero y viven en Escobedo Nuevo León. El sueldo de Juventino no alcanza para poder cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que hace 5 años ella decidió iniciarse en la venta de zapatos por catálogo, y al ver que obtenía ingresos extras ha continuado con ésta actividad hasta el momento. El objetivo de Violeta es ofrecer apoyo a su marido y poder garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.

Ella esta solicitando un crédito de $250 DLLS para poder hacer crecer su negocio al tener mayor capital para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes en ésta época y poder reinvertir parte de sus ganancias. Se parte de los logros de la Familia Ávila B., ellos te estarán sumamente agradecidos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Noemí

texts.en:
Blanca lives in the suburbs of Monterry, Neuvo Leon. She has four children and they all work in the family business. Blanca decided to start her own busines to meet her need to put her children first and secure an education for them. Her husband works as a painter but his salary is not enough to cover the household costs. Blanca has been managing her business for 8 years now and it has given her the ability to give her children an education and a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $250 to buy ingredients to produce larger quantities of her most delicious Mexican foods. The orders she receives have increased but she cannot afford to reinvest her earnings back in the business. She needs your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca vive en los márgenes de Monterrey Nuevo León, tiene 4 hijos y todos participan en el negocio familiar, ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles estudios, Blanca inició su propio negocio. Su esposo trabaja como pintor de casas, sin embargo su salario no suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Blanca tiene más de 8 años de experiencia en su negocio y este le ha permitido ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar insumos y producir una mayor cantidad de sus riquísimas comidas mexicanas, actualmente sus pedidos han aumentado pero no cuenta con el capital económico para hacer crecer su negocio, ella requiere de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Deria Xochitl

texts.en:
Deria is a very family oriented woman. She started her own business with her Mom\'s help. She has two small children for whom she works very hard every day, and her husband emigrated to the United States to try and find employment to help his family. Deria was worried about their financial situation and so she started her business, which today helps her cover all of the family\'s expenses. She hopes to be able to expand her business so that her husband will be able to come back home and so that he will never have to leave again. Together they will manage the business and will enjoy a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $250 to purchase inventory and to increase the variety of products in her store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to make her business grow. She plans on repaying the loan in 3 to 6 months. you can help Deria and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Deria es una mujer muy entregada a su familia inició su propio negocio con la ayuda de su mamá, tiene 2 hijos pequeños por los que todos los días trabaja muy duro y su esposo emigro a los Estados Unidos para encontrar un empleo y sacar a su familia adelante. Deria preocupada por todo esto emprendió el negocio y actualmente este le permite cubrir con los gastos de la familia. Ella tiene la esperaza de hacer crecer su negocio de tal modo que su esposo regrese y no se vuelva a ir, juntos administrarlo y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar mercancía para tener una mayor capacidad y variedad de productos en su tienda, ella tiene la espera que con este préstamo le ayude hacer crecer su negocio. En un término de 3-6 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo, tú puedes apoyar a Deria y a su familia, apóyalos.

loans.use: purchase food

loans.name: Maria Petra

texts.en:
Petrita lives with her five children, for whom she works very hard, in San Nicolas, Nuevo Leon. She started her business to help cover family expenses seeing as her husband\'s salary was not enough. She was also faced with the medical expenses of her sick child who passed away, one that she thinks of with so much love. She sells beauty products and the income has helped her support her family.

She needs a loan of $700 to buy Mary Kay products to meet the demand for those items. During this holiday season she hopes to see an increase in her sales which will help her continue to support her family. She thanks you for your help and for your kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrita vive en San Nicolás Nuevo León, tiene 5 hijos de familia por los cuales trabaja muy duro todos los días. Inició su negocio ante la necesidad de contribuir con los gastos de la familia ya que el salario de su esposo no es suficiente para cubrirlos. Además para enfrentas los gastos de la enfermedad y muerte de uno de sus hijos, que hasta el momento Petrita lo recuerda con mucho cariño. Ella vende productos de belleza y esto le ha permitido apoyar a la familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $700 DLLS para comprar productos de belleza “Mary Key” para enfrentar el incremento de demanda por sus artículos, debido a estas temporadas navideñas ella espera que sus ingresos aumenten y seguir apoyando a su familia como lo hace hasta ahora. Tú puedes contribuir con su propósito, ella agradece tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a friendly and engaging person and a hard worker. She has three children and she has been able to provide them with an education. She started her business a few years ago when her husband retired and his salary was not enough to cover the houshold costs. So it was up to Yolanda to start a business selling Mary Kay products. Her work has allowed her to suport her husband with the family expenses, for which she requires a loan of $700 to purchase items.

Yolanda hopes to expand her business with this loan and she will be able increase her earnings. She thanks you for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una mujer amigable, emprendedora y muy trabajadora; tiene 3 hijos a los cuales les ha podido ofrecer una educación. Su negocio inició hace ya algunos años cuando su marido se retiro, por lo que su salario no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar, entonces fue cuando Yolanda decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo productos de belleza “Mary Key”, actualmente su trabajo le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $700 para comprar mercancía.

Yolanda espera que con este préstamo su negocio crezca y pueda brindarle mayores ingresos, ella espera tu ayuda y generosidad, apóyala para que siga creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en:
Alvaro is a fighter. His family provides him with the love and strength to carry on working every day. His ultimate goal is to be able to offer an education for his children so that in the future they will become honest, hard working people. He started out selling groceries, and, with time, the business has evolved into a corner store, that has given him employment and an income that covers all the family\'s expenses.

He needs a loan of $925 to put towards inventory to stock his store. He sells some of his items on credit to his clients, a strategy to sell his products. He wants to expand his business, a success that will bring a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alvaro es un hombre muy luchador, su familia le brinda el amor y la fuerza para seguir trabajando todos los días. Su finalidad es poder ofrecer una educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro se conviertan en personas honestas y trabajadoras. Su negocio consiste en la venta de abarrotes y con el tiempo ha formado su propia tienda de abarrote, esta le ha proporcionado la forma de tener un empleo y cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia.

El requiere de $925 USD para comprar mercancía ya que Alvaro utiliza créditos a sus clientes como estrategia de venta de sus productos. El desea hacer crecer su negocio y prosperar de tal forma que pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette M. (45 years old), she is married, has 3 children, and works in jewelery sales and her jewelery items are made from Brasilian gold. The loan will allow her to stock jewelery in order to sell them in the businesses she visits daily, thereby improving the livelihood of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Lissette M. (45 años), Maestra de profesión, casada, 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de prendas confeccionadas con oro brasileño. El crédito le permitirá abastecerse de prendas para colocarlas en las empresas que diariamente visita, mejorando así la economía de su familia.

loans.use: To buy Brasilian gold.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a very tenacious and hard working woman, and a mother of three for whom she works hard every day providing them with the basic necessities. Victoria started a small business selling blankets and curtains. She started selling among friends and family, but today she has a large clientele that look for her products. Her husband is a janitor but his job is unsteady and unreliable. Victoria wants to help her little ones by giving them an education and a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $250 for the purchase of more inventory, especially important during this holiday season when sales are so high, a demand that she is not ready to meet. She needs your support and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Vitoria es una mujer muy tenaz y trabajadora, con 3 hijos de familia por los que todos los días tiene que trabajar para poder cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar, Victoria inició un pequeño negocio en la venta de colchas y cortinas. Empezó vendiendo entre familiares y conocidos, sin embargo actualmente ya tiene una variedad de clientes que buscan sus productos. Su esposo es recogedor de basura, por lo que su trabajo es inestable e inseguro. Victoria quiere sacar adelante a sus pequeños brindándoles estudios y una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita de $250 USD para comprar mercancía ya que en estas fechas navideñas las ventas están aumentado, pero no cuenta con la capacidad económica para enfrentar este aumento, por lo que pide de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina sells shoes and fashion jewellery, a business that she started some years ago, something that has allowed her to support her family and her husband by covering the household costs. Her husband works in a private company, but his salary is not enough to cover all their expenses. Catalina has three children aged 15, 11, and 19 years of age, and she knows that their short childhood is a very delicate period for which they need lots of attention.

Catalina runs a small store where she sells fashion jewellery and shoes but she needs your support to expand her business, for which she requests a loan of $250 to purchase more inventory and increase the selection of items for sale. She and her family need your support and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina se dedica ala venta de zapatos y joyería, inició este negocio hace ya algunos años permitiéndole a través de estos años sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada, sin embargo su salario no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos. Catalina tiene 3 jóvenes hijos de 15, 11 y 19 años de edad y sabe que su corta edad es una etapa delicada y necesitan de mucha atención.

Actualmente Catalina tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende sus productos de joyería y de zapatos pero necesita de un apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio, ella requiere de $250 USD para aumentar la capacidad de productos en su tienda y de esta manera ella puede aumentar la variedad y cantidad de artículos para vender. Ella y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.en:
Angelica lives in Escobedo in the province of Neuvo Leon with her two kids aged 5 and 15; they are her inspiration to keep going. Her small shoe sales business has been running for three years now. She has earned a large clientele that depend on her for her products. Her husband works as an ironsmith but his contracts are unsteady and intermittent, which is why she started her business to help out with the family expenses.

Angelica has seen an increase in demand for her items, but she has not way to meet this increase. She requires a loan of $200 to put towards the purchase of inventory that will allow her to meet the demand and therefore take advantage of this opportunity to increase her earnings. She will repay the loan within 3 to 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica vive en Escobedo Nuevo León, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 15 años de edad quienes son su inspiración para seguir adelante en al vida. Su negocio consiste a la venta de zapatos y lleva mas de 3 años funcionando, por lo que actualmente Angélica cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes por sus productos. Su esposo trabaja como herrero por lo que los trabajos que realiza son temporales e inestables, ante este problema ella encontró la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.

Angélica presenta un incremento en la demanda por sus artículos, pero no tiene la capacidad de hacer frente a este incremento, por lo que requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita cubrir con toda esta demanda y no desaprovechar la oportunidad de generar mayores ganancias. En un término de 3-6 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.en:
Yolanda is a family oriented woman, mother of two children and wife to a husband that works as a painter. Her children are still small, aged 4 and 13 years of age, and she worries for them and she struggles to find a way to offer them an education and a better quality of life. Yolanda sells household items such as bed clothes and kitchen items.

She needs a loan of $200 to purchase more inventory and offer her clients a larger variety of items, especially important during this holiday season when sales are so high. Yolanda needs your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una persona muy entregada a su familia tiene 2 hijos y su esposo trabaja como pintor de casas y oficinas. Sus hijos son muy jóvenes apenas tienen los 4 y 13 años de edad, por lo que Yolanda esta muy preocupada por encontrar la forma de sacarlos adelante, ofreciéndoles estudios y una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Yolanda consiste en la venta de diferentes productos del hogar como colchas y artículos para la cocina.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le ayude a tener una mayor variedad de productos, ya que estas fechas son una excelente temporada para que sus ventas se incrementen y genere mayores ingresos. Yolanda requiere de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Erika Roció

texts.en:
Rocio lives in Escobedo in the province of Neuvo Leon, is mother to two small children aged 10 and 2 years, and her husband is a welder but his work is often unsteady and his salary is not enough to cover the family expenses. Rocio found a way to help support her family, she started her won business selling shoes and clothing. Slowly her business grew and now she requests a loan of $200 to buy more inventory. She needs this loan to meet the high demand for her articles during this holiday season.

Rocio wants to give her children and education and a better quality of life. You can help her and her family. They thank you for your generosity and your kindness. She will repay the loan within 3 to 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocio vive en Escobedo Nuevo León, es madre de 2 pequeños de 10 y 2 años de edad, su esposo es soldador, sin embargo su trabajo es inestable y su salario no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia. Por esta razón Rocio encontró la forma de apoyar a su esposo comenzando su propio negocio, este consiste en la venta de zapatos y ropa. Actualmente su negocio a crecido poco a poco, pero necesita de un apoyo por $200 DLLS para comprar mercancía que le permita enfrentar el incremento de demanda debido a esta temporada navideña.

Rocio desea ofrecer a sus hijos estudios y una mejor calidad de vida; tu puedes apoyarla y ayudar a su familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y cariño. En un término de 3-6 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo. ¡Apóyalos!

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.en:
Karina is an engaging and hard working woman with two small children aged 5 and 2 years. She found herself needing to start her own business to support her family and provide them with the basic necessities. Karina sells used clothing and she has been doing so for more thna a year now, a business she opes to expand with the income she earns.

She requires a loan of $200 to buy more used clothing and to increase the variety of items she has for sale. Karina hopes that this will help her increase her sales and allow her to expand her business. She is grateful for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora tiene dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 2 años, ella se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio para apoyar a su propia familia de tal forma que desea tener un mayor ingreso para cubrir con las necesidades básicas de la familia. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene más de un año en este negocio, por lo que ella espera que crezca y que día con día sus ingresos aumenten.

Ella requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía como ropa usada para aumentar la variedad de artículos que tiene a la venta, ya que Karina espera que de esta forma sus ventas se incrementen y su negocio vaya a crecer. Ella espera de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza lives in Escobedo in the province of Neuvo Leon with her three beautiful children aged 3, 11 and 20 years. She started her business when she saw that her husband\'s salary was not enough tto cover the household costs. She makes and sells traditional foods such as tacos and chicken dishes. She has been running the business now for more than 14 years and she wants to expand in order to cover the cost of education for her children who hope to attend university.

She requires a loan of $325 to buy ingredients, such as condiments, for her cooking. She needs your help and your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza vive en Escobedo Nuevo León tiene tres hermosos hijos de 3, 11 y 20 años de edad, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de que el salario de su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de comidas caseras como flautas, guisos con pollos y tacos; tiene más de 14 años con este negocio y Esperanza quiere hacerlo crecer para seguir apoyando a su esposo y cubrir los estudios de sus hijos ya que se encuentran cercanos a estudiar la universidad.

Ella requiere de $325 USD para comprar insumos como materiales de cocina, así como condimentos y la comida para preparar los platillos; ella necesita tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mwasiti is 47 years old ,married with two children.She lives in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She runs a food vending business in Kigamboni area.She has been in this business for many years.The local authorities of the area where she operates requires people running food vending business to rent on already built premises.The move is toward combating cholera out break.The area is usually attacked by cholera.Also they are also required to observe highly sterilized dish serving vessels.All these requirements need some capital investments .Now she want to improve the business by adding food supplying vessels,food wrapping materials for take-aways,hygienical food display cages and plastic sitting chairs and tables.She is in need of USD 750 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He married and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he sold the vegetable. He borrowed the loan amount of $500 to be engaged in sale of vegetable. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1100 to rent a mini shop and bought foodstuffs. 
He applies for the loan $1500 to expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en:
Ayna is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 42. She married and has 2 children. She lost her husband in war and she is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $200 from Normicro in 2002 she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $500 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.

She applies for the loan $800 to repair shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and to repair shop

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.
This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en: Mwajabu is married with  six children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.Mwajabu runs a shop selling cosmetics.She has been in this business for more than three years now.Before undertaking this business she was in food vending business.The business couldn’t turn to be profitable because of inappropriate business skills.Then she decided to turn into cosmetics business after being adviced by a friend.In 2005 she attended a Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by YOSEFO.She noticed tremendous improvement on her business after putting into practice the lessons she learned.She now want to replenish her stock after sales she made during  x-mass.She is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Increase stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Shekha

texts.en: Shekha is 44 years old,married with seven children.Of which two are in secondary school,three are in primary school and one is in nursery school.Shekha runs a shop selling building materials in Kigamboni area in Dar es Salaam.With the help from her husband and a loan from PRIDE-Tanzania she managed to open the shop.Building materials shop need a huge capital.The building materials business generally is good,but this year Shekha has a problem of inadequate capital.The main item in her shop is Cement.Cement production this year went low due to power crisis.Throughout the year Tanzania had experienced acute power shortages,causing Cement price to rise.This made her operations costs to be very high thus lowering her profit margin.Sheha want to replenish the stock of building materials,especially cement.She is in need of USD 1000.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with six children,of which two are in secondary school.Upon completion of secondary school Anna was married to a taxi driver.Income from her husband alone could not meet all the family expenses left alone school fees for the children.That situation forced Anna to find means to help her husband raising the family.She decided to join a training on batik( a type of locally decorated cloth) making from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO).Since she started this business twelve years ago she has acquired a lot of customers from her own made Batik. She now has both regular and new customers.She needs USD  550 to add a stock of raw materials for Batik making.

loans.use: Adding stock of batik making materials

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is 39 years old, married with three children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.Rehema owns a small shop selling cosmetics and women clothes in a very small rented premise.She is in a plan to find another premise with enough space.As a prerequisite to this move,she want to increase the size of stock of cosmetics and clothes.The new premise will have enough space to allow her  stock enough products for sale.To implement her plan Rehema is in need of USD  400.

loans.use: Adding stock of clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Dotto

texts.en: Dotto lives in Kigamboni area of  Dar es Salaam.She is married and has three children.Two of them are in primary school ,one in secondary school.With the help of her husband she managed to open a grocery store five years ago.Her business is good with the exception of insufficient working capital, a competitive disadvantage for her. X-mass period has almost depleted all her stock of cold drinks.Most of the drinks sh sells are from Coca-Cola Company.But recently the company plant at Dar es Salaam failed to meet costomers dermand.It only supply big customers.Other customers like Dotto has to order from another  plant located in Moshi (nearby region) at a bit higher price.More than enough capital is needed. Few chairs within the grocery also acts as a drawback to her business.She has to overcome these drawbacks before her competitors grab her market share. She is in need of USD 750 to facilitate her plan.

loans.use: Adding stock of Cold drinks,chairs and tables

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en: Ramla is 34 years old,married with three children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.Ramla sells home use plastic products.She purchase these products from wholesellers at town center,hire a car and stock them in her store.She has been in this business for more than six years.She has experienced minimal improvements over the years.She learned from experience that,if she increase the size of her business she would experience ‘economies of scale’,thus enjoy the benefits of large scale operations.Hence she is in need of USD 550 to increase the size of the stock.

loans.use: Adding stock

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en: Ephraim is married with six children.She lives in Vituka area of Dae es Salaam.Ephraim owns and runs a refleshment Center located near her residence.He is a retired Civil servant,the business is a sole income generating unit for the family.He opened this center from the retirement benefits accrued to him for his service in the public sector.In his center he sells cold drinks,alcoholic drinks and different kinds of snacks.The most popular snack of which people travel a long way to get it is ‘fried pork meat’ locally known as ‘kitimoto’.The demand during x-mass was imaginable.His center is used by the  people of the area as a place to reflesh after working hours.He is in a plan to improve the business by adding enough stock of drinks and more important sitting chairs and tables.He experienced chairs and tables shortages during x-mass.He do not want to lose so many customers as he losed during x-mass due to insufficient chairs.He is in need of USD 1000 to increase the stock of drinks, sitting tables and chairs.

loans.use: Adding stock of drinks,chairs and tables

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with four children.He owns a shop selling cold drinks near his residence.He opened this shop three years ago after being dropped from employment.He was employed with Dar es Salaam Port Authority.Life was tough for him after being dropped.He get an advice from a friend to open a cold drinks shop.Since then he progress well with an exception of poor capital base.He want to improve his business by adding enough stock of Cold drinks.Drinks produced by Coca-cola Company have risen in price recently.Even more capital is needed to have sufficient stock of these drinks.He is in need of USD 550 to meet his expectation.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is married with seven children.He lives with his family at Vituka area of Dae r es Salaam.William keeps cows and pigs in an area he inherited from his father.He keeps these animals in very  old huts he built about twelve years ago.He usually get into conflict with his neighbours when the animals break the huts and eat some grown vegetables.Local authorities knows William for frequent penalties he pays to his neighbours by damages done by his animals.He want to put out with this problem.He need to build strong and big huts to curb the problem.He still have enough land to so.He also in need to improve the business in general by adding to stock medications for animals,milk carriage vessels,bicycles,wheelbarrows and pork storage equipments.He is in need of USD 1000.

loans.use: Purchasing animal feed,medications,add flock of animals.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 45 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Nancy had benefited from Kiva by receiving a loan of USD 300 that enabled her to buy a dairy cow to improve her family income level. Nancy has also been voted in as the new treasurer of Queen Esther women group. The group elected its new official as per the group constitution. Nancy is one of the strong members in the group. Before the closure of the year, the group approved a loan of USD 300 for Nancy to enable her pay her son’s secondary school fees. The son is sitting for the final secondary school exam in 2007 and repayment of the school fees will enable him to concentrate in his studies without interruptions. The child is a bright student and Nancy wants to give him all the necessary support to enable him perform well. Nancy will repay his loan from the proceeds she gets from her farming activities. Nancy is aware of the group rules and regulations on repayments of all the loans given to the members. She will abide by the rules.

loans.use: Nancy would like to pay Secondary School Fees

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with grown up children. She is a strong Christian and a member of ACK Church in Mihuti. She is a member of Mathioya Womens Group. She is a farmer and grows tea, coffee and rears a dairy cow. Jane has benefitted from her group. She gets small loans from her group that has enabled her to improve the management of her livestock business. She is able to buy animal feed and get modern veterinary services for her cow. She generates most of her income from milk sales. Jane has applied a loan of USD 150 that will enable her to buy shares from Kenya Reinsurance Company. The shares will be floated on the market in January 2007. The group has approved the purchase of the shares through their new rule passed in their December 2006 meeting. Jane will repay the money in 12 monthly installments.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en:
Béatrice G. was born in Tsévié in 1977. She is a baker and sells bread by the main intersection in town. She is the mother of two children. Her husband repairs tires and makes very little money for covering household expenses, now that business is very slow. So, Béatrice shares in covering all their expenses. Lacking the money to start an independent business, she works for a third party who exploits her. However, with her 8th grade education, she does well. A very dynamic and honest woman, Mrs. G. demonstrates a certain business mastery and plans to set up her own business to augment her income. She is also requesting a loan of $1,200 to construct a traditional kind of oven and to acquire the materials necessary to get her bakery set up. And so she will be able to earn enough money to help improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Béatrice est née à Tsévié en 1977. Elle est boulangère et vend du pain au carrefour de la ville. Elle est mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, un vulcanisateur qui dispose de peu de moyens pour subvenir à tous les besoins du foyer en ces moments précis où les affaires marchent très peu. Ainsi, Béatrice partage dans les charges du foyer avec son mari. N’ayant pas de moyens pour s’installer à son propre compte, elle travaille pour une tierce personne qui l’exploite. Avec son niveau de la classe de 4ème, elle arrive à bien gérer les affaires. Très dynamique et honnête, Madame G. Béatrice fait preuve de la maîtrise de ses activités et prévoit s’installer en son propre compte pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer ses revenus. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $1200 pour construire un four traditionnel et acquérir tout le matériel nécessaire pour son installation. Ainsi, elle pourra avoir les moyens suffisants pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To build a traditional oven and to acquire bakery equipment.

loans.name: Yayra

texts.en:
Yayra A. was born in Tsévié in 1964. At the Tsévié marketplace, she sells condiments, canned foods, sugar, salt, oil, and other goods. She is married to a taxi driver and is the mother of three children. Her husband lost the use of his right foot as a result of a traffic accident, so she must look after him. An energetic women though illiterate, Mrs. A. dealt with this situation and is managing as best she can to provide for the needs of the family. As a good manager, she was able to handle and promptly repay two previous loans, $150 and $350 respectively.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 to strengthen her business and make it profitable. Then, it will grow and bring in more income, so that she may take care of her family better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yayra est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Elle vend au marché de Tsévié les condiments, les boîtes de conserve, du sucre, du sel, de l’huile et autres. Mariée à un chauffeur de taxi, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari à la suite d’un accident de circulation a perdu l’usage de son pied droit, ce qui fait qu’il est resté à la charge de Madame. Analphabète mais dynamique, Madame A. Yayra a su gérer cette situation et arrive à subvenir tant que mal aux besoins de la famille. Bonne gestionnaire, elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser promptement les deux précédents crédits respectifs de $150 et $350.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour renforcer et rentabiliser son affaire. Ce qui lui d’accroître ses affaires et d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To augment her capital

loans.name: Natacha

texts.en:
Natacha P. was born in Havé-Tsévié in 1978. She is married, the mother of two children, and the guardian of her two nieces, who are apprentice seamstresses. She quit the 10th grade after her first child was born. She then started selling colorful, traditional cloths that are most often used as skirts or wraps. With this work, she shares household expenses with her husband, who has no steady salary as a substitute teacher in a local middle school. Her husband is known for an inability to provide for his family despite his good intentions. Natacha has proven herself to be honest and trustworthy throughout her initial loan of $650, which was repaid without a problem.

To enhance her business and to augment her income, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to acquire and sell quality traditional cloths of various kinds that are ready-to-wear. She names her business «Jésus Sauve», or Jesus Saves. The success of her plans will allow her to better ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame P. Natacha est née en 1978 à Havé-Tsévié. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) nièces apprenties couturières qu’elle supporte. Elle a abandonné les études en classe de seconde suite à sa première grossesse et s’est lancée après son accouchement à la vente de tissus pagnes. Avec cette activité, elle partage les charges du foyer avec son mari, un vacataire dans un collège privé de la place aux salaires irréguliers, et a démontré son incapacité notoire à subvenir aux besoins de son foyer malgré sa bonne volonté. Natacha a fait preuve d’une femme honnête et de confiance à travers son premier crédit de $ 650 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident.

Pour accroître ses affaires et augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille, Madame P. Natacha sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1200 qui servira à acheter des pagnes de qualité de diverses catégories et prêts-à-porter pour la commercialisation. La bonne réalisation de projet lui permettra d’assurer au mieux le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling traditional cloths that are ready to wear

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.en:
Abibatou D. was born in Atakpamé in 1972. Her husband is medical assistant assigned to Tsévié, the city where she owns a cafeteria called \"Café d’Or\". She is the mother of three children. Very energetic and friendly, she contributes enormously towards covering household expenses, since what her husband makes is not enough. With her 7th grade education, Mrs. D. runs her business well. As an honest woman with an instinct for overseeing other people’s property, she seems to be trustworthy, having repaid two initial loans without a problem. Her cafeteria would have been more profitable if she had obtained a bigger loan. So, to enhance her business and augment her income, Abibatou is requesting a loan of $750 to outfit her cafeteria and to stock up on cartons of milk, glasses, egg trays, and other cafeteria items. Her plan will certainly help improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un infirmier affecté à Tsévié d’où elle tient une cafétéria, Madame D. Abibatou, née en 1972 à Atakpamé est mère de trois (03) enfants. Dynamique et très sociable, elle participe énormément aux besoins de son foyer car les seuls salaires de son mari ne suffisent pour couvrir toutes les charges de la famille. Avec son niveau de la classe de 5ème, Madame D. gère au mieux ses activités. Honnête et ayant le sens de la bonne gestion du bien d’autrui, elle a donné l’impression d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Ses affaires auraient pu être plus rentable si elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit plus consistant. Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Abibatou sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va servir à aménager sa cafétéria et s’approvisionner en cartons de lait, des tasses, de plateaux d’œufs, et d’autres éléments qui entrent dans le domaine de cafétéria. Avec ce projet, elle pourra, d’une certaine manière, contribuer au mieux à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To outfit and supply her cafeteria with necessities

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. was born in Tsévié in 1980. Lacking money, she had to quit school in the 10th grade. She then learned upholstery as a trade, that is, making drapes, cushions, and other furnishings. This is her current craft. She is married but without children. Nevertheless, she is the guardian of her mother’s orphaned niece. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. But without a car, he currently drives a moped.
