An energetic woman, Mrs. A. is an excellent upholsterer with a good command of her craft, but she lacks the funds for growing her business and augmenting her income. She has to help with the household expenses, since her husband’s income falls far short of covering them all. For this reason, Dzifa is requesting a loan of $850 to buy the basic materials for her work. She will then be able to help improve the daily life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Dzifa est née en 1980 à Tsévié. Par manque de moyens, elle a dû abandonner ses études en deuxième degré. Elle s’est formée alors à la tapisserie, métier qu’elle exerce actuellement. Elle est mariée, mais n’a pas encore d’enfant. Néanmoins, elle a à sa charge une nièce orpheline de mère. Son mari chauffeur de profession fait actuellement Zémidjan (taxi-moto) à défaut de voiture. Dynamique, Madame A. Dzifa est une excellente tapissière qui maîtrise bien sa profession, mais manque de moyens pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus afin de contribuer au besoins du foyer car les revenus du marie sont très insuffisants pour couvrir toutes les charges y afférentes. Pour ce faire, Dzifa sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter les matières premières dans le cadre de son métier. Ce faisant, elle pourra alors contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie quotidienne de la famille.

loans.use: To buy the basic materials for her work

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Véronique A. was born in Tsévié in 1976. She finished middle school in Aného before returning to her hometown. No longer able to continue her education due to a lack of support, she trained as a seamstress. But with her instinct for business, she soon started buying and selling colorful traditional cloths between Togo and Côte d’Ivoire. Although the crisis in Côte d’Ivoire ended her business, she adroitly made use of the situation to start up her dressmaking shop again, which she calls «Dieu Est Grand», or God Is Great. Mrs. A. is the second wife of her husband, a medical assistant. Her husband is polygamous, irresponsible, and hardly bothers with the family. So everything rests on her shoulders.

Mrs. A. would like to add to her dressmaking business to boost her income. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to buy a sewing machine, some traditional cloths, and boutique materials. The success of her plans will clearly augment her income and allow her to improve the living conditions for her two children and her little sister.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1976 à Tsévié, Madame A. Véronique a fait ses études primaires et secondaires à Aného avant de revenir dans sa ville natale. Ne pouvant plus continuer les études par manque de support, elle s’est formée en couture. Mais, ayant le goût du commerce, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce des pagnes entre le Togo et la Côte d’Ivoire. Avec la crise ivoirienne, ses affaires ne marchent plus et très ingénieuse, elle a profité de ce temps pour reprendre son atelier de couture. Elle est la seconde épouse d’un infirmier polygame irresponsable qui ne s’occupe guère de la famille et tout repose sur Véronique.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Véronique veut associer le commerce à la couture pour renforcer ses revenus. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour acheter une machine à coudre, des pagnes et les articles de mercerie. Il est évident que la réalisation de projet augmentera les revenus de Mme A. Véronique pour lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de ses deux enfants et sa jeune sœur.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, some traditional fabrics, and boutique materials

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine A. was born in Tsévié in 1968. She did not do very well in school, so she quickly switched to selling cooked rice. She has already repaid a loan of $150. She is married and the mother of two children. An honest and devoted woman, Mrs. A. provides nearly everything for her family, since her husband’s income is not enough to cover their family needs. To enhance her business, she is requesting a loan of $850 which will allow her to open a pub featuring traditional dishes on the menu. She will then be able to augment her income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tsévié, Madame A. Madeleine n’a pas fait de brillantes études. Elle s’est vite convertie en revendeuse de riz préparé. Elle a déjà obtenu et remboursé un crédit de $150. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Honnête et dévouée, Madame A. est puisque tout pour la famille, car le salaire de son mari ne suffit pas pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Pour accroître ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir un bar restaurant aux menus traditionnels. Ainsi, donc elle pourra augmenter ses revenus améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To open a pub serving traditional dishes.

loans.name: Anani

texts.en:
Anani M. was born into a humble family in Tsévié in 1975. Despite his fragile health, he went to school and completed the 8th grade. Wanting very much to enter the real world, he learned how to be a tailor, a trade he currently practices. His wife, a colleague, makes baby hope chests. These parents have a child with a malformed leg. His wife is barely able to help with family expenses because she does not have enough customers to sell her goods quickly.

Mr. M. is requesting a loan of $850 as capital to buy two new machines for making different knots and bows and to add boutique items for sale that are unavailable in the area. The success of his plan will clearly allow him to earn a more substantial income in order to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur M. Anani est né en 1975 à Tsévié dans une famille modeste. Malgré sa santé fragile, il a fait les études jusqu’en classe de 4ème. Voulant très vite entrer dans la vie active, il a appris la couture, métier qu’il exerce actuellement. Marié à une collègue de trousseaux bébés, ils ont un enfant victime d’une malformation au niveau d’un membre inférieur. Sa femme l’aide à peine dans les dépenses familiales car elle ne dispose pas assez de clients pour l’écoulement rapide de sa production.

Monsieur M. Anani sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’acquérir deux nouvelles machines pouvant faire des différents nœuds et y associer les vents des articles de mercerie qui manquent dans le quartier. Il est évident qu’avec ce nouveau projet, Anani pour dégager des revenus plus consistants pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for making different knots and bows and to add boutique items for sale

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Ami G. was born in Tsévié in 1970. She went to school and earned her middle school diploma (BEPC). Lacking the support to continue her education, she had to quit. She then learned to sew, and for five years she has been running her own dressmaking shop, called «Vivre Ensemble», or Live Together, thanks to an initial loan of $350, which she repaid without a problem. She is in a common-law marriage with a plumber who left in search of work in Bénin. That is why Mrs. G. has been alone for 16 months with her 3-year-old daughter. There has been no news of her husband. She courageously deals with household expenses by herself. An adroit and very energetic woman, she puts everything she knows into her work, and she is renowned in her neighborhood for the quality of her services. She would like to include among her goods for sale various fabrics and other boutique items not currently available in her area. This will provide a comprehensive range of goods for her customer base.

To achieve this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to stock and sell traditional skirts, bags, and shoes for women. This new project will grow her business and of course her income, allowing her to take care of her child.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Ami est née en 1970 à Tsévié. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de 3ème sanctionné par le BEPC. Obligée d’abandonner ses études par manque de support, elle apprit alors la couture et depuis cinq (5) ans, elle gère son propre atelier de couture grâce à son premier crédit de $350 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés. Elle vit dans une union de fait avec son mari plombier qui l’a abandonnée pour s’installer au Bénin en quête de travail. C’est ainsi que Madame G. Ami vit seule depuis 16 mois avec sa fille âgée de 3 ans, sans aucune nouvelle du mari. Très courageuse, elle fait face seule aux charges du ménage. Femme ingénieuse et très dynamique, elle met tout son savoir-faire au service de ce travail, et la qualité de ses services fait sa renommée dans son quartier. Elle veut associer la mercerie et la vente de tissus qui manquent dans le quartier et ses environs à la couture pour rendre un service complet à sa clientèle.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour l’achat et la revente de pagnes, sacs et chaussures pour dames. Ce nouveau projet va accroître ses activités et de facto ses revenus lui permettant de s’occuper des besoins de son enfant.

loans.use: To add traditional skirts for sale, plus shoes for women, to her dressmaking shop

loans.name: Kossi Joseph

texts.en:
Kossi Joseph K. was born in Davéli-Tsévié in 1973. The son of peasants, he used to spend all his time with his father in the fields, which prevented him from continuing his education beyond the 5th grade. Benefitting from the support of his village, he was able to learn woodturning. With an initial loan of $550 that he repaid in regular installments, he was able to open his own workshop, which he named «Aimons la Vie», that is, Let’s Love Life. Very energetic and of good conscience, he extended the reach of his business into certain villages near Tsévié. He is married and the father of three children. His wife got training in hairdressing with his help and support. An honest man, Joseph can be trusted, and he has efficiently mastered his business.

Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $1,500 which in part will serve to buy a new machine and to pay for boards. It will also serve to open a hairdressing salon for his wife. The will allow his wife to help with household expenses in order to better ensure the welfare of the entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph est née en 1973 à Davéli-Tsévié. Fils de paysans, il passait tout son temps à accompagner son père au champs ce qui à fait qu’il n’a pas pu continuer ses études au delà du cours primaire. Bénéficiant de l’appui de certains partenaires du village, il a pu apprendre le tournage du bois. Grâce à son premier crédit de $550 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, il a pu ouvrir son propre atelier de travail. Très dynamique et de bonne foi, il a étendu son champ d’action dans certains villages proches de Tsévié. Marié, il est père de trois (03) enfants, il a su aider sa femme à se former à la coiffure. Honnête, Joseph est un homme de confiance qui gère avec efficacité ses affaires qu’il maîtrise assez bien.

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1500 va servir d’une part, à acheter une nouvelle machine et à payer les planches et d’autre part, à ouvrir un salon de coiffure pour sa femme. Ceci va permettre à sa femme de l’aider dans les dépenses du foyer afin de mieux assurer le bien-être de toute la famille.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine and lumber

loans.name: Adzoa Essi

texts.en:
A. Ess T. was born in Tsévié in 1976. Lacking support, she could not continue her schooling beyond primary school. So, she accompanied her mother to the market to sell condiments. After her mother died, she took over managing the business and added smoked and fried fish for sale. To revitalize her business, she had to borrow $300, which she repaid in due course. She is married to a mechanic and has one child. Her husband is only able to help her from time to time with household expenses because he still does not have steady employment.

An energetic woman, Mrs. T. would now like to offer corn and beans for sale, in addition to her smoked fish. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to acquire corn and beans from villages near Tsévié and to continue selling condiment, as well as smoked and fried fish. Thus, she will be able to provide for her family appropriately.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. A. Essi est née en 1976 à Tsévié. Pour manque de support, elle n’a pas pu poursuivre les études après le cours primaire. Elle accompagnait alors sa maman au marché pour la vente des condiments. A la mort de sa mère, elle prend la direction des affaires et y associe la vente des poissons fumés et fris. Pour relancer les activités, elle a du bénéficier d’un crédit de $300 qu’elle a normalement remboursé. Mariée à un mécanicien, elle a un enfant. Son mari l’aide de temps en temps dans les dépenses de la maison car son emploi n’est pas encore stable.

Dynamique, elle veut ajouter à son commerce de poissons fumés, la vente de maïs et de haricot. Pour cela, Madame T. sollicite un crédit de $950 qui va lui permettre d’aller acheter le maïs et le haricot dans les villages proches de Tsévié et de poursuivre la vente des condiments et de poissons fumés et fris. Ainsi donc, pourra-t-elle subvenir convenablement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish and grains.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise T. was born in Binah prefecture in 1965. She was not sent to school because her parents saw no need to educate a girl. At a very young age, she used to accompany them in the fields. At age 8, she was sent to Lomé to serve as a domestic and babysitter. After morning chores, she handled her mistress’ business affairs, which was the basis of her work experience. She finds herself in Tsévié again going from house to house looking for work and saving money in order to learn a trade. Unfortunately, she became pregnant from a scrap metal merchant. That was how her life as a married woman began. Together, they have three children. As the second wife of her husband, she is basically left on her own. Using her savings, she has started selling soap, canned food, lollipops, and other items.

So, Ms. T. is requesting a loan of $750 to lease a shop and to stock up on a fair quantity of canned tomatoes, pastas, soaps... that is, all the basic necessities. She will then be able to augment her income to improve life for herself and for the children left in her care.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Denise est née en 1965 dans la préfecture de la Binah. Elle n’a pas été scolarisée car ses parents n’y voyaient pas l’importance de l’éducation d’une fille. Toute petite, elle les accompagnait au champ. A 8 ans, elle est envoyée à Lomé comme domestique et garde d’enfant. Après les travaux matinaux, elle tenait le petit commerce de la maîtresse de maison d’où son expérience dans le domaine. De maison en maison, elle se retrouve à Tsévié toujours pour chercher du travail, faire des économies pour apprendre un métier. Malheureusement, elle tomba enceinte d’un ferrailleur. Ainsi commence sa vie de femme mariée. Ensemble ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Etant la seconde épouse, elle est plus ou moins laissée à sa propre charge. Avec ses économies, elle a commencé par vendre du savon, des boîtes de conserve, des sucettes et autres.

Madame T. Denise sollicite alors un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre de loyer une boutique et s’approvisionner en quantité raisonnable de tomates en boîtes, spaghettis, savons, bref tous les produits de première nécessité. Elle pourra alors augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants abandonnés à sa charge.

loans.use: To lease a shop and to stock everday necessities to sell

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.en:
Kodzo B. was born in Davié in 1976. There, he went to school until the 7th grade. Thinking himself old enough, he no longer wanted to attend school. Instead, he wished to pursue his dream of making shoes, so he trained as a shoemaker. He currently owns his own shop, called «Viens Voir», or Come and See, where he makes men’s shoes and women’s sandals. He is married and the father of a child. Because of the quality of his work, his customer base is growing to the point where he has trouble meeting the demand due to a lack of funds.

Brimming with the will to succeed, Mr. B. is requesting a loan of $850 to re-outfit his shop and to buy work-related materials. He will then be able to open an outlet in the heart of the city of Tsévié. This loan will allow him to increase his profit margin, which will as a result improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur B. Kodzo est né vers 1976 à Davié où il a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de 5ème. Ne voulant plus poursuivre les études car estimant trop âgé, il désire réaliser son souhait qui est de devenir un grand cordonnier. Il apprit alors le métier de cordonnerie. Actuellement, il a son propre atelier où il fabrique des chaussures pour hommes et tapettes pour femmes. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. De par la qualité de ses prestations, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante qu’il a du mal à servir car il manque de moyens.

Pleine de volonté, il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour réaménager son atelier et acheter du matériel du travail. Il pourra ainsi ouvrir un point de vente des produits au cœur de la ville de Tsévié. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires ce qui aura pour conséquence une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his shop and buy work-related materials.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1970, Akuwa K. is married and the mother of four children. After quitting school, she entered into a sewing apprenticeship. Her husband works in the same field as a tailor. But given the cost of living, people prefer second-hand clothing, and so there is less work for him, and thus he earns less. This situation obliges Ms. K. to commit more income to household expenses than her husband does. An honest and energetic woman, she has several apprentices in her shop, which is called «Main de Dieu», or Hand of God. She needs more machines to ensure that her apprentices are well-trained and to guarantee her shop’s good reputation.

To do this, Ms. K. is requesting a loan of $950 as capital to buy five sewing machines and also work-related materials. She will then be able to help improve the training and work environments for her apprentices, as well as to ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame K. Akuwa est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, elle entre en apprentissage de couture. Son époux est également tailleur. Mais compte tenu du coût de la vie, les hommes préfèrent les friperies ce qui fait qu’il a moins de travail donc gagne moins. Cette situation oblige Madame K. à s’investir plus dans les charges du ménage que son mari. Honnête et dynamique, elle a plusieurs apprenties et a besoin d’augmenter le nombre de machines pour assurer une bonne formation des apprenties et garantir la bonne réputation de son atelier.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à l’achat de 5 machines à coudre et des matériels de travail. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de travail et de formation de ses apprenties et également assurer le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and work materials.

loans.name: Dado

texts.en:
Dado A. was born in Tsévié in 1964. She had to quit school in the 10th grade in order to learn hairdressing. After finishing her training, she did not have the money to open a shop. So she set up a table and became a merchant. An energetic woman with an instinct for management, she was able to handle a $350 loan, which she repaid in due course. Ms. A. is married with three children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to stock up on rice, sugar, and tomatoes. She will then be able to enhance her business, make it profitable, and contribute more towards improving the life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Dado est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Elle a dû abandonné ses études en au niveau secondaire pour apprendre la coiffure. Formation terminée, elle n’a pas eu de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Elle se lança alors dans le petit commerce de table. Dynamique et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, elle a su gérer les $350 de crédit obtenu et régulièrement remboursé. Madame A. Dado est mariée et à trois (03) enfants. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 qui servira à s’approvisionner en riz, sucre et tomate. Elle pourra ainsi accroître et rentabiliser ses activités et contribuer plus à l’amélioration de la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Kokou J. was born in Tsévié in 1960. Coming from a humble family, he had to quit school in the 9th grade due to a lack of support. He had to go abroad to work. There, he was a cook in a restaurant up until he turned to his native land. With his savings, he started his own shop in 1990 selling items such as white rice, oil, cookies, drinks, and so forth. Then, to bolster his business, he made use of a $550 loan, which he repaid without a problem. An efficient man, he has complete mastery of his business. He is both honest and energetic, and he is married to a hairdresser. They have two children in middle school. Kokou’s business could be better developed if he had more loan capital, for he manages money well.

The loan of $1,200 that Mr. J. is currently requesting will serve as capital to stock up on sacks of corn and beans, mineral water, and various other items. It will also serve to open another sales outlet. Thus, he will be able to increase his business and augment his income in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur J. Kokou est né à Tsévié en 1960. Issu d’une famille modeste, il n’a pu terminer ses études de troisième degré par manque de support. Il a dû partir pour l’étranger où il avait servi comme cuisinier dans un restaurant jusqu’à son retour sur la terre natale. Avec son économie, il a initié en 1990 sa propre boutique de vente de produits comme le riz blanc, l’huile, biscuits, boissons et autres, avant de bénéficier d’un crédit de $550 pour renforcer son activité, lequel crédit qu’il a bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Il a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités qu’il gère avec efficacité. Honnête et dynamique, il est marié à une coiffeuse avec qui il a eu deux (02) enfants qui font les études secondaires. Les activités de Kokou pourrait mieux se développer s’il avait bénéficié de fonds de crédit plus consistant car il en a une bonne maîtrise.

Ce crédit de $1200 que Monsieur J. Kokou sollicite aujourd’hui, servira à approvisionner sa boutique de sacs de maïs, de haricot, d’eau minérale et de divers autres produits et à ouvrir un autre point de vente. Ainsi donc, il pourra accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus qui serviront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock his shop with basic food items and to open another sales outlet.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Born in 1985, Kokouvi D. finished middle school in Tsévié before entering an apprenticeship because his parent no longer had the money for more schooling. He currently lives in Kpatéfi, where he manages his uncle’s shop selling general grocery items. He is single with no children, and his socio-economic situation is nothing to envy. Mastering his work and having an instinct for management, he would like to be on his own.

To achieve this, he is requesting a loan of $750 for opening a shop and establishing his own business. The loan will allow him to take care of educating his little brothers and to ensure that things improve, particularly the lives of his elderly parents.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1985, Monsieur D. Kokouvi a fait ses études primaires et secondaires à Tsévié avant d’entrée en apprentissage car les parents n’ont plus de moyens pour lui assurer sa scolarité. Actuellement, il vit à Kpatéfi où il gère une boutique de vente d’alimentation générale d’un oncle. Célibataire sans enfant, sa situation socio économique n’est pas à envier. Maîtrisant ses activités et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, il souhaite aujourd’hui mener ses propres affaires.

A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre d’ouvrir une boutique et s’installer à son propre compte. Ce qui permettre de s’occuper de la formation de ses jeunes frères et d’assurer de l’amélioration des conditions surtout de ses parents en âge avancé.

loans.use: To open his own shop

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette M. was born in 1970 in Davié-Tsévié, where she does business selling cooked rice. She is the fourth of nine children. Her parents did not have enough money to send her to school. In the beginning, she served as a domestic in the city of Lomé. There, she learned the art of cooking. After returning to the city of her birth to take care of her sick mother, she got married to a tailor and became the mother of two children. Her husband, given the current socio-economic situation, has no fixed income for covering household expenses. So, most of these expenses rest on Bernadette’s shoulders. A courageous woman despite all her problems, she has been able to promptly repay an initial $450 loan, which demonstrates her good conscience and honesty. She is brimming with confidence and deserves financial support.

Bernadette is requesting a new loan of $950 stocking up on grains to support her sales of rice thus guarding against repeated shortages. This will allow her to increase her income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame M. Bernadette est née vers 1970 à Davié – Tsévié où elle mène son activité de vente de riz préparé. Quatrième enfant des neuf que compte sa famille, ses parents n’avaient pas assez de moyens pour la scolariser. Elle a d’abord servi comme domestique à Lomé. C’est de là qu’elle tient son art culinaire. Revenue dans sa ville natale pour s’occuper de sa maman malade, elle s’est mariée avec un tailleur et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, compte tenu de sa situation socio économique, n’a pas de revenus fixes pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Ainsi, la plupart des charges du ménage reposent-elles sur Bernadette. Très courageuse et malgré tous ses problèmes, elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son premier crédit de $ 450 obtenus, ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et honnêteté. Elle est pleine de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement

Bernadette sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui va servir à faire d’une part le stockage de céréales et d’autre part à renforcer la vente de riz afin d’éviter des ruptures répétées de stock. Ce qui va lui permettre de d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock grain and sell rice

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Madame M. Bernadette est née vers 1970 à Davié – Tsévié où elle mène son activité de vente de riz préparé. Quatrième enfant des neuf que compte sa famille, ses parents n’avaient pas assez de moyens pour la scolariser. Elle a d’abord servi comme domestique à Lomé. C’est de là qu’elle tient son art culinaire. Revenue dans sa ville natale pour s’occuper de sa maman malade, elle s’est mariée avec un tailleur et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, compte tenu de sa situation socio économique, n’a pas de revenus fixes pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Ainsi, la plupart des charges du ménage reposent-elles sur Bernadette. Très courageuse et malgré tous ses problèmes, elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son premier crédit de $ 450 obtenus, ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et honnêteté. Elle est pleine de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement

Bernadette sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui va servir à faire d’une part le stockage de céréales et d’autre part à renforcer la vente de riz afin d’éviter des ruptures répétées de stock. Ce qui va lui permettre de d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stockage de céréales et vente de riz

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Akou K. was born in Tsévié in 1955. As the daughter of peasants, she did not have the opportunity to go to school, much like the other girls of her generation. From a young age, she has been selling mush throughout the city. She married a laborer and has five children. Everything was going so well when suddenly he died in a traffic accident. Since then, all family expenses have fallen onto her shoulders. To deal with the situation, she got a $350 loan, which she repaid without a problem.

An honest and energetic woman, she has always put into practice the management advice she receives, all to improve her business and make it profitable. To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of $850 to stock up on rice, sugar, and other basic goods. She will then be able to increase her income to improve the living conditions of her orphan children and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Akou est née à Tsévié en 1955. Fille de paysans, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études à l’instar des autres filles de son époque. Depuis son jeune âge, elle vend de la bouillie à travers les quartiers de la ville. Mariée à un ouvrier, elle a eu cinq (05) enfants. Tout allait si bien quand subitement le mari décède à la suite d’un accident de circulation. Depuis ce temps, toutes les dépenses de la famille sont revenues à sa charge. Pour faire face à la situation, elle a obtenu un crédit de $350 qu’elle a déjà remboursé sans difficulté.

Honnête et dynamique, elle a toujours mis en application les conseils en gestion reçus pour améliorer et rentabiliser ses activités. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $ 850 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en riz, sucre et autres produits de première nécessité. Elle pourra augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants orphelins et de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy rice and essential grocery items.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1970, Adjo B. sells cooked rice. She quit school because of work opportunities as a porter in the city of Lomé. After her first child was born, she went from house to house to wash clothes for people. Later, she returned to her hometown. She married a shoemaker, had two children, and now they have three in all. Looking back on her life, she is attempting to go in another direction. As a very energetic woman, she runs her business in all modesty.

Ms. B. is requesting a loan of $650, so that she can sell charcoal, in addition to her sales of mush. She will stock up on wood from surrounding villages. This loan would allow her to bolster her income in order to provide more for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame B. Adjo vend du riz préparé. Elle a abandonné les études au profit du travail de portefait à Lomé. Après la naissance de son premier enfant, elle fait la lessive de maison en maison avant de revenir à Tsévié. Mariée à un cordonnier, elle a eu deux (02) enfants, ce qui porte ses enfants à trois. Prenant conscience de son passé elle essaie de redonner un autre sens à sa vie. Très dynamique, elle gère avec modestie ses affaires.

Madame B. Adjo sollicite un crédit de $650 va lui permettre d’associer à la vente de bouillie, la vente de charbon qu’elle s’approvisionnera de bois villages environnants. Ceci va lui permettre de renforcer son revenu dans le but de subvenir plus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of mush, charcoal.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie B. was born in Lomé in 1960. She is a married mother of two children and also takes care of her uncle’s two children. She is a trained hairdresser but no longer works as one because of the location of the salon. She is now in the business of selling cosmetics and soap (Lagosdi). It is a profitable business that allows her to earn a substantial income. Her husband is a driver who no longer has a car, so Ms. Marie B. is responsible for all of the family’s expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $1000, which will serve as the capital to buy cosmetics and soap. She will thus be able to earn a greater income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Marie est née à Lomé en 1960. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) enfants de son oncle paternel. Coiffeuse de formation, elle n’exerce plus cette activité à cause de la situation géographique de l’atelier. Actuellement, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de la vente des produits cosmétiques et savons (Lagosdi). C’est une activité rentable qui lui procure un revenu substantiel. Son mari est un chauffeur qui n’a plus de voiture. Alors toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame B. Marie.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat des produits cosmétiques et savons. Elle pourra alors dégager des revenus conséquents en vue de l’amélioration des conditions de vie sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and soap

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.en:
Mr. Ayaovi S. was born in 1975 in Tabligbo (Yoto prefecture). He is a young electrician who can no longer work as one because there is not enough demand for that line of work. He has set up a business of selling shirts, which is doing very well and is allowing him to earn a substantial income. He now has so many customers that he can not serve them all because of a lack of capital.

Mr. Ayaovi S. is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow him to buy a supply of different types of shirts, socks and ties. He will thus be able to increase his income and better meet his needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Ayaovi est né en 1975 à Tabligbo (P/Yoto). C’est un jeune électricien bâtiment qui n’exerce plus cette activité à cause de la situation actuelle car il n’a pas assez de client. Il s’est lancé dans le commerce de la vente des chemises, ce qui lui prospère et procure des revenus substantiels. Il a aujourd’hui assez de clientèles qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire à cause de l’insuffisance de son fonds de commerce.

Monsieur S. Ayaovi sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en différents types de chemises, en chaussettes et cravates. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et avoir plus de revenu pour subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Ms. Essi A., 40 years old, has lost three husbands and no longer knows where to turn for help. A mother of three children, she finds herself being crushed by the household expenses, for which she alone is responsible. She is a courageous, dynamic woman who sells charcoal for a living. This business is very prosperous, but she does not have enough money to go herself to buy the charcoal wholesale in production areas, where the prices are lower. Ms. A.’s income has dwindled to next to nothing, and she is no longer able to meet the needs of her family. She fears that, because of a lack of financial means, her children will stop going to school and will become delinquents.

To strengthen and develop her business, Ms. Essi A. is requesting a loan of $950. The loan she is requesting will allow her to order charcoal wholesale from production areas, to transport it, to stock it and to resell it. This will allow Ms. A. to increase her income, to better her family’s living conditions and above all to ensure her children’s education, which is her greatest concern.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Mme A. Essi a perdu successivement 03 maris et ne sait plus à quel saint se vouer aujourd’hui. Mère de 05 enfants, elle se trouve écrasée par les charges de son ménage qu’elle supporte seule. Femme courageuse et dynamique, elle a pour activité le commerce du charbon de bois. Cette activité est très florissante mais elle n’a plus assez de moyens financiers pour aller elle-même s’approvisionner en gros dans les zones productives où les prix sont plus bas. Le revenu de Mme A. est devenu insignifiant et elle n’arrive plus à faire face efficacement aux besoins de la famille. Elle craint fort que ses enfants abandonnent l’école faute de moyens pour devenir des délinquants.

Pour renforcer et accroître ses activités, Mme A. Essi sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $ 950 pour renforcer son commerce. Le crédit demandé va servir à commander en gros du charbon de bois dans les zones productives, à le transporter, le stocker et le revendre. Cela permettra d’améliorer le revenu de Mme A. et donc des conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout assurer l’éducation de ses enfants qui est sa première préoccupation.

loans.use: To buy charcoal wholesale

loans.name: Ami Chantal

texts.en:
Mrs. Ami Chantal M. is a 43 year-old woman who is married with four children. She has shouldered most of the household expenses since her husband lost his job three years ago. She owns a small general grocery store where she sells iced water and food. However, the income is not enough to cover all the family needs, and her children are often sent home from school due to non-payment of school fees. With the situation becoming increasingly worrying, Mrs. M. obtained a loan of $350 which she paid back quickly and without any problem. She manages her business well, and deserves financial support to allow the business to grow.

She is requesting a loan of $900 to fund the buying and reselling of basic food products. This will allow her to increase her income, thus ensuring the well-being of her children and her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme M. Ami Chantal est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle supporte la grande partie des charges du ménage depuis que son mari a perdu son emploi il y a 3 ans. Propriétaire d’une petite boutique d’alimentation générale, elle y vend de l’eau glacée en dehors de l’alimentation. Les revenus étant insuffisants pour couvrir les besoins de la famille, ses enfants sont régulièrement renvoyés de l’école pour non payement des frais de scolarité. La situation devenant de plus en plus alarmante, Mme M. avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit de $350 qu’elle avait promptement remboursé sans incident. Elle fait d’une bonne gestionnaire et mérite d’être financièrement soutenue pour accroître ses activités.

Le crédit de $ 900 qu’elle demande va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits d’alimentation générale. Ce faisant, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus pour assurer le bien-être de ses enfants et de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling of general food products

loans.name: Akouavi Kobéro

texts.en:
Miss Akouavi Kobéro J. is 30 years old and single. As the eldest daughter born into a poor family, she had to leave school very young in order to work and to help out her parents. So she started work in a shop selling pagnes (decorated fabric draped round the waist to form traditional tunics for both men and women) and jewelry. Thanks to this small income she was able to provide for her parents and her four brothers and sisters. After obtaining a loan of $650, Miss J. opened her own shop selling pagnes and jewelry. However, she only has limited means to satisfy the increasing demands of her fast growing clientele. In order to meet these demands, Miss J. is requesting a loan of $1200 which she will use to fund the purchase and resale of pagnes, jewelry and other items. The experience which Miss J. has built up in this field is the key to the success of her project.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 30 ans, Mlle J. Akouavi Kobéro est célibataire. Née d’une famille très pauvre, elle a dû abandonner très tôt l’école en tant que fille aînée pour travailler et venir en aide à ses parents. Ainsi, elle commença à travailler comme employée dans une boutique de vente de pagne et de bijoux et c’est grâce à son petit revenu qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de ses parents et de ses 4 frères et sœurs. Avec le crédit de $ 650 obtenu, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente de pagne et de bijoux. Mais ses moyens sont très limités pour satisfaire les demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite alors un crédit de $ 1200 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des pagnes, des bijoux ainsi que d’autres articles. L’expérience que Mlle J. a acquise dans ce domaine est un atout pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: buying and selling pagnes and jewelry

loans.name: Kossi Mathieu

texts.en:
A master arc welder and licensed electrician, Mr. Kossi Mathieu G., born in 1965 in Dalavé, is married and has four children. After studying in Ghana, where he reached the Senior Second School level, he returned to Togo and continued till the end of the secondary general studies cycle, finishing with the BEPC (conferred after four years of secondary education). Forced to abandon his studies due to lack of support, he then learned about ironwork, electricity, and arc welding. His own personal effort led him to open his workshop, which he manages rigorously. Based on the quality of his services, his work is increasingly sought after, but his means are too limited to respond promptly to his customers’ requests. He therefore asked for a loan of $850 which he managed well and repaid without incident, reinforcing his credibility and increasing his clientele. Today he faces a constantly increasing demand which he is unable to satisfy due to a lack of machines and other materials. The small size of his workshop is also a handicap for the growth of his business.

Thus, to enlarge his business and provide quality service to his clientele and attract more regular customers, Mr. Kossi Mathieu G. is asking for a loan of $2000 to buy a machine and to rent a more spacious location for his workshop. This will surely increase his business and also his income, improving the working conditions of his five (05) apprentices and the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Maître Soudeur à l’arc et Electricien confirmé, Monsieur G. Kossi Mathieu, né en 1965 à Dalavé, est marié et père de quatre enfants. Après ses études au Ghana de niveau Senior Second School, il est revenu au Togo où il a poursuivi ses études jusqu’à terminer le second cycle de l’enseignement général, sanctionné par le BEPC. Obligé d’abandonner ses études par manque de support, il s’est formé alors en ferronnerie, électricité et en soudure à l’arc. Par ses efforts personnels, il ouvrit son atelier qu’il gère avec rigueur. De par la qualité de ses prestations, il est de plus en sollicité mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour répondre promptement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Il sollicita alors un crédit de $850 qu’il avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Ce qui a renforcé sa crédibilité et augmenté sa clientèle. Il fait face aujourd’hui à une demande sans cesse croissante qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire par manque de machines et autres matériels de travail. L’étroitesse de l’atelier est un handicap aussi pour le développement de ses activités.

Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et rendre un service de qualité à sa clientèle pour les fidéliser, Monsieur G. Kossi Mathieu sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour acheter une machine et louer un emplacement plus espacé pour son atelier. Ce qui augmentera à coup sûr ses affaires et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de travail de ses cinq (05) apprentis et le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase a machine and to rent a more spacious location for his workshop

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en:
A dynamic young man born on September 3 in Badou, Mr. Agbéko A. is an upholsterer in training. After being forced to abandon his studies despite his wishes due to lack of support, he learned about upholstering with the help of his older sister. Today he is a confirmed master upholsterer and has many orders which he is unable to satisfy due to a lack of means, since he does not have the necessary materials. This worries him greatly because his older sister has also lost her job and is unemployed. Very dynamic but also level-headed, he is a serious man with a bright future, given the right support. This is proven by the $200 he asked for and obtained to satisfy a client, a loan which was reimbursed immediately after one month of work. Based on this experience, Mr. Agbéko A. today is asking for a loan of $1500 in order to be able to open his workshop and set it up. This loan will serve to rent shop space and to buy a machine and other work materials. Helping this young man would be a good example to empower others who spend their lives on the streets.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune très dynamique né le 03 septembre à Badou, le Monsieur A. Agbéko est tapissier de formation. Après s’est obligé d’abandonner ses études par manque de support malgré sa bonne volonté, il s’est formé en tapisserie avec l’aide de sa grande sœur. Il est aujourd’hui, un maître tapissier confirmé et a beaucoup de commandes qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire par manque de moyens car il n’a pas les matériels nécessaires. Ce qui lui donne beaucoup de soucis car sa grande sœur a aussi perdu son emploi et se trouve en chômage. Très dynamique mais aussi très calme, il a l’air un homme sérieux et plein d’avenir si l’on le soutient. La preuve en est des $200 sollicités et obtenus pour satisfaire un client, lequel crédit a été remboursé aussitôt le travail livré en un mois.

Fort de cette expérience, Monsieur A. Agbéko sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1500 afin de pouvoir ouvrir son atelier et s’installer. Ce crédit servira à louer magasin et à acheter une machine et autres matériels de travail. Aider ce jeune serait un bel exemple pour les autres qui traînent dans les rues pour leur entière auto prise en charge.

loans.use: To rent a shop and to buy material to open an upholstery workshop

loans.name: Akoua

texts.en:
Mrs. Akoua B. was born on March 3, 1977 in Badou. She is married and has three children. Not having had the chance to continue her secondary education, she engaged in trading small household items. Unfortunately, her husband, a taxi driver, no longer has a car, and his irregular income does not allow him to meet the needs of the household. Thus, more than 80% of the household expenses rest on his wife, who also needs to finance the growth of her business. As a result, misery has settled on this household where, paradoxically, there also reigns a good marital atmosphere. Very courageous and dynamic, she benefitted from a loan of $150 which allowed her to restart her business. Despite this state of extreme poverty, Akou knew how to manage and repay her loan promptly without incident. This increases her credibility and her good faith. Shee deserves to be supported financially once more.

Mrs. Akoua B. is asking today for a loan of $750 to rent a small shop and to develop her business of selling basic consumption goods. Financing this woman means saving the lives of an entire family in distress.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme B. Akoua est née le 03 mars 1977 à Badou. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études Vsecondaires, elle s’est très lancée dans le petit commerce de table. Malheureusement, son mari, un chauffeur de télé taxi, n’a plus de voiture et son revenu irrégulier ne permet pas de subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Ainsi, plus de 80% des charges du ménage reposent-t-elles alors sur la femme qui dispose aussi de peu de moyens financiers pour faire développer son commerce. Ainsi, s’installe la misère dans ce foyer où paradoxalement y règne une bonne ambiance de vie de couple. Très courageuse et dynamique, elle bénéficia un crédit de $150 qui lui a permis de relancer ses activités. Malgré cet état d’extrême pauvreté, Akoua a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son crédit sans incident. Ce qui augmente sa crédibilité et sa bonne foi. Elle mérite confiance pour être encore soutenue financièrement.

Mme B. Akoua sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $750 pour loyer une petite boutique et développer ses activités de vente des produits de première nécessité. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver la vie de toute une famille en détresse.

loans.use: To rent a store to sell basic consumption goods

loans.name: Siakou

texts.en:
Mr. Siakou L. is a renowned mechanic in the N’kafu area where he opened his workshop. Approximately 38 years old, Siakou is married and has three children. Very calm and having mastered his business, Siakou and his four apprentices are highly sought after because of the quality of their work and the warm welcome they give to their customers. Very rigorous in adminstrative matters, Siakou has proven himself to be a man of honesty and trust with respect to his three previous loans which were paid back regularly without incident.

To increase and develop his business, Siakou is asking for a loan of $2000 to buy a new machine and some small equipment. This will increase his revenue and his income, which will allow him to ensure the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur L. Siakou est un vulgarisateur de renom dans le quartier N’kafu où il a ouvert son atelier. Agé de 38 ans environs, Siakou est marié et père de trois enfants. Très calme et maîtrisant très bien ses activités, Siakou avec ses quatre apprentis est très sollicité à cause de la qualité de ses prestations et de l’accueil très chaleureux qu’il réserve à sa clientèle. Très rigoureux en matière de gestion, il a fait preuve d’un homme d’honnêteté et de confiance à travers ses trois crédits déjà obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident.

Pour accroître et développer ses activités, Siakou sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour acheter une nouvelle machine et de petit outillage. Ce qui augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus qui lui permettront d’assurer le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and some small tools/equipment

loans.name: Teast First

texts.en: T. descreeasdasd

loans.use: test use test again

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tO EXPAND HER FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Kilijkhan

texts.en:
Kilijkhan has his own grocery store. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Shusha. 
This 56-year-old Kilijkhan with his family settled in Salyan region Yenikend village. He has 4 children. He has been engaged in this business for 4 years. 
He needs a loan amount of $700 o expand the area of his grocery store.

loans.use: to expand  his business

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
You can see in the picure the man, who is very optimistic about he future of his business. 
This man is 29, single. He is hard worker. He tsarted  to busy with this business 7 years ago. He is  Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Zangilan. He settled in Salyan region Yenikand village. 
Zaur requests this loan to buil the barber\'s shop. He wans to bring about his desire.

loans.use: To built the barber\'s shop

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman was born in 1978 in Jabrail region. He is single,   Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Salyan region Yenikand village. He wants to buy the manufactured goods (light): cooking batteries, clothes. He started this business 3 years ago.

loans.use: To buy the manufactured goods (light)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en: Mahabbat lives with her 3 children in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is a very kind and hard-working person. She has been engaged in this business or 17 years. This 56-year-old woman applies for the loan amount $800 to buy 2 milch cow

loans.use: to buy 2 milch cow

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad borrowed the loan amount two time. For the first time he borrowed the $600 and built the grocery store. The second time he borrowed $800 and bought the foodstuffs: rice, flour and etc. 
Now he needs the loan $1000 to expand the area of his grocery store to increase the products. He has been engaged in this business for 5 year.
He and his family lives in Salyan region Kardilli village. He is 33, has 2 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his business and to buy the foodstuffs: rice, flour and etc.

loans.name: Natik

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1981 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He likes the animals. He started his business 2 years ago. Natik wants to expand his business. 
He applies for the loan amount $800 to buy 3 cattle. He is very opimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 cattle

loans.name: Shohrat

texts.en:
This single man is 26, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Salyan region Yenikand village. In 2004 he decided to start his business, but he didn’t have enough money and didn’t have a shop. 
Having borrowed the loan $400 rom the Komak Credit Union he built the shop and  bought the foodstuffs.
Now he needs the loan amoun of $600 to buy the foodstuffs: sugar, tea, granulated sugar, vermicelli and etc.

loans.use: To buy the foodstuffs: sugar, tea, granulated sugar and etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his dressmaking business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business of selling new clothes.

loans.name: Sudjayat

texts.en:
Sudjayat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Seyidli village. She settled with her 3 children in Absheron region Binagadi shosse.
This 53-year-old widow Sudjayat started her business 8 years ago. She cooks the taste national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal, dovga and etc.
 In the beginning of her business she did not have enough money. In spite of her difficulties she did not leave her business. She decided to borrow the loan amount of $1000 to buy the equipments for cafe, which has been rented by her. This business allows her to support to her family. 
Now she applies for the loan amount of $1000 to buy this cafe. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repayingthe loan back. She is very optimistic about the future of her business.

loans.use: To buy the cafe,which has been rented by her

loans.name: Allahverdy

texts.en:
Allahverdy has been engaged in this business since 2003. Before he rented this tea-house. Having borrowed the loan amount of $400he bought tea-pots, chairs, tables and this tea-house. He has a lot of clients. His tea-house is a small and he wants to expand the area of his place. All in Absheron region talk about the taste of his tea. Clients have rest over a traditional cup of refreshingAzerbaijani tea in his tea-house. His tea help to people to forget about their problems.
Now he needs the loan amount of $1000 to expand the area of his tea-house. 
He supports to his family with this business. 
He is 52, married, has 3 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Etyemezli village. He settled with his family in Absheron region.

loans.use: To expand the area of his tea-house

loans.name: Djahid

texts.en:
Djahid has not his own shop. It is a problem for him. Komak Credit Union help to him to start his business. He borrowed the loans 2 time. For the first time he borrowed the loan of $400 to buy the lorry, 1 accumulator, 4 wheels. For the second time he borrowed $600 to paint and repair his lorry.
Now he needs $1200 to built his own shop in order to sell the building materials. He started this business 12 years ago.
Djahid is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Seyidli village. He and his family settled in the building of Sevindj kindergarten in Khirdalan settlement. 
He is 39, married, has 3 children. 
Djahid is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To build the shop

loans.name: Nadjaf

texts.en:
Nadjaf has his own alehouse. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region Kosalar village. He and his 6 children settled in Khirdalan settlement. 
Having borrowed the loan $400 he bought the beer equipment. You can see this equipment in the picture. He has been engaged in pub business since 2004. 
Now he plans to buy the utensils, in order to cook our traditional dishes and to sell this dishes.
He applies for a loan of $1000 to bring about his wishes.

loans.use: To buy the utensils

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
This 29-year-old young man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region Kilindjli village. He temporary lives with his family in Khirdalan settlement. He borrowed the loan of $500 and bought the building materials.
Now he needs $1000 to buy the lorry. He has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He is very kind, friendly and hard-working person.

loans.use: To buy the lorry

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina deals in frozen foods, meat and fish. She sells to a large group of people but has little storage facilities and therefore is not able to buy large quantities to sell. She is seeking a loan of $1100.00 from Kiva to expand her business. She is competent and capable of paying back the loan.

loans.use: Justina wants to expand the working capital for her business.

loans.name: Sayavush

texts.en:
Sayavush is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He likes to busy with this business. 
Having borrowed the loan of $400 he bought the welding apparat. He started his business 4 years ago.
This 46-year-old Sayavush is married, has 4 children,   Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region Nadjafli village, settled with his family in Khirdalan settlement.
He has not the welding shop. He has been engaged in this business  in his own yard .
He always is  enjoying to busy with this business.

loans.use: To build the welding shop

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is 37, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Djabrail region Soltanli village. He and his wife, who is pregnant settled in Khirdalan settlement. He has his own car. He has been engaged in this business for 6 years. In the beginning in his business, he borrowed $200 and bought 2 wheels and 1 accumulator. 
The second borrowed loan of $400 he spent to buy the spare parts. 
For the third time he borrowed the loan amount of $800 to paint his own car.
Now he needs the loan amount of $1500 to buy the minibus, in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy the minibus

loans.name: Grace Abaya

texts.en: Aunty Grace sells general goods like tins of milk, milo, fish, soaps, soft drinks and the like. Her market is very vibrant in that she sells to a large group of people. She however needs capital for expansion. She is therefore seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to make this expansion a reality. She is very capable of paying it back since she has knowledge of simple accounting and loan management.

loans.use: Grace would like to expand her current business.

loans.name: Hetem

texts.en:
Hetem has been selling the sand for 2 years. He is 36, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region He and his family temporary live in in Khirdalan settlement Kushchulug massiv.
Having borrowed the loan amount of $400 he bought 1 car sand and started his business.
Now he needs the loan of $1000 to increase the variety of the  building materials.
He wants to begin selling of the cement.

loans.use: To increase the variety of selling building materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris O. is a very hardworking lady who is willing to work but lacks starting capital. She lives in a small community called Dodowa in the Dangme West District of Ghana.  She sells shoes, sandals, slippers and so on from house to house. She wishes to have a permanent shop where she can buy goods in large quantities for sale. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to make this wish a reality.

loans.use: Doris is seeking to expand her shoe business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia started to make and sell food to her neighbouts two years ago, as she needed to increase her family\\\'s income, since her husband did not earn much money in his job and they are supporting two of three of their children with school costs. She n eeds a loan of $475 to buy ingredients that will permit her to meet the demand during this time of year, and in this manner incrase her income. She plans on repaying th eloan in a period of 6 to 12 months.

You can help Partricia assure the completion of her children\\\'s studies, and become part of the successes of their family. Support them; they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia hace dos años comenzó a elaborar y vender comida a sus vecinos, pues necesitaba aumentar los ingresos familiares, ya que su esposo no gana mucho en su empleó y ellos están apoyando a dos de sus tres hijos con los gastos de la escuela. Ella necesita de un crédito de $475 DLLS para poder comprar más insumos que le permitan cumplir con toda la demanda que esta época del año tiene, y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos. Ella planea cubrir el total del préstamo en un periodo de 6 a 12 meses.

Tu puedes apoyar a Patricia a asegurar la culminación de los estudios de sus hijos, hazte parte de los logros de su familia, apóyalos ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
This 53-year-old Mahir has been selling the building materials for 5 years. He is married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region Djamilli village. He and his family temporary live in in Khirdalan settlement. He supports  to his family with this business
Having borrowed the loan amount of $400 he bought 4 wheels for his own lorry.
Now he needs the loan of $800 to capital repairs of his own lorry.

loans.use: To capital repairshis own lorry

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, lives Miss Araceli, mother of three children. Her husband is employed in a company and she saw that they needed extra income to be able to pay for all their current expenses, for which it has been three years since she decided to start a small business. She dedicated herself to bargain sales. Her love of her family and her engaging spirit have made the realization of Araceli\\\'s project possible.

To be able to continue with her business, she requires a loan in the amount of $475 to be able to vary the merchandise to be able to expand her business and help her family as she has been doing to date. Your generosity can help Araceli, support her, the decision is in your hands. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, vive Doña Araceli, madre de tres hijos. Su esposo es empleado en una empresa y ella veía que requerían de ingresos extras para poder hacer frente a todos lo gastos presentes, por lo que hace tres años decidió emprender un nuevo pequeño negocio. Comenzó a dedicarse a las ventas al por menor. El amor por su familia y su espíritu emprendedor es lo que ha hecho posible la realización del proyecto de Araceli.

Para poder continuar con su empresa, ella, requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 DLLS y así poder surtir la mercancía que necesita para crecer más y poder ayudar a su familia como hasta el momento. Tu generosidad puede ayudar Araceli, apóyala, la decisión ésta en tus manos, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Norma

texts.en:
In Escobedo, Neuvo Leon, lives Miss Maria and her family, husband and two children. Their house is very small and they face economic problems frequently, since her husband is a labourer and his work is occasional so his income is not secure. Following this difficult situation, Miss Maria thought to help her family live in better conditions and enjoy a better financial stability. And since then, almost three years, she started to make a sell food from her home.

The genuine duty to her family and the will to come out on top motivated Miss Maria to find a solution to their problems. But now she requires a loan to continue, for the amount of $250, the same will be repaid in a 3-6 month term. You can help ensure the well-being of this family, they need you. With your support they will be achieve a better life and conquer their adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Escobedo, Nuevo León, viven Doña María y su familia, esposo y dos hijos. Su casa es muy pequeña y enfrentan frecuentemente problemas económicos, pues su marido es Albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por lo que los ingresos no seguros. Tras ésta difícil situación Doña María, pensó en ayudar a su familia a tener mejores condiciones de vida y una mayor estabilidad financiera, y entonces cuando, hace ya casi 3 años comenzó a elaborar y vender comidas en su propio domicilio.

El autentico compromiso con su familia y las ganas de salir adelante impulsaron a Doña María a encontrar una solución a sus problemas, pero ahora ella requiere de un préstamo para continuar, por la cantidad de 250 DLLS, mismo que será cubierto en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Tú puedes asegurar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan, con tu apoyo lograran vivir mejor y vencer las adversidades.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Responsibility, strenght and proactiveness are the characteristics that define Guadalupe, that is married and is mother of two children, still minors. Her husband holds a casual job, for which the income is never stable in their home. It is for this difficult situation that for Guadalupe started to sell shoes by catalogue, already four years ago, and this way help have a little more income to cover the costs of the education for her little ones. But to be able to meet the strong demands she has during this season, she requires a loan of $250, of which she plans to repay in a term of 3 months.

Her primary concern is to secure the well-being and education of her little ones, it is this why she now needs your support, become part of the successes of Guadalupe and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza y proactividad, son características que definen a Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de dos hijos aun menores de edad. Su esposo posee un trabajo eventual, por lo que lo ingresos nunca son seguros en su hogar. Es por esta difícil situación por la que Guadalupe, hace ya 4 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y así poder tener un poco más de ingresos para poder hacer frente a los gastos de educación de sus pequeños. Pero para poder cubrir el fuerte pedido que tiene en ésta temporada, ella requiere de un préstamo de 250 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses.

Su principal preocupación es asegurar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños, es por ello que ahora necesita de tu ayuda, se parte de los logros Guadalupe y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Djahan

texts.en:
Djahan has her own shop. She is 32, married, has not children. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Kosalar village. 
Djahan and her husband settled in Khirdalan settlement
She borrowed the loan of $400 and bought the light industrial wares.
Djahan has been engaged in this business for 2 years.
Now she needs the loan of $1000 to begin selling clothing.

loans.use: To begin selling clothing

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a lady who despite her age does not feel tired with her work. Mama O., as she is called by all, sells agricultural produce at the market.  She sells items such as fresh palm fruits and pepper in tins. There are increasing demands from her customers daily. To satisfy her customers demands, she is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva in order to buy more goods and sell them in bags.

loans.use: Mama Okoe would like to expand her produce sales.

loans.name: María Barbarita

texts.en:
Maria Barbarita is mother of two little ones of 6 and 8 years and lives with her husband in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Facing the lack of financial resources to satisfy the basic necessities of her family, she searched for 3 years for something that would permit her to help her husband and bring her children a dignified quality of life. This is how she began to sell cosmetics by catalogue.

Now she needs a loan of $250 to keep supporting her family and give her kids an education. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a 3-6 month term. Help Maria Barbarita and her fmaily. They need your support now - they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Barbarita es madre de 2 pequeñitos de 6 y 8 años y vive con su esposo en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Ante la falta de recursos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, ella buscó desde hace 3 años una actividad que le permitiera poder ayudar a su esposo y brindarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna. Es así como comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de 250 DLLS para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a María Barbarita y su familia, ellos ahora necesitan de tu apoyo, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her printing business.

loans.name: Brenda Rene

texts.en:
Brenda is 34 years old and lives in the city of Escobedo, Neuvo Leon, with her son and husband. Eight years ago she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, with the objective of helping her husband with the heavy house-hold expenses and with the school payments for their son. Without this business they would hardly cover the basic necessities. It is for this that Brenda has struggled for day after day to maintain what she has built with so much effort with the support of her loved ones.

But to be able to continue she requires a loan in the amount of $250, which will be used for the purchase of merchandise and in this manner be able to increase her sales. Don\'t leave Brenda alone now that she needs your support and generosity. The decision is in your hands, you only need to make your decision. Help her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda tiene 34 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, con su hijo y esposo. Hace ocho años que ella comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo con los pesados gastos del hogar y con los pagos de la escuela de su hijo. Sin ésta actividad ellos difícilmente podrían cubrir las necesidades básicas. Es por eso que Brenda ha luchado día a día para mantener lo que con tanto esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus seres queridos ha construido.

Pero para poder continuar ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar mercancía y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas. No dejes sola a Brenda hoy que necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, la decisión en tus manos sólo hace falta que te decidas. Apóyala

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.en:
Brenda lives in the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon in a small room of her husband\'s parent\'s house, that is currently working in a different city. She depends totally on her husband, but nevertheless her husband\'s job is not stable, he is a driver and his salary depends on the number of trips available in the week. For this reason Brenda started to sell cosmetics by catalogue two years ago, to secure the well-being of her family. Her dream is to build a small house where they will be able to live, her husband her their future children.

She needs a loan of $200 to be able to purchase more merchandise and increease her sales. Help Brenda build her dream, don\'t leave her alone in this struggle. You have the power to help, she will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda vive en la localidad de Escobedo, en estado de Nuevo León en un pequeño cuartito de la casa de los padres de su esposo, quien se encuentra trabajando en otra localidad. Ella depende totalmente de su esposo, sin embargo el empleo de su esposo no es fijo, pues es chofer y su salario depende del número de viajes que haya en la semana. Por esta razón Brenda comenzó hace dos años a vender cosméticos por catálogo para asegurar el bienestar de su familia. Su principal ilusión en poder construir una pequeña casita en la que puedan vivir ella, su esposo y sus futuros hijos.

Ella necesita de un préstamo de $200 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas. Ayuda a Brenda a construir su sueño, no la dejes sola en esta lucha, tú tienes el poder de colaborar, ella te lo va agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is the owner of Adom Ventures and she trades in general goods. She is very hardworking and eager to expand her operations. She however lacks the needed capital and is therefore seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva. She is honest and can pay it back. Her dream is to own a supermarket.

loans.use: Elizabth needs working capital to invest in her store.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is 25 years old, is married and is mother of two little ones of 7 and 3 years of age. Her husband is in the sales of cold meats, but in this business he sees a variable and occassional income. It is why two years ago Mariana decided to start selling cosmetics by catalogue and in this way help her husband with the house hold expenses and secure the daily sustenance for her little ones. This struggle has not been an easy one, but the love and dedication of her family she has been motivated to continue one and not give up against obstacles.

She requires a loan of $200 to buy merchandise and increase her earnings and secure the well-being of her family. Help support what Brenda has built with so much effort. Make your decision and help her. She and her family need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos pequeños de 7 y 3 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carnes frías, pero con esta actividad percibe ingresos muy variables y eventuales. Es por eso que hace 2 años Mariana se decidió a comenzar a vender cosméticos por catálogo y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y asegurar el sustento diario de sus pequeños. La lucha no ha sido fácil, sin embargo el amor y compromiso con su familia la han impulsado y a continuar y no detenerse frente a las dificultades.

Ella requiere de un crédito de $200 DLLS para comprar mercancía y poder así aumentar sus ingresos y asegurar el bienestar de su familia. Ayuda a sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo Brenda ha construido, decídete y apóyala, ella y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.en:
Sandra and her husband have had to work very hard to be able to give only what is necessary to their three children. They live in the city of Escobedo in the state of Nuevo Leon. But it has been two years since she was left unemployed and started to look for another job, but it was long before she could find one. With desparation in not having enough to cover all the expenses, she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, and in this manner be able to help her husband and cover the basic necessities for their children.

The love of her family carried Sandra to find a business that would permit her to have some extra income, but now she needs a loan of $200 to continue with her project, of which she will repay in a term of 3-6 months. Help Sandra maintain what she has achieved so far. Don\'t hesitate and help her. She needs your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra y su esposo han tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder dar solo lo necesario a sus 3 hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Sin embargo hace 2 años ella se quedó sin empleo y comenzó a buscar otro, pero tardo mucho tiempo sin encontrarlo. Ante la desesperación de no tener lo suficiente para hacer frente a los gastos, ella comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, y de esta forma poder ayudar a su esposo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.

El amor a su familia llevó a Sandra a encontrar una actividad que le permitiera tener algunos ingresos extras, pero ahora ella necesita un préstamo de $200 dólares para continuar con su proyecto, mismo que planea regresar en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a Sandra a sostener lo que hasta ahora ha logrado, no lo dudes y apóyala, ella requiere de tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.en:
Five years ago Miss Maria started to sell shoes by catalogue, when she faced a lack of resources for the expensive education of her children, that are 16, 12, and 6 years of age, for her husband\'s salary was not enough to cover all of the house hold expenses. An engaging spirit and responsibility are the characteristics that define Miss Maria, and thanks to these she has been able to come out on top and fight for the well-being and future of her family, essentially, her children.

She now requires a loan of $250 to be able to cover her costs and pay off some outstanding accounts, planning to repay the full amount of the loan in a period of 3-6 months. Help Miss Maria build her ultimate dream, see the completion of her children\'s studies. You can help them, don\'t doubt it. With your hlep and your generosity you will be able to help secure a better quality of life for this family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.
