Hace 5 años Doña María comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, ante la falta de recursos para costera la educación de sus hijos, quienes tiene 16, 12 y 6 años de edad, pues con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Espíritu emprendedor y responsabilidad son características que definen a Doña María y que gracias a ellas ha podido salir adelante y luchar por el bienestar y futuro de su familia, esencialmente de sus hijos.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene y así incrementar sus ingresos y pagar algunas facturas pendientes, planeando cubrir el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a Doña María a construir su máximo sueño, ver culminados los estudios de sus hijos. Tú puedes ayudarlos, no lo dudes más. Con tu apoyo y generosidad podrás ayudar a asegurar una mejor calidad de vida para esta familia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ecolastica

texts.en:
Ecolastica has a young son and is married, lives in a small house in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Eight years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue, this with the hopes of helping her husband with the house hold expenses, seeing as his salary was not enough. Since then she has worked very hard day after day to continue with her business and keep support her family. Her will power and the love of her children is what motivated Ecolastica to realize what she has till now.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $200, which will be used to purchase merchandise to maintain and increase her earnings, also to pay off some outstanding accounts. With your generosity you can help Ecolastica and her family. Your help will keep them ahead, don\'t doubt it, they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ecolastica tiene un hijo pequeño y es casada, vive en una pequeña casita en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Hace 8 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, esto con la finalidad de ayudara su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pues son el salario que el percibe no es suficiente. Desde ese entonces ella ha luchado muy duro día a día para continuar con su actividad y seguir apoyando a su familia. La fuerza de voluntad y el amor a sus hijos es lo que ha movido a Ecolastica a realizar lo que ha hecho hasta el momento.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares, misma que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para sostener e incrementar sus ingresos, además de pagar algunas facturas que tiene pendientes por pagar. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Ecolastica y a su familia, con tu ayuda ellos podrán seguir adelante, no lo dudes, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Maame Gladys, as she is affectionately called, is a fashion designer. She owns a shop and has lots of customers who patronize her already-made clothes. She sews both ladies and gents wear. She does not have enough machines to enable her to produce on as large a scale as she desire. She wishes to apply for a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to buy more machines. She is a very promising lady and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is mother of four children, 17, 11, 9 and 2 years of age, is married and lives in a small house in the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon. Their needs have significantly increased with the cost of the education of their children and her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover the costs comfortably. This is why 5 years ago Benita started to make ladies\' shoes, a business that has permitted her to put her family and husband ahead. Now she requires a loan of $250, as she is going through some economic problems and is the only way to be able to maintain what she has built with so much effort.

She plans to repay the full amont of the said loan in a term of 3-6 months. Things have not been easy for Benita and her family and with much effort they have earned what they have. Now the well being and education of their children is in jeopardy. You can help them materialize Benita\'s dream of seeing her children finish their studies, that is the only inheritance she can give them. You can help them, don\'t doubt it. They will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Benita es madre de 4 hijos de 17, 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, es casada y vive en una pequeña casita de la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Las necesidades han aumentado mucho con lo gastos de la educación de sus hijos y con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir satisfactoriamente. Es por todo ello que hace 5 años Benita comenzó a fabricar zapatos para dama, con esta actividad ella ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ayudar a su esposo. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 DLLS, pues atraviesa por algunos problemas económicos y es la única manera de poder sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha construido.

Ella planea cubrir el monto total de dicho préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Las cosas no han sido nada fáciles para Benita y su familia y con mucho esfuerzo han logrado lo que tienen. Ahora su bienestar y la educación de sus hijos esta en peligro. Tú puedes ayudar a cristalizar los sueños de Benita, ver a sus hijos culminar sus estudios, que es la única herencia que les puede dejar. Tú puedes ayudarlos, no lo dudes, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia lives in the community of Escobedo, in the province of Nuevo Leon. Some years ago she went through a difficult divorce. Six years ago, the last of her single chidlren was married and she was left alone without any support, with only whatever her children can sometimes offer to giver her. Following this worry she started to sell clothing, and this way be able to secure her daily sustenance. Things have not been at all easy for Elia, she has had to overcome many obstacles that life has bestowed on her, but thanks to her great character and her unquestionable integrity she has been able to keep going.

She now needs your help. She requires a loan of $925 to be able to complete the orders placed, and this way support herself. Elia plans to repay the full amont of the loan in a 6-12 month term. You can help her, don\'t leave her alone. She will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elia vive en la comunidad de Escobedo, en el Estado de Nuevo León, ella hace algunos años vivió un difícil divorcio. Hace seis años el último de sus hijos solteros se casó y ella se quedo sola y sin ningún seguro, solo lo que eventualmente sus hijos pueden darle. Tras esta preocupación ella comenzó a vender ropa, y así poder asegurar su sustento diario. Las cosas no han sido nada fáciles para Elia, ha tenido que vencer muchos obstáculos que la vida le ha impuesto, pero gracias ha su gran carácter y a su indudable entereza ella ha logrados seguir adelante.

Ella ahora necesita de tu apoyo, pues requiere de un préstamo de $925 dólares para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene, y así poder mantenerse sola. Elia planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes apoyarla, no la dejes sola, ella te lo agradecerá por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
When he noticed the necessities faced by his family due to the lack of a steady and insufficient income, one year ago, Roberto, with the hlep of a his brother, that works in the same trade, started to make and sell leather products, such as wallets, keychains, mug holders etc. This is in the city of Escobedo, in the State of Neuvo Leon. With this business Roberta has been able to secure daily sustenance for his family and provides them with the education required by his children.

He now needs a loan to be able to continue with his business, in the amount of $275 and with this will purschase the equipment to produce his own products. Roberto and his family need you. Help them; they will be grateful. You only need to make your decision.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Al darse cuenta de las necesidades que enfrentaba su familia tras la falta de ingresos seguros y suficientes, hace un año, Roberto, con la ayuda y capacitación de su hermano, quien se dedica a lo mismo, inició la fabricación y venta de productos de piel como; carteras, llaveros, porta tarros, etc. Esto en la localidad de Escobedo, en el Estado de Nuevo León. Con ésta actividad Roberto ha logrado asegurar el sustento diario de su familia y brindarles la educación que requieren sus hijos.

El ahora necesita de un crédito para poder continuar con su negocio, por la cantidad de $275 DLLS y con esto comprar quipo con lo que elabora sus propios productos. Roberto y su familia te necesitan, apóyalos, ellos te lo agradecen, solo hace falta que te decidas.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.en:
Maria Lorena is mother of 4 children, all stil under age. Her husband is a labourer and he works casually, only when people need him, as he has not been able to find a steady job with some construction company that will assure his income. Following this difficult situation she, four years ago, started to sell used clothing, with her only goal is to provide her children with what they need to live and not have to depend solely on the casual income of Mr. Roman. The love of her children and her devoted duty to her husband have motivated Maria Lorena to realize this project and with the support of her own she has maintained it to date.

However, she now requires a loan of $475 to be able to purchase loads of clothing to incrase her sales. You have the option to help her. With your generosity you can help Maria Lorena\'s children have a better quality of life an a better future, following the completion of their studies. Make your decision and help them. They thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Lorena es Madre de 4 hijos, todos aun menores de edad. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja eventualmente, sólo cuando la gente lo requiere, pues no ha logrado encontrar un empleo seguro en alguna constructora que le asegure su ingreso. Ante esta situación ella hace cuatro años comenzó a vender ropa usada, con único propósito de brindar a sus hijos lo necesario para vivir y no depender únicamente del sueldo eventual de Don Román. El amor por sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo ha motivado a María Lorena a realizar éste proyecto y con el apoyo de los suyos lo ha mantenido hasta el momento.

Sin embargo, ella ahora esta requiriendo un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar pacas de ropa e incrementar así sus ventas. Tú tienes la opción de ayudarla, con tu generosidad puedes hacer que los hijos de María Lorena tengan una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro, tras la culminación de sus estudios. Decídete y apóyalos, ellos de lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Maame Gladys, as she is affectionately called, is a fashion designer. She owns a shop and has lots of customers but not enough machines to enable her to produce on as large a scale as she desires. She sews both ladies and gents wear. She is therefore seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to be able to buy more machines for production. She is a very promising lady and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: Gladys wants to buy more sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
The need for an extra income was what pushed Hermelinda to start selling shoes by catalogue, seeing as her husband does not have a good income. Her primary concern is to be able to provide her 3 children with the education they require to be able to have a future with dignified quality of life. It has already been two years since she started her project, and thanks to the unconditional support of her own and the love of her family, she has been able to continue until now.

Hermelinda now requires a loan of $475 that will be used to purchase merchandise that her clients have asked for, as she does not have the needed capital to increase her selection. She plans to repay the full amount of her loan in a term of 5 – 10 months. Don’t doubt it and decide to help Hermelinda to continue moving forward and help her dream become reality, to provide her children with the education they need. They will thank you forever.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La necesidad de ingresos extras, fue lo que impulso a Hermelinda a iniciar a vender zapatos por catálogo, ya que su esposo no tiene un buen ingreso. Su principal preocupación es poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos la educación que requieren para poder tener un futuro con una calidad de vida digna. Ya son dos años de que ella comenzó con este proyecto, y gracias al apoyo incondicional de los suyos y al amor a su familia ha logrado continuar hasta el momento.

Hermelinda en este momento requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, mismo que utilizará para la compra de mercancía que sus clientes le solicitan, pues ella no posee el capital para surtir. Ella planea cubrir el monto total de su préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses. No lo dudes y decídete a apoyar a Hermelinda a seguir adelante y poder hacer realidad la ilusión de brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. Ellos te lo van a agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is mother of three children, two of which are married and the youngest one is currently studying a professional career. Her husband works as a taxi driver, for which his income is very variable. For this reason two years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue. Her primary goal is to see her son finish his university studies, it is for him that she has fought so hard to continue this project. Without this business she would have no resources to cover the cost of their son’s education.

To realize her dream, Felipa requires a loan of $475 that will be put towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales, but more importantly to be able to pay off some outstanding accounts, for if she does not pay them she will not be able to go on. You have the power to help her and contribute to the training of their children. Make your decision – they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y el más pequeño se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional. Su esposo trabaja en un taxi, por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y eventuales, por esta razón hace 2 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo. Su principal objetivo es que su hijo culmine sus estudios universitarios, es por ello que ha luchado muchísimo para continuar con este proyecto, pues sin esta actividad no tendrían los recursos para costear la educación de su hijo.

Para poder cristalizar su sueño, Felipa requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares, mismo que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, pero más importante aún para poder pagar unas facturas que tiene pendientes, pues si no las cubre ya no podrá continuar. Tú tienes el poder de ayudarla y contribuir a la formación de sus hijos, decídete, ellos te lo agradecen

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a woman of superior strength and with an engaging and proactive spirit. Despite all of the difficult moments she had to go through, she never stopped moving forward. It has not been at all easy, but she has made it. Some years ago her husband passed away and she was left alone with one of their children, while the others were already married. Following this situation she looked for a business that would generate the necessary earnings for the daily sustenance of her children and herself and no longer have to depend on the occasional help provided by her other children.

It has already been six years since Maria Cristina started to sell foods she herself made in her home. Now she requires a loan of $250 to be able to buy ingredients needed to make her products and therefore increase her earnings and be able to continue on with her daily struggle. The time has come for you to make your decision to help her. The decision is in your hands, you now only need to make your decision.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Cristina es una mujer con mucha fortaleza y con un espíritu emprendedor y proactivo, pues a pesar de los difíciles momentos por los que ha tenido que atravesar, nunca se ha dejado vencer y a seguido adelante, no ha sido nada fácil, pero lo ha logrado. Hace algunos años su esposo falleció y ella se quedó sola con uno de sus hijos, los demás ya estaban casados, ante esta situación ella buscó una actividad que le generará los ingresos necesarios para el sustento diario de ella y sus hijos y no depender de la eventual ayuda que le proporcionaban sus otros hijos.

Ya son 6 años desde que María Cristina inició con la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora en su propia casa. Ahora ella requiere de un crédito de $250 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos y así incrementar sus ingresos y poder continuar en la lucha diaria. Es momento de que te decidas apoyarla, la decisión esta en tus manos, sólo hace falta que te decidas.

loans.use: purchase mercandise

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe has since some time ago started to make and sell hamburgers in her home, which is located in city of Escobedo, in the province of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. The unconditional support from her husband is what has made possible for Maria Guadalupe to keep going after 5 years of running her project, that she then started to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and an education as a base for their future well-being.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to keep up her business, this amount she plans on repaying in a term of 3 to 6 months, and will be used towards the purchase of ingredients and utensils she needs to make the foods she sells. Help Maria Guadalupe and her family. They need you, don’t hesitate any longer. .

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe hace tiempo que comenzó a elaborar y vender hamburguesas en sus domicilio, mismo que se encuentra en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, todo se encuentran estudiando actualmente. El apoyo incondicional para con su esposo, es lo que ha hecho posible que María Guadalupe después de 5 años continúe con el proyecto que en ese entonces inició para poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y la educación que será la base de su bienestar futuro.

Ella ahora necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para así poder seguir con su negocio, esta cantidad la planea regresar en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, y la destinará para la compra de insumos e utensilios que requiere para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Apoya a María Guadalupe y su familia, ellos te necesitan, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: purchase merchanise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Miss Maria del Rosario lives with her husband and four children in the community of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. Her husband is a labourer and he earns very little, for which is not enough to cover all of their expenses. Three years ago she, through a friend, learned that she would be able to earn an extra income through the sale of cosmetics through catalogue. Thanks to this business she and her family has been able to come through and without this business they would not have been able to afford their childrens’ education. Miss Maria del Rosario requires a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to keep up the business and pay for a large shipment and, in this manner, have the merchandise available for her clients.

You can help her and her family. Become part of their efforts. Miss Maria del Rosario has worked hard with the love she has for her family. The decision is in your hands, your generosity would be a great help for them. Make your decision, they will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María del Rosario vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en la comunidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Su marido es obrero y gana muy poco, por lo que no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos. Hace 3 años ella, por medio de una amiga, se enteró que podía ganar algunos ingresos extras por medio de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado, junto con el apoyo de su familia, salir adelante, ya que sin esto no podrían costear los estudios de sus hijos. Doña María del Rosario requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder continuar y pagar un pedido grande y de ésta forma tener mercancía en existencia para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Tú puedes apoyarla a ella y su familia y ser parte importante de sus logros. Doña María del Rosario ha luchado mucho por el amor que le tiene a su familia. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda para ellos, decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer sinceramente

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.en:
Miss Conchita lives with her four children in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. She is married but her husband left them and left her destitute with her little ones, something that has not been at all easy for her. Nevertheless the great love she has for her family and the sense of responsibility have made Miss Conchita rise and move forward. Resulting form all of this, four years ago she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, with the ultimate goal of giving her children what they need to live and provide them with the education they require.

Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to fill the orders she has received and therefore provide her children with what they need. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can help her during these times. She and her little ones need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Conchita vive con sus cuatro hijos en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, ella es casada pero se su marido de fue de la casa y la dejó desamparad con sus pequeños, esto no ha sido nada fácil para ella, sin embargo el gran amor que le tiene a su familia y la responsabilidad han hecho que Doña Conchita se levanté y siga adelante. Es por todo esto que hace 4 años que comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, con la finalidad de dar a sus hijos que necesitan para vivir y brindarles la educación que requieren.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene actualmente y así poder brindarles a sus hijos lo que necesitan, ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes apoyarla en estos momentos, ella y sus pequeños te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.en:
Cesar lives with his wife and their little one in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. Unfortunately two years ago he suffered an accident and now he finds himself unable to do heavy labour or anything requiring great physical effort. This is why he found himself in need to find some business that would permit him to keep providing sustenance for his family, and this is how he started a small grocery store. The situation has not been easy for him, for what he had to go through, but now with the great support of his loved ones he continues to struggle day after day.

Now Cesar needs a loan to be able to add variety to his small store and provide for his family. He needs $200, you have the ability to help, don’t leave him alone during this difficult time. Make your decision and help him. He will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar, vive con su esposa y con su pequeño en la localidad de Monclova Coahuila. Desafortunadamente hace 2 años él sufrió un accidente y ahora se encuentra imposibilitado para laborar en trabajos pesados o que requieren de mucho esfuerzo, es por eso que se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitiera poder llevar el sustento su familia, así es como inició con un pequeño puesto de abarrotes. No ha sido fácil para él la situación por la que ha tenido que pasar, pero con el gran a poyo de sus seres queridos el continua luchando día a día.

Ahora César requiere un préstamo para poder surtir su pequeña tienda y mantener a su familia, él necesita 200 DLLS, tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlo, no lo dejes sólo en estos difíciles momentos, decídete y apóyalo, el te lo agradecederá por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Flor Jisela

texts.en:
Flor is married and has 4 chidren, her other half works in a company but his salary is not enough for the expenses. They live in a small room in her mother’s house. Some time ago they started to build a house of their own, but they have not been able to finish it because they ran out of money. For this reason 2 years ago Flor started to sell shoes by catalogue and this way be able to finish building their house.

She now needs a loan of $250 to be able to fill her clients’ orders and increase her earnings. She will repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 3 – 6 months. You can help make Flor’s dream a reality, that is to see her house built so that her children can enjoy a better quality of life. The decision is in your hands. Make your decision and become part of the realization of their dream.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su pareja trabaja en una empresa, pero su sueldo no es suficiente para los gastos, ellos viven en un pequeño cuartito en casa de su madre. Hace tiempo que comenzaron a construir su pequeña casita, pero no han podido terminarla, por falta de dinero, es por eso que hace 2 años Flor comenzó a vender calzado por catálogo y así poder terminar de construir.

Ella ahora necesita de un préstamo de 250 DLLS para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes e incrementar su ingreso, cubriendo el monto del mismo en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Tu puedes ayudar a hacer realidad el sueño de Flor, que es ver terminada la casa para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. La decisión esta en tus manos, decídete y vuélvete parte de la realización de sus sueño.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives in the city of Monclova, here in the state of Coahuila, she is married but is separated from her husband for some time now. She had a job to support herself through this situation, but some time later she found herself unemployed, and, desparate, she looked for a business that would generate the income that she needed. Now it has been one year since she sells used clothing in her community.

To be able to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales, she requires a loan of $200, and she plans to repay it in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can be a part of Maria Guadalupe’s continued project. You only need to make a decision, do not leave her alone – she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe vive en la localidad de Monclova, ene estado de Coahuila, es casada pero se separó de su esposo hace algún tiempo, ella buscó un trabajo para poder sostenerse tras esta situación, sin embargo tiempo después se quedó sin empleo y desesperada buscó una actividad que le generará los ingresos que requería, por ello ahora hace 1 año que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su comunidad.

Para poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas, ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 DLLS, planeando cubrirlo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes ser parte de la continuación del proyecto de María Guadalupe, sólo hace falta que te decidas, no la dejes sola , ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Responsibility, strength and integrity are the qualities that define Veronica. She is a mother of 4 children and they live in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. Many years ago she faced a difficult divorce, but she, with the love of her children, moved forward. She never received any support from her ex-husband, which is why it has been 11 years since she started to sell cosmetics and this way ensure sustenance for her children.

It has not been easy, but she has made it. Now requires a loan of $475 to pay off an outstanding account to keep on with her project. You can help Verornica continue, she and her children are grateful for your generosity.

Tranlsated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza y entereza, son cualidades que definen a Verónica, madre de 4 hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Monclova Coahuila. Hace muchos años enfrentó un difícil divorcio, pero ella, por el amor a sus hijos siguió adelante. Nunca ha recibido el apoyo de su ex pareja, por lo que hace 11 años comenzó a vender cosméticos y así asegurar el sustento de sus hijos.

No ha sido fácil, pero lo ha logrado, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder cubrir una factura que tiene pendiente y poder seguir con su proyecto. Tu puedes ayudar a Verónica a continuar, tu generosidad la agradecen ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena divorced her husband one year ago, and she and her children were left completely desperate and he never helped with the expenses. Facing this difficult and worrisome situation she started making and selling desserts and candy, with her only goal to cover the basic necessities for her children and continue supporting their studies. Struggling alone for her family has not been an easy mission, but her great integrity has carried her through.

She needs your help, and she needs a loan of $250 to purchase ingredients to meet a strong demand she is currently seeing. Help Lorena provide a better quality of life and an education for her children. Think how difficult it has been for her to face adversity. Please help her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena hace un año se divorció de su esposo, y ella y sus 3 hijos quedaron totalmente desamparados, pues él nunca les ayuda con los gastos. Ante esta difícil y preocupante situación ella comenzó a elaborar y vender repostería y dulces, esto con el único objetivo cubrir la necesidades básicas de su hijos y seguir apoyándoles con su estudios. Luchar sola por su familia no ha sido una misión fácil, pero su gran entereza la ha acompañado.

Ella necesita de tu apoyo, pues requiere de un préstamo de $250 dólares, para poder comprar insumos y hacer frente aun fuerte pedido que actualmente tiene, ayuda a Lorena ha brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos. Piensa en lo difícil que ha sido vender las adversidades para ella y por favor apóyala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a small store she has owned for over 5 years. She sells a little bit of everything. Prior to opening her store she used to work with her late husband selling seafood. They worked together for about 8 years until one night he was killed in a robbery attempt. Although this was very tough for Ana, she had to continue to make income to support her 3 kids. She worked selling various items door-to-door until a family member from Spain gave her a $1000 loan to get her store up and running. She now needs to continue investing in her store in order to make her business successful. She plans on investing in beef, poultry, eggs and other foods to sell from her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in meats and other foods for her market

loans.name: Luisana

texts.en:
Luisana lives in the city of Monclova, Coahuila, she is single and she has a little of five years of age. She has had to struggle alone with her daughter, as the father has never given them any kind of help. It is why she started selling shoes by catalogue, and in this manner obtain an income to be able to take care of her. She now requires a loan of $100 that she plans to cover in a term of 3 to 6 months. With this amount she will be able to pay off an outstanding account so that she will be able to purchase more merchandise to maintain and increase her earnings.

Luisana\'s little girl will start preschool and it will increase their necessities. The only thing missing now is for you to make your decision. They will be forever grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisana vive en la localidad de Monclova Coahuila, es soltera y tiene una pequeñita de cinco años de edad, ella ha tenido que luchar sola con su hija, pues el padre nunca le ha dado ningún tipo de ayuda. Es por eso que comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y de ésta manera obtener ingresos para mantener a su niña y al mismo tiempo poder cuidarla. Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $100 DLLS que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Con esta cantidad ella podrá pagar una factura que tiene pendiente y comparar más mercancía para tener en existencia e incrementar sus ganancias.

La niña de Luisana va a empezar su educación preescolar, por lo que ahora las necesidades aumentan, ayúdalas ellas te necesitas, solo hace falta que te decidas, ellas te estarán por siempre agradecidas

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, natural medicines and other vitamins. She learned to be a saleswoman from her parents who are also in the same line of works. She is in need of a loan in order to invest in products. She is especially interested in diversifying her line of natural medicines because her clients are satisfied with the results and they have become very popular items. Maria is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter is married but still lives with Maria at home. Maria has been separated from her husband for 5 years and she has had to play the role of mother and father to her 2 younger children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in natural medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria Esther is mother of three children of 8, 17 and 16 years of age, she is married and lives in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. Her husband\'s salary was not enough to cover all the house hold costs, which is why they decided to start a small grocery store some years ago. Maria Esther\'s most important dream is to see her children\'s studies completed and she knows that the only way to do this is through the business they now have.

But to be able to continue with this project and realize their dream, she needs a loan of $200 that she plans on repaying in a term of 3 to 6 months. You have the ability to help them, you only need to decide. They will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Esther es madre de 3 hijos de 8, 17 y 16 años de edad, es casada y vive en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. El salario de su esposo son les alcanzaba a cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que decidieron poner una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes hace algunos años. La principal ilusión de María Esther es ver culminados los estudios de sus hijos y sabe que la única manera de lograrlo es con el negocio que ahora tienen.

Pero para poder continuar con este proyecto y hacer realidad su sueño requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, mismos que planea cubrir en un periodo de 3 a 6 meses. Tu tienes la opción de ayudarlos, solo hace falta que te decidas, vuélvete parte de sus logros, ellos te lo agradecederán por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Berta Alicia is 44 years old and she lives alone in a small house in the city of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. She has always worked to support herself, day after day, but four years ago she was let go from the company where she worked for many years. Given the desperation to find an income for sustenance and daily necessities, Berta started a new project: the sale of foods she makes hersel fin her own home.

She has had to struggle for everything that she has, and things have not been easy. Now she requires a loan of $250 to be able to keep supporting herself. You can help her, you only need to make your decision. Become part of her efforts, she thanks you for it sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta Alicia tiene 44 años y vive sola en una pequeña casita de la localidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Ella siempre ha trabajado para mantenerse día a día, sin embargo hace cuatro años que fue despedida de la empresa en la que laboró por muchos años. Ante la desesperación de con contar con ingreso alguno para el sustento y necesidades diarias, Berta comenzó con un nuevo proyecto, la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora en su domicilio y mantequilla.

Ella ha tenido que luchar mucho para lograr lo que tiene, las cosas no han sido fáciles. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de 250 dólares para poder seguir manteniéndose sola. Tu puedes apoyarla, solo hace falta que te decidas a hacerlo, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis and his wife sell clothing. They have set up a part of their home as a store for their clients to come and visit. During the day, Luis travels to the rural sector of Ecuador in his truck offering his products in the small towns. While he is away, his wife sells the clothing from her home. Luis started selling clothes after losing a job he held in a large company for about 15 years. He bought his a used truck and started investing all of his savings. He now needs the loan because he wants to buy shoes for men and women. HE is 65 years old and has had 2 children with his wife.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in men and women\\\'s shoes

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.en:
Juanita lived through a difficult divorce some years ago, and she was left pennyless with three children, still underage, whom she needed to support on her own. She could not find a job so she started a business, the sale of used clothing. In this manner she was able to obtain the income to cover the necessities of her children and at the same time care for them while working out of her home.

It has not been easy to struggle on her own to put kids first. She now needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase merchandise and increase her earnings. You can contribute and help secure the well being of Juanita and her children. You only need to make your decision and help them. Remember that they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita hace algunos años que vivió un difícil divorcio, y quedó desamparada con tres hijos, aún menores de edad, a quienes tenía que sacar adelante ella sola, por lo que tenía que comenzara trabajar, pero no encontró trabajó, así que inició una actividad, la venta de ropa usada. De está forma logró obtener los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo poder cuidarlos al laborar en su propio domicilio.

Luchar sola para salir adelante con sus hijos no ha sido una tarea fácil, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos. Tu puedes contribuir a asegurar el bienestar de Juanita y sus hijos, sólo hace falta que te decidas y los apoyes, recuerda que ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz is a chicken monger who buys poultry wholesale and distributes to the local markets. When he moved to Guayaquil as a young boy he had to work in the streets in order to help his family survive. He has worked as a shoe shiner and a street vendor of many items including candy and fish. He now owns this business that allows him to make a much more stable income. He is requesting the loan because he wants to invest in larger quantities of chicken so he may offer his products to more stores. He is very optimistic about the future for him and his 3 children. His main goal is to improve his home which is made out of bamboo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more chicken\'s for his business

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old and she lives with her three children of 3, 7 and 11 years of age. She is single and does not receive any economic support from the father of her children. She has always struggled alone for the wellfare of her little ones and her love for them is what has permitted her to always continue forward, although it has not been at all easy. For all of this she some time ago started selling comforters by catalogue and this way afford the schooling of her children and provide them with necessities to live with dignity.

But now she requires a loan of $550 to be able to meet fill the orders placed and pay off outstanding accounts, and this way increase her earnings. Do not leave Claudia and her family alone. They need you. You only have to decide and show them your great generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia tiene 30 años de edad y vive con sus tres hijos de 3,7 y 11 años de edad, es soltera y no recibe apoyo económico por parte del padre de sus hijos. Ella siempre ha luchado sola por el bienestar de sus pequeños y el amor a ellos es lo que le ha permitido continuar siempre hacia delante, aunque no ha sido nada fácil. Por todo lo anterior ella hace algún tiempo comenzó a vender edredones por catálogo y así poder costear el estudio de sus hijos y darles lo necesario para vivir dignamente.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $550 dólares, para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene y pagar las facturas pendientes, incrementando así sus ingresos. No dejes solos a Claudia y su familia, ellos te necesitan, solo tienes que decidirte y mostrar tu gran generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Mister Porforio lives in the city of Monclova, CoahuiL. with his wife and their two children of 18 and 19 years, whom he helps with their university studies. He took an electrician course some years ago, and he worked for a company for many years in this occupation. But some years ago he was let go, which is when he started to work for himself, that was the only way to give his wife and their children the necessities of life. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy equipment he needs to keep on going, he plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a 6 to 12 month term.

Mister Porforio\'s dream is to see his children\'s studies compelted so that they can have a better future, it is the only inheritance he can give them. Become a fundamental part of the realization of his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Porfirio vive en L. localidad D. Monclova, CoahuiL., con su esposa y sus dos hijos D. 18 y 19 años, a quienes apoya con sus estudios universitarios. Él estudió un curso D. electricidad hace algunos años, y durante mucho tiempo laboró para una empresa desempeñando su oficio. Sin embargo hace algunos años fue despedido, por lo que comenzó a trabajar por su cuenta, pues era L. única forma D. darles a su mujer y a sus hijos lo necesario para vivir. Ahora necesita D. un préstamo D. $475 DLLS para comprar equipo que requiere para continuar, planeando cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo D. 6 a 12 meses.

El principal sueño D. Don Porfirio es ver culminados los estudios D. sus hijos, para que ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro, es L. única herencia que el les pueD. dejar. Vuélvete parte fundamental D. L. realización D. su sueño. Decídete y apóyalos.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.en:
Karina Elizabeth lives with her husband in Monclova, Coahuila. They have just become a family and they have many expenses, but with many sacrifices they were able to acquire a small house that they are still paying for. Karina when she saw her husband working so much and still was not able to meet all the payments, she decided to start selling products through catalogue. The love and devotion to her husband have allowed her to continue with her project. But now she needs a loanof $250 to be able to fill her orders and this way manage to increase her sales.

It is time that you help Karina to reach her dream of having a proper house and have a roof over the head of their future children. The decision is in your hands, you can help them. She will be sincerely grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina Elizabeth vive con su esposo en Monclova, Coahuila. Ellos acaban de formar una familia, y enfrentan muchos gastos, pues con muchos esfuerzos adquirieron una pequeña casita que aún están pagando. Karina al ver que se marido trabajaba mucho y aun así no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos lo pagos, decidió ayudarlo y comenzó, hace un año a vender productos por catálogo. El amor y fiel compromiso con su pareja, han logrado que ella continué con su proyecto. Pero hora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que enfrenta y de ésta manera lograr incrementar sus ventas.

Es momento de que ayudes a Karina a lograr el sueño de tener una casita propia y así poder asegurar un techo para sus futuros hijos. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu puedes ayudarlos, ella te lo agradecedará sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Miss Herlinda is a divorced woman since some time ago, and lives alone in the city of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. She has five married chidlren, that help her finanically whenever they can, but nothing is ever steady. For this reason she looked for a business to secure an income to live dayd to day and not have to depend on anyone. She started 5 years ago to sell and make wood furniture. She now needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months approximately.

The loan is destined to buy wood for the furniture, and this way cover her costs and secure a stable income. She needs you, do not leave her alone. She will be sincerely grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Herlinda es una mujer divorciada desde hace algún tiempo, vive sola en la localidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Tiene cinco hijos los cuales están casados, quienes cuando pueden le apoyan económicamente, pero nunca es nada seguro. Es por esto que ella buscó una actividad de le asegurara ingresos para vivir día y día y no depender de nadie. Comenzó hace 5 años a vender y producir muebles de madera. Ella necesita ahora de un crédito de $250 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses aproximadamente.

El destino del crédito es comprar madera para los muebles, y así poder cubrir los gastos que tiene y asegurar un ingreso estable. Ella te necesita, no la dejes sola, ella te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Honest and hard working are the characteristics that clearly define Miss Julia. It has been 10 years since she has been divorced, and she was left destitute with her still very young children. But she alone was able to raise them with a small business she started during this difficult time, the sales of flour tortillas. Some time ago she was forced to leave the place where she had established her sales counter because the people no longer allowed her to stay, which was the beginning of a series of difficulties. Nevertheless she was able to re-establish herself in her own home and she continues on with her business that has allowed her to provide her family with all they need.

She now needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase ingredients and necessary utensils to increase her productinos and increase her earnings. Miss Julia needs your generosity and your help. Do not abandon her and help her keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Honrada y trabajadora, son características que definen claramente a Doña Julia, hace 10 años que es una mujer divorciada y quedó desamparada con sus hijos aún muy pequeños. Pero ella sola pudo sacarlos adelante con un pequeño negocio que inicio en esa época tan complicada, la venta de tortillas de harina. Hace tiempo que tuvo que retiras del lugar donde estableció su puesto, pues las personas ya no le dieron el permiso necesario, por lo que enfrentó una serie de dificultades. Si embargo ahora se estableció en su propia casa y continúa con esta actividad que le ha permitido darle a su familia todo lo necesario.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos e utensilio necesarios para aumentar su producción e incrementar sus ingresos. Doña Julia requiere de tu generosidad y ayuda, no la abandones y apóyala a continuar.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is married and has three small children. Her husband works in a company but his salary is very low and they face many difficulties in covering all of the costs for their childrens\' education, which is why some time ago she started making chorizo sausage to sell to her neighbours. With time Rosa Maria has been able to acquire more steady clients, now she has weekly orders.

She now requires a loan of $200 to be able to increase her roster of clientele by purchasing more ingredients for to make her product. With the great support of her family she has been able to reach her objective. You only need to decide and she and her family will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María es casada y tiene tres hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja en una empresa, pero su sueldo es muy bajo y presentan muchas dificultades para cubrir con los gastos de la educación de los niños, es por ello que hace algún tiempo ella comenzó a elaborar chorizo para luego venderlo a sus vecinos. Con el tiempo Rosa María ha logrado conseguir clientes fijos y seguros, ahora ya tiene pedidos semanales.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares para poder incrementar su cartera de clientes, comprando más insumos para la elaboración de su producto. Con el gran apoyo de su familia ella ha logrado su objetivo, pero tu también puedes apoyarla, solo tienes que decidirte, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa E. M. (age 43) is a teacher by profession, mother of three, who wishes to work selling cosmetics and at the same time working as a hairdresser, creating hairstyles in her home. The money will be invested in remodeling her house to install a beauty salon, and also the purchase of beauty products for resale, which she will use to increase her income and help her children have better preparation for work.

(translated from Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Teresa E. M. (43 años), es maestra de profesión, madre de 3 hijos, que se dedica a vender cosméticos y al mismo tiempo a trabajar como estilista, realizando peinados a domicilio. El dinero lo invertirá en la remodelación de su casa para instalar un salón de belleza y en la compra de productos de belleza para comercializarlos, con lo cual planea incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos a tener una mejor preparación profesional.

loans.use: Usará el dinero para acondicionar una parte de su casa e instalar un salón de belleza, además de comprar productos de belleza para venderlos.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has recently completed her third cosmetology course at the Mifex MERIT Centers. She has learned how to cut hair, do make up and give manicures and pedicures. Now that she has the skills, she is ready to start her own beauty salon with the help of this loan. She will first buy the necessary materials for her manicures and pedicures, which include nail polish, soap and clippers. She is 19 years old but could not start her college studies because of financial restraints. She has been married for 2 years and does not have children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy materials to start her beauty salon

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.en:
Olga Alicia is married and has two children and they live in the city of Monclova in the state of Coahuila. Her husband, Salvador Lozano, is a clerk in a company but he has only recently started his job 6 months ago. He was for some time unemployed because it was very difficult to find a job, and to be able to face this situation with the help of some family they started a small business, an office supplies store. But in order to her to continue with her project, Olga needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales. She will then be able to reinvest her earnings and keep expanding.

Olga\'s primary objective is to secure the daily sustenance and education of her little ones and of course help her husband during these difficult times of economic instability that they are going through. The decision is in your hands and your generosity can contribute to the security of this family. Help them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Alicia es casa y tiene dos hijos, viven en la comunidad de Monclova, ene el estado de Coahuila, su esposo, Salvador Lozano, es obrero en una empresa, pero únicamente tiene 6 meses con el empleo, hace tiempo que estaba desempleado, pues era muy difícil encontrar trabajo y para poder hacer frente a tal situación, con la ayuda de algunos familiares emprendieron un pequeño negocio, una papelería. Pero para continuar con este proyecto, Olga necesita un préstamo de $250 DLLS y así poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas, para poder reinvertir las ganancias y continuar creciendo.

El principal objetivo de Olga es asegura el sustento diario y la educación de sus pequeños y por supuesto ayudar a su esposo en estos momentos difíciles de inestabilidad económica por ellos que traviesan. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu generosidad puede contribuir a la seguridad de ésta familia. Apóyalos.

loans.use: porchase merchandise

loans.name: Hilda Araceli

texts.en:
In a small house in the city of Monclova in the state of Coahuila lives Hilda, her husband, their two children, and her husband\'s mother. She sells her home made foods, a business she started some time ago when her husband found himself without a steady job. He now sells fast food near a well known business. But with this business he was not able to meet all of the heavy expenses of the household, which is why she decided to do something to help her family and secure sustenance for her children that is how the business started.

During this time of year the orders for the food Hilda sells have increased significantly, which is why she requires a good sized capital that she does not have. She requires a loan of $250 to purchase ingredients and necesssary utensils. You can help her, help her family and they will forever be grateful to you. You only now need to decide to show your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En una pequeña casa de la localidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila, viven Hilda, su esposo, sus dos hijos y la madre de su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora, inició con esta empresa desde hace algún tiempo que su esposo se quedo sin empleo estable, y ahora él se dedica a vender frituras en la afueras de una reconocida empresa. Pero con esta actividad no se alcanzaba a cubrir con todos los pesados gastos del hogar, por lo que ella decidió hacer algo para ayudar a su familia y asegurar el sustento de sus hijos y comenzó con ésta actividad.

Por éstas épocas los pedidos de la comida que vende Hilda se incrementan mucho, por lo que ella requiere de una buena cantidad de capital que ella no posee, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de 250 DLLS, para comprar los insumos e utensilios necesarios. Tú puedes apoyarla a ella y a su familia y ellos te estarán por siempre agradecidos. Solo hace falta que tu te decidas a mostrar tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.en:
In the city of Monclova, Coahuila lives Juanita, a married woman and mother of three children. Some time ago her husband had to leave to work some place else, but the money that he was sending them was not always steady. Given this situation she started to make and sell home made foods in her very own community. Despite her husband\'s absence Juanita has been able to make it with the love for her children and her unquestionable integrity. She counts on the unconditional support of her children that actively help her in the business she runs day after day.

They now need you. They require a loan in the amount of $250, to be able to fill all the orders placed and purchase all the ingredients necessary. Help Juanita provide stable sustenance to her children, now that she finds herself alone. You can help her now. Make your decision. She thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Monclova Coahuila vive Juanita, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Hace algún tiempo que su marido tuvo que partir a laborar en otro lugar, pero el dinero que les envía no siempre es seguro, ante esta situación ella se encontraba muy preocupada por la integridad y estudios de sus hijos, es por ello que comenzó a elaborar alimentos y venderlos ahí mismo en la colonia donde vive. A pesar de la ausencia de su esposo, Juanita ha logrado salir adelante por el amor a sus hijos y su indudable entereza. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos, quienes le ayudan activamente en la actividad que realiza día con día.

Ellos ahora te necesitan, pues requieren de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, para poder hacer frente a todo los pedidos que tiene en puerta y comprar todos los insumos necesarios, ayuda a Juanita a brindarle un sustento estable a sus hijos, ya que se encuentra sola. Tú puedes apoyarla ahora, decídete, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martin is married and is father of three children. Some time ago he found himself unemployed and began to look for an alternative way to bring all that was needed for his home. This is how he had the idea to make and sell foods, supplying the local Monclova markets. The will to provide his children with a better quality of life and a future permitted Martin to not give up before such difficulties. And with the unconditional support of his family, that help him run the business, now he continues on with his project.

Nonetheless he now requires a loan of $475 to be able to purchase necessary ingredients to increase his sales. Become part of the efforts of Martin and his family and help them continue on.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es casado y padre de 3 hijos, hace algún tiempo se quedó sin empleo y preocupado comenzó a buscar una alternativa para poder llevar lo necesario a su hogar. Es así como tuvo la idea de dedicarse a la venta y elaboración de alimentos, comerciándoles en los mercados rodantes de la localidad de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila. Las ganas de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y futuro hicieron que Martín no se dejará vencer ante tal dificultad y con el apoyo incondicional de su familia, quienes le ayudan en el negocio, ahora continua con su proyecto.

Sin embargo el ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para incrementar las ventas. Se parte de los logros de Martín y su familia y ayúdalos a continuar.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana runs a small market out of her home where she sells chicken, beef, pork and sausages. She started the business only 6 months ago with the help of her husband who gave her $80 to start off with. She put a sign outside of her home and has been spreading the word within the community. She is now ready to take the next step in her business and begin fixing up her home so it is more attractive to clients. With the loan, she plans on making the lower sector of her house into a store where she can sell other products such as rice and cooking oil.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in her home

loans.name: Ana Belen

texts.en:
Ana Belen started her office supply store two years ago and the business has done well, she has plans in increase the variety of products so that she can offer better service to her clients, satisfy their needs, and increase their number. For this she is requesting a loan of $1500.00 to purchase merchandise, she plans to repay her loan in one year.

(translated from Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ana Belen inicio su negocio de papeleria hace 2 años y el negocio ha marchado bien, ella tine planes de incrementar la variedad de productos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, satisfacer sus requerimientos y poder incrementar el numero de ellos, por lo cual solicita un credito de $1500.00 para la compra de mercancía, ella piensa liquidar su credito en un año.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her grocery store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for business expansion and diversification.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock and buy a new bicycle for Boda boda (carrying passengers)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for tailoring and to add another machine to the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring more variety to her textile stock.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
44-year-old Gurban with his 1 child settled in Sumgait city. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region. Since 1994 Gurban has been engaged in butchery to improve his family’s living condition. In the beginning his business, he borrowed a loan amounting $300 from Normicro. For the second time Gurban borrowed  $500 and significantly expanded his business, bought some calves, achieved progress in his business. The loans were paid back timely.

He applies for a loan amount of $800 to buy 5 calves

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mordern equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock for his shoe sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business and improve his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern frying equipment and rent a room for business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase stock for her used clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her pharmacy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy additional set of simu ya jamii and stock different variety of calling cards.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias has been a salesman for about 40 years. He sells all types of household products from a market where he has had a stand for over 20 years. His son also works in his stand selling chickens and vegetables. They have been able to diversify their product offerings by reinvesting their products into their business. They are requesting this loan because they want to speed up this process and make a large investment that will boost their business. They are interested in purchasing plastic storage containers and kitchen supplies. Elias still has 2 children who live with him and are going to school. He hopes he can pay for them to attain higher educations.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in plastic storage supplies and other items to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime has about 8 years of experience running and owning food markets. Prior to this, he used to be a street vendor, but he decided to switch due to the instability of the work. He started off by only selling vegetables, but now he has diversified his product line to include many different foods and home supplies. He is requesting the loan in order to continue investing in products that keep his clients coming back.

Jaime is 27 years old and has one son who is 6 years old. His wife is expecting a new child in only 2 months, putting pressure on Jaime to generate income for his growing family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products for his store

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren sells encebollado, a popular Ecuadorian dish made with albacore and yucca. He learned to make this while working with a family member who was in the same business. After learning the trade well he decided to start his own operation and bought himself a tricycle cart so that he may sell his product.

Business has gone well for him and his wife who helps him. They hope that with this loan they can buy an additional tricycle cart so that he can hire a family member to sell for him. They have 4 children, all of which are still in school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase fish at wholesale prices and a new tricycle cart

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has owned her store for about 3 years. She opened the business when she returned from abroad where she worked as a housekeeper in order to accumulate capital. Her first business, a phone center, did not work out and she decided to open this store. Luckily, things have been going well, but she is in need of a loan in order to buy products for her store. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband also helps in her business when he cannot find work.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve store inventory

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has about 18 years of experience in the business of retail. Currently she sells all types of beverages including soda and beer. She also has a pool table where local members of the community come to play. This business was owned by her late husband who passed away two years ago. She has had to take on the work in order to find a way to make ends meet. Her two sons help her at the business as well.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has about 2 years of experience in the restaurant business. She decided to start it on her own initiative after being fed up of her work as a housekeeper. With her savings and the help of her brother in law who is a carpenter, she was able to acquire tables, chairs and utensils for her business. She started off by having the business outside of her home, but now she has made space inside to sit her clients. Maria is eager to continue improving her business but she needs a loan in order to make aesthetic improvements. She has 3 children who are all grown up and often help her in the restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant

loans.name: Airu

texts.en:
Airu has had her business for only 8 months. She had been working as a housekeeper since she was very young, but she is in search of a new way to generate income for her family. Her sister motivated her to start a business selling sodas and other drinks from her home. She lives in one of the worst sectors in Guayaquil. Her house, which is pictured, is made out of bamboo and is in the sector of the city near the shore where the tide rises into her home. She is hoping that with time she will be able to make a better home for her and her 9 children. Her husband works in the water company for a low wage.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in beverages to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells sodas, juices and beer. She already owns two large freezers thanks to the profits the business has generated. She is hoping that with this loan she will be able to buy her drinks wholesale to improve her profit margin and possibly a new freezer.

Maria and her husband have 10 children, 6 of them still live at home. She has been living in this very poor community for many years. Her home was once in very poor conditions and vulnerable to the rising shore, but she has made various improvements thanks to her business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more beverages and maybe a new freezer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a seamstress for more than 8 years. She makes all types of clothing and often takes custom jobs from her clients. She also has a small shop that she runs out of her home with the help of her 13 year old daughter. Although she prefers that her daughter study and not work in the business, she must recognize the need for money. She is a single mother who has had to face many difficulties after divorcing her husband. She counts on her businesses to help educate and feed her kids.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and fabrics

payments.comment: Elizabeth pago la operación de crédito con dinero de transferencia de emigrante.  Agradece a la comunidad Kiva por la confianza recibida para ella. Al contar con liquides proveniente de su familia y en esta epoca de lluvias en la costa ecuatoriana los negocios bajan su nivel de ventas siendo esta la causa del pago total.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a single mother who sells cosmetics. She travels around the local community from the morning into the evening offering family, friends and acquaintances her products. This work provides the main source of income for her and her family. She has three daughters, two of which go to school. When she goes out in the afternoon to sell, she must leave her younger kids at the care of her older daughter, which is worrisome for her. She hopes to invest the loan in more of her products and eventually open a store from home. Her goal is to become a large scale distributor of the cosmetics.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela has more than 13 years of experience in the production and selling of clothing. She learned the trade from her mother and set up her own business after saving up money from a job as a housekeeper. She has a very modest workshop that is in need of more fabrics and other materials, but she works long hours in order to make ends meet. As a single mother, she relies heavily on this business and a part time job cleaning houses in order to feed and educate her 2 children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Kennide

texts.en:
Kennide owns a tire sale and repair shop. After working for several years in a market selling fruit, Kennide decided to pursue the family trade and open this workshop. He learned the ins and outs of the business from his father who has already passed away. He started the business with a loan in order to buy the machinery but he is eager to receive more capital in order to continue to grow his operation. His shop is open from 7 in the morning to 7 pm. He has 2 kids and a wife who is a teacher.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy materials for his workshop

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto owns a local stand where he sells fish and fresh seafood. He started the business with some of his savings and used his 18 years of experience to make it a success. Along with his stand he has a job at a local fishing company where he packs and sells the products. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to invest in many different types of seafood that are often requested by his clients. He is a single man who still lives with his mother and three sisters. He plays a major financial role in the household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in different types of seafoods

loans.name: Contreras

texts.en:
J. sells clothing from her home and door-to-door. She has been in this line of work for over 20 years. She has had much experience working for clothing factories and stores, but due to the instability of the jobs and the poor pay she decided to start her own business. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to manufacture her own clothing. She is a single mother of one child. She and her husband separated after she had a baby with a mental disability that passed away. She is very optimistic about the future of her 4 year old child though.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine so she may begin to make clothing on her own

loans.name: Aleida

texts.en:
Aleida has a restaurant that is very popular in the local community. Prior to opening her business she held jobs in the city as an assistant for a dentist and at department stores. After she and her husband divorced, she decided to stay near her children and open a business from her home. She started off by just selling chicken wings, but as time passed she has been able to open a full fledged restaurant. The person who owns the home where she rents offered to rent her the home right next to it for her business. This has been great for Aleida who is raising two kids on her own. She runs the restaurant with the help of her mother, who always dreamed of having a business with her daughter. She is requesting the loan in order paint the place and invest utensils.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Paint her restaurant and invest in utensils and dishes

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a saleswoman of clothing and other products. She works during the week at a factory but she and her husband also sell clothing when she is not at work. It is very difficult for them to make ends meet for them and their 3 children because their salaries are very low. They hope that with this loan they will be able to make a significant investment in clothing that will allow them to improve their business and leave their jobs. They are very optimistic about the future for them and their three kids, although they know they must continue to work hard.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has a small restaurant that she runs out of her home. She has had about 8 years of experience in the restaurant business. She started this operation off by just selling chicken and chicken wings. She has made it into a full fledged restaurant during the weekends, but because of capital restrictions cannot sell during the week. She has also made space in her home to be able to seat people, but she is also in need of tables and chairs for the business. She hopes that the loan will help her overcome these barriers and continue to develop her business. She has five children, only two of which still live at home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more tables, chairs and food

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito sells crab meat to the local community. He has been working with seafood for over 15 year. He gets up at 4 every morning to buy crabs from fishermen. He and his wife then spend the next couple of hours cooking the crab and removing the crab meat. He puts the meat in plastic containers and then sells it to the public.
