He and his wefe have 3 kids who are all in school and often help out in the business. His wife is a housekeeper who works in the city. Their short term goal is to fix their home before the rainy season gets bad. Currently their roof leaks and it is very vulnerable to heavy rains.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy crab at wholesale prices

loans.name: Kodjo François

texts.en:
Mr. François Kodjo T., born in 1962 in Tchagba in Haho, is married with two children. Being unable to get an education due to lack of support, he taught himself to drive and got his driving license in 1982. Unable to buy his own car, he frequented transportation centers to take over from drivers during their rest periods. However, this did not guarantee him enough income to support his household needs. Very quiet and serious, he worries constantly about his family’s well-being. Despite his precarious situation, he succeeded in getting a $200 loan which he gave to his wife to set up a small food business so that she could contribute to the household expenses. With his help, his wife was able to manage and repay this loan, and she received a further loan, in her own name, which she is repaying with no problems.

Mr. T. is now requesting a $2000 loan to buy a car so that he can provide a taxi service. The financing of this project will be of enormous help in stabilizing Mr. T.’s income to provide for the needs of his family, and especially to ensure his children’s education.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à Tchagba dans le Haho, Monsieur T. Kodjo François est marié et père de deux enfants. N’ayant pas pu faire des études par manque de support, il s’est débrouillé pour se former en conduite et eut son permis de conduire en 1982. Ne pouvant pas s’acheter une voiture, il est figé dans des stations de service de transport pour prendre la main aux chauffeurs en leur temps de repos. Ce qui ne lui garantit pas un peu revenu lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. Très calme et sérieux, il a constamment le souci du bien-être de sa famille, et malgré sa situation très précaire, il a réussi à obtenir un crédit de $200 qu’il a remis à sa femme pour exercer de petit commerce de table afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Avec son concours, la femme a su bien gérer et rembourser ce crédit et en a eu un autre en son propre compte qui se rembourse aussi bien.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur T. Kodjo François sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour s’acheter une voiture pour faire le service de taxi bagage. Financer ce projet contribuera énormément à stabiliser les revenus Monsieur T. Kodjo François pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, surtout assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Mr. Victor D., aged 43, sculptor by profession, is married with one daughter. After having to abandon his education at secondary level due to lack of support, he then taught himself how to sculpt. He has been doing this work for 15 years, but he cannot really make any progress because of insufficient finances. He does not make enough money to cover his household expenses, which creates an unhappy atmosphere at home. He requested and was given a $300 loan, which he managed well and paid back without any problems. Extremely rigorous in the management of his business, Victor really deserves to be trusted and given financial help to develop his business and make it profitable.

He is now requesting a $950 loan which will be used to buy tools and raw materials. This will allow him to grow his business, and therefore increase his income to ensure an improved standard of living for his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Artiste sculpteur de profession, Monsieur D. Victor, âgé de 43 ans est marié et père d’une fille. Après s’être obligé d’arrêter ses études au niveau secondaire par manque de support, il apprit alors la sculpture avec ses propres moyens. Il exerce ce métier depuis 15 ans mais n’évolue pas réellement pour insuffisance de moyens matériels et financiers. Il ne dispose pas alors de revenus adéquats pour subvenir aux charges de son foyer. Ce qui crée une très mauvaise ambiance dans son foyer. Il sollicita et obtint alors un crédit de $300 qu’il a su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Très rigoureux dans la gestion de ses affaires, Victor mérite toute confiance pour tout concours financier pour développer et rentabiliser ses activités.

Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $950 qui servira à acheter le matériel et outillage et des matières premières. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître ses activités et de facto augmenter ses revenus pour assurer le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy tools and raw materials

loans.name: Dopé Noëlle

texts.en:
Trained as a secretary and stenographer, Ms. Dopé Noëlle A., born on December 20, 1973, has not had the opportunity of having a permenant, stable job. She is most often hired as a replacement, but she likes her work and does it very well. Her situation does not provide enough to pay her bills and ensure a good future for her. Although she is single and has no children, she is responsible for her mother and two cousins. With her pale skin and enviable beauty, she does not want to leave herself open to abuse by men. Her small savings and a $300 standby credit allowed her to buy a portable computer to do travelling secretarial work. This service would do more to increase her success and help her if she could receive more consistent financial support. This is why Ms. A. is currently asking for a $2000 credit to open a business center. The credit will be used to buy a microcomputer and a photocopier, and to install a telephone. Financing Ms. A. would act as encouragement and a good example for girls who succumb to debauchery, prostitution, and easy money, with all the problems that brings today like AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. A plan like hers deserves to be financed right away.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Secrétaire sténographe de formation, Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle, née le 20 décembre 1973, n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi fixe et stable. Elle est employée le plus souvent comme remplaçante, pourtant elle aime son travail et le fait très bien. Cette situation ne lui permet pas se prendre en charge et lui assurer un bon avenir. Or, bien que célibataire sans enfant, elle a à charge sa maman et deux cousines. D’un teint clair et d’une beauté enviable, elle ne veut pas se laisser abuser par les hommes. Avec sa petite économie et un crédit d’appoint de $300, elle est arrivée à acheter un ordinateur portatif pour faire le secrétariat ambulant. Ce service peut mieux lui réussir et lui rapporter bien si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier plus consistant. Aussi, Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle sollicite-t-elle aujourd’hui d’un crédit de $2000 afin d’ouvrir un centre d’affaires. Ce crédit servira à acheter un micro-ordinateur, un appareil photocopieur et à installer un téléphone. Financer Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle c’est encourager et donner un bel exemple aux filles qui se laissent à la débauches, à la prostitution et aux gains faciles avec tout ce que cela comporte aujourd’hui comme le SIDA et autres maladies sexuellement transmissibles. Un projet comme celui-ci mérite d’être financé aujourd’hui.

loans.use: Buying a microcomputer and photocopier and installing a telephone to open a business center

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born in Lomé on October 10, 1981, Mr. Yaovi S. did not go to school because of his parents’ poverty. He had a difficult childhood but managed to find an apprenticeship to pay for his own needs as soon as possible. He was brave, and managed to overcome his difficulties to finish his training. Currently he works hard, in a small workshop that he opened after finishing his apprenticeship, to meet his own needs and those of his destitute parents. But he cannot meet this objective with his limited material and financial means. Mr. S. wishes to open a real carpenter’s workshop where he could put all his talents to use for his clients, of whom he has more and more. He is therefore asking for a $1000 credit to buy small tools and wood for building and selling furniture. This would give him a stable income and ensure the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

S. Yaovi n’a pas été à l’école à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents. Il vécut une enfance difficile mais réussit à entrer en apprentissage pour pouvoir se prendre en charge le plus tôt possible. Courageux, il a pu faire face aux difficultés pour finir sa formation. Aujourd’hui, en fin d’apprentissage, il a ouvert un petit atelier où il travaille avec endurance pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses parents écrasés par la misère. Il ne parvient pas à atteindre cet objectif car, il est limité par les moyens tant matériels que financiers. Monsieur S. désire ouvrir un vrai atelier de menuiserie où il va faire éclore tous ses talents à l’endroit de ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour l’achat de petit outillage et du bois pour la fabrication et la vente des meubles. Ce qui lui permettra de stabiliser ses revenus et assurer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying wood and small tools

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi A. was born on July 15, 1967 to a poor family in Lomé. Not having enough money to go far away for his studies, he decided to learn carpentry and thus receive profesionnal training. Now married and the father of three (03) children, he has his own workshop. He is dynamic and innovative, and attracts clients by displaying his products outside. But without modern tools, he continues to work by hand, which makes production extremely slow. He would therefore like to supply his workshop with more effective equipment for faster, more refined work. To do this, he is asking for a $1500 credit that will enable him to buy two machines that can handle all the necessary carpentry work. This will mean that he does not have to transport wood to other workshops, and can cut his costs. Realizing this plan will allow him to increase his production and his income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi est né le 15 Juillet 1967 dans une pauvre famille à Lomé. Ne pouvant pas aller loin dans ses études faute de moyens, il décida d’apprendre la menuiserie et avoir ainsi une formation professionnelle. Aujourd’hui marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il tient son propre atelier. Dynamique et innovateur, il séduit sa clientèle avec ses produits exposés en plein air. Mais n’ayant pas d’outils modernes, il continue de travailler manuellement, ce qui retarde énormément la production. Il se propose alors de doter son atelier de matériels plus performants pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffiné. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1500 qui lui permettra d’acheter deux machines pour tous travaux de menuiserie. Cela lui évitera de transporter le bois dans d’autres ateliers afin de limiter les frais. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître sa production et d’augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy two machines for carpentry work

loans.name: Y. Nestor

texts.en:
Mr. Y. Nestor A. was born on February 26, 1979 in Porto-Novo (Benin). He had to drop out of his primary studies, and at the age of 15, he started his training as a tapestry-maker. At the end of his training, he could not get set up because he had no money to buy the necessary equipment, so he has to rent a sewing machine by the day, which he sets up on the side of the road to work. This is not at all profitable for him, because the cost for renting the machine is too high. Mr. A. therefore keeps sinking further into poverty with each passing day, despite his intelligence and creativity. He is currently asking for $950 in financial support, which would allow him to open and equip a workshop. The credit he is seeking would be enough to rent a workshop, and also to buy a sewing machine and other tapestry tools. With all of this, he would be able to have a stable income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Y. Nestor est né le 26 Février 1979 à Porto-Novo (Bénin). Il dût arrêter ses études aux cours primaire et à l’âge de 15 ans, il entra en formation de tapissier. A la fin de cette formation, il n’arrive pas à s’installer car n’ayant aucun moyen pour s’acheter le matériel nécessaire, il est obligé de louer quotidiennement une machine à coudre qu’il installe au bord de la rue pour travailler. Ce qui ne lui est pas du tout rentable car les coûts de location de la machine sont trop élevés. Monsieur A. continue donc de sombrer dans la misère au fur et à mesure que les jours passent malgré son intelligence et son esprit de créativité. Il sollicite à ce jour un appui financier de $950 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir un atelier et de l’équiper. Le crédit qu’il demande va servir à louer un local pour son atelier, d’acheter une machine à coudre et autres outillages pour la tapisserie. Ce faisant, il pourra alors avoir des revenus stables pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and small tools for tapestry work

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He is 40, married. He settled with 2 children in Sumgait city. He began his businnes from 2001. Rahim is the only breadwinner in family. His first loan was $500, bought 6 sheeps. 
He spent the second loan amount of $800 to buy 11 sheeps. 
In third time he borrowed 1000$ and has bought 4 calves.
Now he is planning to buy 18 sheeps in order to increase his incomes. Rahim applies for a loan amount of 1500$.

loans.use: To buy 18 sheeps

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en:
Born in Akoumapé-Kpota in 1966, Mr. Agbéko N. is the second son in a family of ten children. His parents had no concept of educating their children, and he was not able to go to school. He learned carpentry, but it took quite a while for him to set up shop because he lacked the resources. He received a $450 credit to open a workshop, but it was not well equipped. Despite all his talent, his work well done and his dynamic nature, he could not effectively meet the demand of his clients. Plunged into further difficulties, Mr. N. found a new strategy for attracting clients: building furniture and displaying it in front of his workshop. This highly profitable activity requires a large financial investment, and so Mr. N. is asking for $1000 in financial support to outfit his workshop and buy small tools and wood for making and selling furniture. This will increase his business and his income, and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1966 à Akoumapé-Kpota, Monsieur N. Agbéko est le deuxième fils d’une famille de dix enfants. Ses parents ignorent toute notion de scolarisation des enfants et il n’a pu aller à l’école. Il apprit la menuiserie, mais a mis assez de temps pour s’installer par manque de moyens. Il obtient un crédit de $450 pour ouvrir un atelier mais très mal équipé. Malgré tout son talent, son travail bien fait et son dynamisme, il ne parvient pas à répondre efficacement à la forte demande de la clientèle. Plongé davantage dans les difficultés, Monsieur N. Agbéko a trouvé une nouvelle stratégie pour séduire sa clientèle : fabriquer des meubles et les exposer devant son atelier. Cette activité très rentable demande assez de moyens financiers et Monsieur N. sollicite un appui financier de $1000 qui va servir à aménager son atelier, à acheter de petit outillage et du bois pour la fabrication et vente des meubles. Ce qui va accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his workshop and buy wood and small tools

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
30 years old, Mrs. Pauline A. had a difficult childhood due to the poverty of her parents. She abandoned her studies at an early age to learn sewing with the hopes of taking charge and helping our her parents. Today, she has her own store that she oversees with modesty and rigor. Married and a maother of two children, she also takes care of three other children [cousins]. She is in charge of all the cleaning, as her husband, employed at the airport, has an undesirable salary. In the hopes of improving revenues for her family, Mrs. A. recently added a small dry goods businesses to her store, as well as selling plastic objects (plates, glasses, etc). If she was able to obtain a loan in order to sell her things closer to the N\\\'kafu market, her business could be more profitable. Therefore, in order to increase her revenues, Mrs. A. is asking for a $1500 credit in order to buy a more sophisticated sewing machine, dry goods, and plastic objects to sell. The realization of this project would allow her to improve the work conditions of her three apprentices and the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 30 ans aujourd’hui, Madame A. Pauline a eu une enfance difficile à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents. Elle abandonna très tôt les études pour apprendre la couture en vue de se prendre en charge et aider ses parents. A ce jour, elle tient son propre atelier qu’elle gère avec modestie et rigueur. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle prend en charge trois (03) autres enfants de sa tante. Ce qui fait peser sur elle les charges du ménage car son mari, employé à l’aéroport, n’a qu’un salaire dérisoire. Dans le but d’améliorer ses revenus de la famille, Madame A. Pauline vient d’initier en plus de son métier, un petit commerce de mercerie et de vente d’objets en plastique (sceau, cuvette, assiette, gobelet…). Ces activités pourraient évoluer au mieux si elle disposait d’un fonds de crédit plus consistant car l’emplacement à proximité du marché de N’kafu un atout pour le développement de ses affaires. Ainsi, pour accroître et augmenter ses revenus, Madame A. Pauline sollicite un crédit de $1500 pour acheter une machine à coudre sophistiquée et acheter les articles de mercerie et les objets en plastic pour leur revente. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de travail de ses trois (03) apprenties et le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and dry goods.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Mr. Paul T. was born on June 29 1975 in Lomé. From a poor family, he had to abandon his studies once he reached secondary school in order to learn hydrolic mechanics. He specialized in the repairs of shock absorbers and others, allowing him a fairly regular list of clients that he is sadly unable to satisfy due to a lack of performance materials. This makes it very difficult to do his job since his clients are often not pleased with the time lag in their repairs. In order to chance this situation, he would like to acquire other equipment in order to improve his performance and make his clients more loyal to him. In order to accomplish this, Mr. T. is asking for a loan of $1200 which would allow him to buy, among other things, two table clamps and other tools. This would enable him to improve his workshop, generate more profits and tend to the needs of his wife and two children.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur T. Paul est né le 29 juin 1975 à Lomé. Issu d’une famille pauvre, il a dû abandonner les études au niveau secondaire pour apprendre la mécanique hydraulique. Il s’est spécialisé dans la réparation des amortisseurs et autres. Cette spécialité lui a procuré une clientèle assez importante qu’il n’arrive pas malheureusement à satisfaire convenablement par manque de matériels de travail performant. Ce qui rend très difficile l’exercice de son métier car les clients sont souvent mécontents du retard pris dans les prestations. Pour sortir de cette situation, il désire acquérir d’autres équipements en vue d’améliorer ses prestations et fidéliser sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Monsieur T. Paul sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui va lui servir à acheter entre autres, deux (02) étaux de table, une (01) clé à griffe, une paire d’arrache. Cela lui permettra de renforcer son atelier, d’améliorer son revenu et de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses deux (02) enfants.

loans.use: Buy work materials.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Minkend village. He is married. He settled with family in Sumgait city. This 41-year-old man, Rasim started his business 5 years ago. His first loan was $500, bought 6 sheep. 
Rasim applies for a loan amount of 1000$ to buy 6 sheeps and 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 6 sheeps and 2 calves

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Mr. Roland M. was born on September 15, 1980 in Lomé. Having styled his brothers, sisters and friends early with much attention and finesse, his parents pushed him towards this career. He began an apprenticeship and never stopped wowing people with his great work. Very dynamic and an entrepreneur, he was able to open his own salon just after his apprenticeship ended, thanks to a loan of $150 that he obtained and regularly paid back. The efficacity and quality of his work makes him an excellent hair stylist in his community. Facing clients that are more and more demanding, Mr. M. now feels the need to update his equipment in order to be line with their requests. IN order to do this, he is asking for a $1200 credir to improve his salon and his equipment. This credit will alow him to buy electric razors, hair dryers, wash basins and cosmetic beauty products. Financing this young man to improve his salon will be a great encouragement for others in the community to follow in his footsteps and take charge of their own destinies and not fall into juvenile deliquency.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur M. Roland est né le 15 septembre 1980 à Lomé. Ayant commencé très tôt à coiffer ses frères, ses sœurs et ses amis à la maison avec beaucoup de soin et de finesse, ses parents ont jugé bon de l’orienter vers ce métier. Il entra en apprentissage et ne cessa de séduire tout le monde par son travail bien fait. Très dynamique et entreprenant, il réussit à ouvrir un salon de coiffure juste après sa formation, ceci grâce à un crédit de $150 qu’il a obtenu et régulièrement emboursé. L’efficacité et la qualité de son travail font de lui un excellent coiffeur dans son quartier. Face à une clientèle de plus en plus abondante et exigeante, M. M. se trouve dans l’obligation de perfectionner son équipement en vue d’être à la hauteur de la demande. Mais il ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour le faire. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour aménager et renforcer son salon en équipement. Ce crédit servira à l’achat des tondeuses électriques, des séchoirs, des lave-tête, des produits de beauté et cosmétiques. Financer ce jeune garçon à améliorer son salon de coiffure fera tache d’huile dans la quartier et encouragera d’autres jeunes à emboîter ses pas pour leur auto prie en charge afin d’éviter la délinquance juvénile.

loans.use: Update the look and equipment for his hair salon.

payments.comment:
Roland thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to his project funding which allows him today to increase his activities and automatically his incomes to his proper living conditions improvement and those of his family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!
The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment.

loans.name: Logossou Kokou

texts.en:
Mr. Logossou Kokou A. nicknamed \"Paolo\" was born on October 18, 1972 in Lomé. A very bright and intelligent child, he never learn the form of artist/painting/drawer which he exercises with efficacity. His paintings have made him a celebrity during various expositions. Thanks to this work, he is able to take care of his parents and his three brothers. Today, he is hoping to hold a large art show which would allow him to be better known as his paintains are appreciated in greater depth in Europe and the United States. This project is important and deserves to be supported, and Mr. A. lacks the necessary funds to carry this out. It is important to note that Mr. A. already has experience with finance loans as he has already benefited in the past from two loans of $300 and $650 that he managed well and repaid without any incident. He can therefore be supported with confidence. He is asking for a credit of $1500 today which would allow him to open his own shop and to buy matierlas necessary to produce his work. This project would allow him to become even more famous and would allow him to have a more certain revenue to satisfy the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Logossou Kokou de sobriquet « Paolo » est né le 18 octobre 1972 à Lomé. Garçon très doué et un génie, il n’a pas appris métier d’artiste-peintre-décorateur-dessinateur qu’il exerce avec efficacité et ses tableaux l’ont rendu célèbre lors de diverses expositions. Et grâce à ce travail, il arrive à prendre en charge ses parents et ses trois frères encore élèves. Aujourd’hui, il cherche à donner une grande dimension à son activité et a l’ambition de préparer une grande exposition qui lui permettra de s’ouvrir davantage sur l’extérieur car les tableaux sont plus appréciés en Europe et aux Etats-Unis. Cet important projet qui mérite d’être soutenu, demande assez de moyens dont ne dispose pas M. A.. Il faut noter que M. A. a déjà des expériences en matière de gestion des crédits car il avait bénéficié par le passé de deux crédits respectifs de $300 et $650 qu’il avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Il mérite tout confiance d’être financièrement soutenu. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1500 qui servira à louer à aménager un local pour ouvrir sa boutique et à acheter des matériels de travail nécessaires pour ses prestations et productions. La réalisation de ce projet le rendra encore plus célèbre et lui permettra de disposer d’un revenu sûr pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Rent and update a store to open his boutique and to buy work materials.

payments.comment:
Logossou thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to his project funding which allows him today to increase his activities and automatically his incomes to his proper living conditions improvement and those of his family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!

The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment.

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.en:
27 years old, Mrs. Dorothée K. is a married woman and mother of one child. Oldest child in her family, she worked hard in order to help out her parents and her younger brothers and sisters. Thanks to help from her husband and a loan of $450, she opened a dry goods stores in her community. This could become very profitable as she realizes thather store is the only one in the area and demand is great. She is therefore hoping to enlarge the inventory of her store, and is asking for a loan to invest in her store. She is asking for a $1200 loan which would allow her to buy and resell dry goods, thus greatly expanding her business and allowing her to better take care of the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 27 ans, Mme K. Dorothée est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Fille aînée de sa famille, elle travaille durement pour venir en aide à ses parents et à ses jeunes frères et sœurs. Grâce à l’appui de son mari et à un crédit de $450 obtenu, elle a ouvert une boutique de mercerie dans son quartier. Cette activité peut lui être très rentable si elle disposait d’un fonds de crédit plus consistant car sa boutique est la seule dans son quartier. Elle s’est donc rendue compte que la demande est devenue très forte et cherche à renforcer sa boutique. Le renforcement et l’élargissement de la boutique nécessitent un nouvel investissement et pour y parvenir, Mme K. a besoin d’un appui financier. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits de mercerie. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître considérablement ses activités et facto ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy and sell dry goods.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina N. is married. She has one daughter and two grandsons aged 10 and 12. After her daughter was divorced, Nina devoted a lot of her time and energy to supporting her daughter and grandchildren. The boys were growing and Nina willingly sacrificed her free time and rest to make enough money to pay their school fees. She was the only breadwinner in the family and worked hard to provide for all of them. Nina started her business having only one small stall with plastic bags, shoe laces and other small necessities. Perseverance, hard work and commitment to her business in combination with loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped Nina become a successful private entrepreneur. She has good reputation among other market vendors. Her friendly attitude and willingness to meet customers’ needs help her keep good clientele. She has a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”, repaying 15 loans with no delinquencies. Today she has 3 kiosks at different open air markets and sells women’s clothes. Moreover, Nina employs two women, providing a stable salary for two more families. Nina realizes that access to loans is important to her business. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase the assortment of clothing items that she sells in her kiosks. The loan will not only increase her working capital and sales, but promote the expansion of Nina’s business. She feels a wider assortment of quality dresses, skirts, jackets and pants will better meet the growing demands of her clients. More working capital will help to ensure business growth and provide a more secure future for her employees, family and grandchildren.

Ніна Тимофіївна - заміжня. В неї одна донечка й два онуки: 10 та 12 рочків. Після розлучення доньки, Ніна Тимофіївна багато часу й енергії присвятила своїм онукам. Хлопчики підростали, Ніна Тимофіївна з радістю жертвувала вільним часом та відпочинком, для того, щоб заплатити за навчання онуків. Вона годувала усю родину, тому була змушена важко й наполегливо працювати, щоб забезпечити рідних. Ніна Тимофіївна почала власний бізнес з маленького прилавку, продавала поліетиленові пакети, шнурки та інший необхідний дріб’язок. Наполегливість, невтомна праця й вірність власній справі у сукупності з позиками від „Надії України” допомогли Ніні Тимофіївні досягти успіху в якості приватного підприємця. В неї гарна репутація серед інших торговців на ринку. Її щире ставлення й готовність задовольнити усі потреби покупців допомагають їй зберегти постійних клієнтів. В Ніни Тимофіївни – чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона сплатила 15 позик без жодного прострочення. Сьогодні в неї вже 3 кіоски на різних ринках міста, вона продає одяг для жінок. Окрім того, Ніна Тимофіївна взяла на роботу двох жінок, забезпечивши стабільну зарплатню для ще двох родин. Ніна Тимофіївна розуміє, що позики відіграють дуже важливу роль в її бізнесі. Вона просить про позику в 1 000 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент одягу. Позика не тільки допоможе Ніні Тимофіївні поповнити оборотні кошти та розширити торгівлю, але й сприятиме розвитку її бізнесу. Ніна Тимофіївна вважає, що більший асортимент якісного одягу, а саме суконь, спідниць, пальт та штанів допоможе задовольнити зростаючий попит з боку покупців. Поповнення оборотних коштів сприятиме росту бізнесу, а також забезпечить стабільне майбутнє для її реалізаторів, родини та онуків.

loans.use: Expand assortment of goods to meet customer demands

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region Gulabirt village. He is married. He settled with family and child in Sumgait city. He has been engaged in this business for 14 years. This is not his first loan, he borrowed 500$ a year ago. With first loan he bought 6 sheep. The loans were paid back timely.
Nemat applies for a loan amount of 1000$ to buy 14 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 14 sheeps

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He is 54, married. He settled with 3 children in Sumgait city. Vagif is the only breadwinner in family. It is necessary to note that Vagif is the one of the active clients of Normicro. All borrowed loans by him were paid back timely. His first loan was $300, bought 5 sheep. He spent the second loan $500 to buy 9 sheep. Third time he borrowed 800$ and bought 4 calves.
Now he is planning to buy 11 sheep and 1 calf in order to increase his income. Vagif applies for a loan amounting 1000$.

loans.use: To buy 11 sheeps and 1 calf

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala was born in Siyazan region of Azerbaijan. After wedding they moved to Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. She is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning she used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $400 she wants to buy refrigerator and improve condition of her family. 

She applies for $400 to buy the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy the refrigerator

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her pay phone business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara operates a community phone center. Her resolve to operate other centers has led her to request a loan amount of $1075 to extend her operations to 3 other adjoining communities. She has participated in Krabans Business Advisory lessons.

loans.use: Communication Services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tailoring business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old, is married and has 3 children and they all live in Monclova, Coahuila. Her husband is employed and earns the minimum wage. The necessities of their children grow as they continue to grow with the increasing costs of education and clothing. Given this situation Erika since about a year ago, was worried and started to look for a business that would generate an extra income to help her husband. And she identified the possibility of selling jewellery. To date she still maintains her project that she started with the unconditional support of her family.

The situation has improved, although it has not been easy, but with patience, together they have been able to make little by little. Erika now requires a loan of $250 to be able to purchase merchandise to offer her clients and therefore increase her earnings. You can contribute to the well being of this family. You only need to help them, as they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika tiene 32 años, casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en Monclova, Coahuila. Su esposo es empleado y gana el salario mínimo, las necesidades de sus hijos crecen conforme ellos van creciendo, pues lo gastos en educación y vestido se incrementan. Por esta situación, Erika hace ya casi un año que, preocupada, buscó una actividad que le pudiera generar ingresos extras para ayudar a su esposo y vio la posibilidad en la venta de joyería. Hasta el momento ella ha seguido con el proyecto que hace tiempo inició con el apoyo incondicional de su familia.

La situación ha mejorado, aunque fácil no ha sido, con paciencia juntos han podido salir adelante poco a poco. Erika ahora requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar mercancía, ofrecerla a sus clientes, e incrementar sus ingresos. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de ella y su familia, solo tienes que ayudarlos, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha Aurelia

texts.en:
Miss Martha has a lovely family, made up of her four children and her husband. They live in Monclova in the state of Coahuila. One of their children is currently studying a program in university but the family income was not enough to provide him with the education that he wanted. With this situation at hand, Miss Martha started to sell shoes by catalogue and in this manner be able to obtain the income to put towards the realization of her son\'s wish.

She now requiers a loan of $475 that wil be used to purchase merchandise and pay off some outstanding accounts. With this she will be able to increase her sales, most needed because her son\'s tuition costs aree increasing and they cannot cover them. Make it possible for the continuation and completion of Miss Martha\'s son\'s studies. Become an essential part of the realization of the dream. Help them, they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha tiene una linda familia, conformada por 4 hijos y su esposo, ellos viven en Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Uno de sus hijos hace dos años que tuvo el deseo de estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero los ingresos familiares no alcanzaban para brindarle la educación que él deseaba. Tras esta situación, Doña María comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo y de esta manera poder obtener ingresos que utilizaría para poder cumplir el deseo de su hijo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, que utilizará para poder comprar mercancía y pagar unas facturas pendientes. Con esto ella podrá incrementar sus ventas, ya que los pagos de la educación de su hijo se están incrementando y no alcanzan a cubrirlos. Haz posible la continuación y culminación de los estudios D. hijo de Doña Martha. Vuélvete parte esencial de la realización de su sueño, apóyalos, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adriana Monserrat

texts.en:
Adriana is a very engaging and hard working woman, married and has three small children. Her husband\'s work is occassional as an independent laborer and his income is unstable and not enough to cover the basic necessities of their household. Antonio, Adriana\'s husband, since a year and a half ago fell ill and needed urgent medical care and tests, which is when she started to sell costmetics with her objective to be able to get her husband\'s needed medical care.

It has not been an easy struggle through all this time, but the ongoing love of her family has made this possible. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months. Adriana and her family need you and your support and generosity. Do not doubt and make your decision. They will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Adriana es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños. El trabajo de su marido es eventual, ya que es albañil por su cuenta, por lo que los ingresos no son seguros y no alcanzan a cubrir todas la necesidades básicas del hogar. Antonio, esposo de Adriana, hace un año y medio se enfermó y necesitaba urgentemente consultas y exámenes médicos, por lo que ella comenzó a vender cosméticos, con el objetivo de conseguir los medios necesarios para atenderlo.

No ha sido fácil luchar en todo este tiempo, pero la constancia y el amor a su familia lo han hecho posible. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito para poder continuar con su proyecto, por la cantidad de $250 dólares, mismos que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Adriana y su familia necesitan de ti, de tu apoyo y generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Francisca Gabriela

texts.en:
Miss Panchita, as she is known in her community of Monclova, Coahuila, where she lives with her husband and three children. She has always been a very active woman with a strong and engaging spirit, despite the fact that things have been very difficult for her and for her family, as they have many needs. Due to this, 10 years ago Miss Panchita, upon an invitation from a friend, started to sell products for the home through catalogues. All this time she has been able to keep her business successful thanks to the love from her family and her will to provide her children with a better future through an education, as this is the only inheritance she can give them.

Miss Panchita needs a capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales and keep support her husband and children, as she has been doing to date. She requires a loan of $250 that she plans to repay in a term of 3 to 6 months. You have the ability to contribute and supprot Miss Panchita. Do not hesitate and show your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Panchita, así es como la conocen en su localidad, Monclava Coahuila, donde vive con su esposo y 3 hijos. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy activa y con espíritu bastante emprendedor, a pesar de que las cosas no han sido muy fáciles para ella y su familia, ya que tienen muchas necesidades. Por esto, hace ya 10 que Doña Panchita, ante la invitación de una amiga, comenzó a vender productos para el hogar a través de catálogos. Todo éste tiempo ha logrado mantener su actividad con éxito gracias al amor que le brinda su familia y al deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro a través de la educación, que la única herencia que puede dejarles.

Doña Panchita necesita capital para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercancía y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y lograr seguir apoyando, como hasta ahora a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú tienes la posibilidad de contribuir, apoya a Doña Panchita, no lo dudes más y muestra tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is married and lives in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. It has been seven years since she started selling cosmetics - she has always been a person very much wanting to grow and be independent. This way she generates her own income and she does not totally depend on her husband. Sonia wishes to build a house of their own to be able to provide a good quality of life for their future children. She has had to struggle for what she has achieved until now despirte the difficult situations that have crossed her path - she has always known to get up and keep going.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $650 that she will repay in a term of 8 to 16 months that she will put towards the purchase of merchandise requested by her clients. Now is your chance to become part of the realization of Sonia\\\'s dreams. She needs you to keep going and she is thankful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es casada y vive en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, hace ya siete años que inició a vender cosméticos, pues ella siempre ha sido una persona con muchas ganas de crecer y de ser independiente. De esta manera ella genera sus propios ingresos y no depende totalmente de su esposo. Sonia tiene el deseo de construir un a casa propia para poder brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus futuros hijos. Ella ha tenido que luchar mucho por lo que ha construid hasta el momento y a pesar que ha a atravesado por situaciones complicadas ha sabido levantarse para continuar.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 DLLS, mismos que cubrirá en un plazo de 8 a 16 meses y que utilizará para comprar la mercancía que sus clientes le piden. Ahora es tu oportunidad de se parte e la realización de los sueños de Sonia, ella te necesita para continuar y te agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Fidencia Rossana

texts.en:
Fidencia has three childrena and lives with her partner in a small house in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. They are currently going through very difficult times as they now face a serious economic crisis. The household costs and the necessities of their children cannot be covered with the couples\' salary. Fidencia, for some time now, has been selling ceramics to alleviate the situation, and she has managed to remain stable for more than three years now. But today she needs a loan in the amount of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months.

With this loan she will be able to vary the merchandise she offers her clients, and this will in its turn help obtain greater earnings and therefore alleviate some of the difficulties present in their home. Fidencia and her family require your generosity, help them. You have the ability to do so. Do not doubt it any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Fidencia tiene 3 hijos y vive con su pareja en una pequeña casita de la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Ellos actualmente están pasando por momentos muy complicados, ya que atraviesan por una mala crisis económica, pues los gastos del hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos no se alcanzan a cubrir únicamente con el sueldo de su pareja. Fidencia desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de cerámica por la misma situación, y a logrado ser constante por ya más de tres años, sin embargo hoy necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismo que piensa cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

Con este préstamo ella podrá surtir más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, y esto a su vez le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos para poder sanar un poco las dificultades que se encuentran presentes en su hogar. Fidencia y su familia requieren de tu generosidad, apóyalos, tu tienes la posibilidad de hacerlo, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has been selling used clothing for two years now. She has fought hard to be able to keep up her business as it is an important source of extra income that allows them to cover the necessities, that without this business would not be possible. She has three children of 15, 14 and 12 years, all of whom are currently studying. Her husband is a laborer and earns only minimum wage. Thanks to the extra income earned by Fidencia, her children have been able to keep going to school. This is why she works so hard.

She requires a loan of $250 to invest on merchandise, to be able to increase her sales, a loan that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months. Do not permit that the children of Fidencia not be able to finish their education. You can help her, show your genersotiy, she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandra se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace dos años, ha luchado mucho para poder continuar con su negocio, pues es una fuente importante de ingresos extras, misma que les permite poder cubrir necesidades que sin esta actividad sería imposible. Ella tiene 3 hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años, todos se encuentran estudiando actualmente, su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo. Gracias a los ingresos extras que gana Fidencia, sus hijos pueden seguir estudiando. Es por ello que trabaja mucho.

Ella requiere de un crédito de $250 DLLS para poder invertir en mercancía y poder incrementar sus ventas, mismo que planea regresar en un plazo de 3-6 meses. No permitas que los hijos de Fidencia no puedan concluir sus estudios, tu puedes apoyarla, muestra tu generosidad, ella te necesita.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Paola Patricia

texts.en:
Paola is a person that wants to come out on top through her own efforts. She is married and has a small child. They live in the city of Monclova, Coahuila, in a room of Paola\'s husband Antonio\'s parents. This is why about a year ago she started to sell jewellery with the goal of helping her husband with their expenses and to save money to be able to build a small house for their family.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $250, that will be used to purchase more merchandise and this way be able to more quickly build the house following and increase in her sales. She plans on repaying the full amount of the loan in a term of 3-6 months. Become a fundamental part of the realization of Paola\'s dream. Help her build a proper home. The decision is in yoru hands, you just need to make the move.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Paola es una persona que quiere salir adelante por sus propios méritos, es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño. Ellos viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, en un cuarto de la casa de los padres de Antonio, esposo de Paola. Es por ello que hace poco más de un año ella comenzó a vender joyería con el objetivo de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y además poder juntar capital para construir una pequeña casita para su familia.

Ella ahora necesita de un crédito por una cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar más mercancía y así poder construir más rápido su casa ante el incremento de las ventas. Planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 3-6 mese. Se parte fundamental de la realización del sueño de Paola, ayúdale a construir un hogar propio, la decisión esta en tus manos sólo hace falta que te decidas.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.en:
In Monclova, Coahuila lives Mister Nicolas, a very hard working and responsible man. Some time ago he started his own business in repairing and selling jackets. He started by repairing two jackets and the client was pleased and started to recommend him to other people. Later he started to buy used jackets to repair and then sell them. He decided that it was better to start his own business than to keep working for the company where he worked because his earnings were greater and it permitted him to give his family a better quality of life.

He now requires a loan of $475, which will be put towards the purchase of a bulk of jackets to generate further earnings. Thanks to Mister Nicolas\' business they do not have to depend on but instead help their children that are now married and need their support. Do not leave them alone - they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Monclova, Coahuila vive Don Nicolás, un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y trabajador, hace tiempo que inició su propio negocio de reparación y venta de chaquetas. El comenzó reparando dos chaquetas y al cliente le gusto y empezaron a recomendarlo con más gente, después empezó a comprar chaquetas usadas para repararlas y posteriormente venderlas. Decidió que era mejor desarrollar esta actividad propia que seguir laborando en la empresa para la que trabajaba, pues esto le genera más ingresos y le permite brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de un lote de chaquetas y con esto generará más ingresos. Gracias al negocio de Don Nicolás ellos no dependen se la ayuda que sus hijos, quienes ya están casados, eventualmente les brindan, ahora ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no los dejes solos, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE JACKETS

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Elnur is 28 years old. He married and has 1 child. He is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he sold the fruit. He borrowed the loan amount of $500 to be engaged in sale of fruit. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1000 to rent a mini shop and buy foodstuff. 
Now, he applies for the loan $1500 to expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.en:
Ogtay is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. Ogtay works as a master. He has a small place in a cellar of the building where he repairs refrigerators. He is hard working person. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 20 years ago and it allows him to support his family. He is 47. In 2003 he borrowed $400 from Normicro and spent this loan amount to buy the spare parts for refrigerators. 
For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $600 and bought 6 relays and 7 motor for refrigerators. 
Now he applies for a loan amount of $800 to buy the spare parts and to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Teu

texts.en:
Teu is married with seven children. She lives in the village of Tafitoala on the south coast of Upolu in Samoa.

Her business activity is plantation and fishing. She grows taro, tamu, bananas, pineapples, yams and vegetables.

Teu is the leader of her village group and is pictured in front of her house. There are 18 women in the lending group and the weekly meeting is held in the house. In fact her house is a complex of buildings. There is the building in the foreground where meetings are held and some members of the family sleep. As can be seen there are no walls which is common in Samoa. If it rains, there are canvas sheets which are rolled down. In the background is a second house or building where other family members live and also eat. There is a wooden kitchen which is located beside this and another traditional Samoan hut which is out of shot. In front of Teu is a lawn area, and immediately behind her can be seen a small garden of flowers. What cant be seen is on either side are grown vegetables and pineapples. Behind the building in the foreground, and between all the houses the ground is covered in small black lava rocks. This is a typical way Samoan houses are surrounded - it is a form of paving. In fact the whole island and in particularly the area of the coast where Tue lives is covered in lava remains.

Although it cannot be seen, Teu\\\'s plantation is at the side and back of the houses in the photo.

As above, Teu is the leader of her village lending group (center chief) and has been a very good ambassodor of the SPBD program

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, weed killer. Cement for home improvement

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is married with 3 children. She lives in the village of Saaga on the south coast of Upolu in Samoa.

Malo runs a roadside general store. These are quite common in Samoa and indeed SPBD and Kiva finance many. Malo’s store is one of the best on the island and she was the winner of one of the seven best businesswomen awards given by SPBD in 2007. The store is stocked which a variety of goods, many of which are not seen in other roadside stores. There are for example toys, sporting goods (ie volleyballs which is popular in Samoa), clothing, mobile phones, stationary and many other things. Malo started the store four years ago and it has doubled in size since then. She has used her loans to help build the store but also to buy stock.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana Harrison is part owner and manager of Boomerang Creek Café, which is located on the south east coast of Upolu. As can be seen in the photo, this is one of the main tourist areas in Samoa as it is located near some of the best beaches. Ana is pictured in front of some of the beach hut accommodation which she has used her loans to help build. In the background can be seen the beach and Pacific Ocean. On the other side of the road can be found the café which sits above the road but above very steep cliffs and waterfalls. The café includes an open entertainment which is used for Samoan dancing on the weekends, group functions during the week and on Thursdays Ana runs a bingo game for the local women. Bingo is very popular in Samoa.

Ana is one of the leaders of her village lending group in Saleapaga. Some of the other members also run beach hut businesses further down the road. Ana has been very instrumental in helping and supporting the women in her village and is a role model for them.

She is pictured wearing a pouletasi which is a traditional style of Samoan dress, usually hand sewn.

loans.use: Purchase building supplies

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
Messan A., born in Ahépé (Yoto prefecture) on October 17, is married and the father of two. He holds a high school diploma, but his parents had no money left to provide a university education for him. He found employment in a shop, earning a little money to help support his three brother and his retired parents. Household expenses continued to grow, so he used the little he had saved, plus a $350 loan, to open a hardware shop that he manages strictly and efficiently. The location of his shop brings him a good number of customers, and he often runs out of certain items for sale. He buys his merchandise locally, in Lomé, which does not leave him a profit margin in proportion to the size of his business. Finding that more and more of his customers are disappointed, he has decided to stock goods from Nigeria. Now, in order to do this, he needs more financial resources.

So, to expand his business and augment the income he needs for his family that depends on him alone, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $1,500 to enlarge his shop and to diversify the range of goods offered. His level of education and his experience are major assets for good management and a profitable business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Messan, né le 17 octobre à Ahépé (Préfectur de Yoto) est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après son baccalauréat, ses parents n’avaient plus de moyens pour l’inscrire à l’Université. Il s’est fait employé dans une boutique de la place où il gagnait un peu de revenus l’aidant à subvenir aux besoins des ses trois frères et ses parents devenus inactifs. Les charges devenant plus lourdes et avec ses petites économies et un crédit de $350, il ouvrit une boutique de quincaillerie qu’il gère avec rigueur et efficacité. L’emplacement géographique de sa boutique, lui amène assez de clients et il a souvent de rupture de stock de certains articles. Il achète ses marchandises sur place ici à Lomé, ce qui ne lui laisse pas une marge bénéficiaire à la taille de ses activités. S’apercevant que sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps, il décide de approvisionner à partir du Nigéria. Or, ces transactions demandent un fonds de commerce plus important qu’il ne dispose pas.

Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille qui ne compte que sur lui, Monsieur A. Messan sollicite un crédit de $1500 qui servira à agrandir sa boutique et à diversifier la gamme de ses articles. Le niveau d’études et l’expérience de Monsieur A. Messan constituent un atout majeur pour une bonne gestion et rentabilité de ses activités.

loans.use: To stock up and sell hardware and related goods.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.en:
Yolande A., who is also called Yoyo, was born on March 25, 1977, in Badou (Wawa prefecture). Coming from a family of seven children, she left school very early because her parents, short on funds, had preferred to send the boys to school to the detriment of the girls. So she turned towards an apprenticeship in dressmaking. Unfortunately, since completing her apprenticeship five years ago, she lacked the money to open up her own shop. She worked outdoors at home using sewing machines she rents from friends and acquaintances. But with the quality of her work, she received a lot of orders that are filled late just because of a lack of machines available. Her customer base continued to grow and grow, so using the little money she saved, she decided to lease a shop of her own called «Yoyo Couture». But she still runs up against the problem of finances. Her husband, a furniture maker without a steady income, finds himself unable to help her despite his willingness to do so. A very level-headed and energetic young woman, Yolande needs financial support to make things work.

Yolande is requesting a loan of $950 to renovate her shop and to buy two sewing machines. Financing her means helping her improve the living condition of the four people she under her care, plus her parents weary with age.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mme A. Yolande dite « Yoyo » est née le 25 mars 1977 à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa. Issue d’une famille de sept (07) enfants, elle abandonnant très tôt l’école car ses parents, ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens, avaient préféré scolariser les garçons au détriment des filles. Elle s’oriente alors vers l’apprentissage et s’est formée en couture. Malheureusement, depuis la fin de sa formation il y a cinq (05) ans, elle n’est pas arrivée à ouvrir son atelier par manque de moyens. Elle travaille à la maison en plein air avec les machines louées auprès de ses camarades ou connaissances. Mais avec la qualité de ses prestations, elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps justement par manque de machines. Sa clientèle devant de plus en plus importante, elle décide d’ouvrir un atelier mais se heurte toujours aux moyens financiers. Son mari, un menuisier sans emploi fixe, se trouve lui aussi dans l’incapacité de lui venir en aide malgré sa bonne volonté. Avec sa petite économie réalisée, elle est arrivée à louer un local qui nécessite des aménagements et des équipements. Jeune femme très calme et dynamique, Yolande a besoin d’un appui financier pour pouvoir s’en sortir.

Yolande sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 qui servira à aménager son atelier et à acheter deux machines à coudre. Financer Mme A. Yolande c’est contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie de quatre (04) personnes à sa charges et ses parents, aujourd’hui très fatigués par le poids de l’âge.

loans.use: To renovate her shop and buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en:
Nurida is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. Nurida is 45 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She lost her husband in Karabakh war and she is the only breadwinner of her family now. In the beginning of her business, she borrowed $500 from Normicro and rented a small tea-house. For the second time she borrowed $700 and bought chairs, tables and electric stove. Now she has rented a cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with her service.
She applies for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her cafe.

loans.use: To expand the area of hers cafe

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa A. was born in Niamey (Republic of Niger) on April 23, 1959. Coming from a family of nine children, she could not continue in school. So, at a very early age, she started learning how to make and sell corn mush. She was able to save a little money from this business and expanded into general grocery items sold from a display located in front of her house. Business is booming, allowing her to help with household expenses, since she is married and the mother of four. Today, Ms. A. would like to go professional by opening up a shop, but she lacks the funds to do so. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000 to open a shop, that she will call «Chez Yawano» and to widen the range of goods for sale. Her experience as a merchant to-date will guarantee the success of her plans.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yawa est née à Niamey (République du Niger) le 23 avril 1959. Fille d’une famille de neuf (09) enfants, elle n’a pu avancer dans les études et commença très tôt à préparer et à vendre de la bouillie à base du maïs. Elle réalisa un peu d’économie à partir de cette activité et entreprit la vente des produits d’alimentation générale sur une étagère devant sa maison. Ce commerce prend un essor rapide, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges de son ménage car elle mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Aujourd’hui, Mme A. veut rendre professionnelle son activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique mais elle n’a pas assez de moyens pour réaliser ce projet. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir la boutique et d’élargir la gamme des ses produits. L’expérience que Mme A. a acquise dans ce domaine est une garantie pour le succès de l’activité.

loans.use: To stock and sell general grocery items

loans.name: Samangul

texts.en:
Samangul is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Gubadli. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 48. She is a widow and has 5 children. Samangul has lost the husband in war. Despite all difficulties during 14 years this mother could grow up the children alone. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $700 and expanded a quality of the goods.
She applies for the loan $1000 to buy the textile goods and increase the goods assortments.

loans.use: To buy the textile goods and increase the good assortments

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine O. is a young lady who owns a beauty salon located in Dodowa, a community in the Dangme West district in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She has lots of customers but not enough equipment such as driers, rollers, hairpins etc. Her shop is also not big enough to accommodate all her customers, especially when they come in numbers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $875.00 from Kiva for expansion. She has had training on loan management and simple record keeping from KSF. She is very hardworking and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her beauty salon business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is a lady who cooks and sells a favourite dish of Ghanaian society.  This dish, kenkey (dokono), is not often prepared in homes. She is currently engaged in this on a very small scale but wishes to expand due to the high demand. She is therefore seeking a loan of $725.00 from Kiva to enable her do this. She is very hardworking and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her food sales

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Madam Mary L. buys fish in cartons from the harbour and fries and sells them. She does this on a retail basis but wishes to operate on a larger scale, that is distributing her fried fish in kilogram baskets to interested persons. She however lacks the capital to do so. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to make this a reality. She believes in hardwork and knows with this loan, business will indeed grow.

loans.use: working capital to expand her fish selling business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: “No food for the lazy man” seems to be the favorite saying of Auntie Maggie. Despite her age, she still loves to work to improve her standard of living. She sells items ranging from footwear to clothes. She wishes to sell more items than she is now. She is therefore seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva for business expansion. She is a very good and hardworking woman and can pay back the loan duly without default.

loans.use: working capital to expand her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Fine and beautiful African prints are what Madam Comfort sells. The demand for her fabrics is very high but she lacks capital to buy more in wholesale and in turn sell it retail to her customers. It is also her desire to own a shop whereby she can include other items such as footwear, ladies and gents underwear etc. She is in dire need of a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her make this productive idea into a reality. She will not disappoint Kiva in terms of repayment. She has had training on loan management and simple accounting from KSF.

loans.use: working capital to expand her fabric sales

loans.name: James

texts.en: Mr. James D. is a serious and business-minded young man seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to help him expand his operations. The demand for the goods he sells (soaps, biscuits, tins of milk, fish etc.) in his locality is very high and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity and make the most out of it. He is very hardworking and can pay back the loan. Thanks to KSF, he can now manage loans effectively and knows how to keep simple records.

loans.use: working capital to expand his sales

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madam Elizabeth is the owner of the God is Good enterprise. She has been in business for sometime now but lacks the needed capital to grow it. She needs a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to help her do this. She is hopeful that this amount, when given, will move her business to a higher level. She will work tirelessly and pay back earnestly.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christian Ventures is operated by Madam Christiana A.. She sells food items and has lots of customers but little capital to buy more items to sell. She is always at the mercy of the sun and working is also not conducive during the rainy season. She is therefore seeking a loan of $825.00 from Kiva to help her open a shop and sell more items.

loans.use: working capital to open a shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Madam Josephine’s kenkey has always been enjoyed by the people in her community. She prepares her kenkey under very good hygienic conditions and therefore it is very attractive for buyers. She however needs capital to produce more to meet the high demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. She can work very hard with this amoount and pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her kenkey selling business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Miss Monica N. sells jewelry. She does so by carrying her items on her head and moving from one place to the other. She is seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva to enable her to acquire a shop. She is a beneficiary of KSFs TEACH product and has knowledge about loan management and simple record keeping.

loans.use: to start a jewelry shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Miss Evelyn D. sells corn and cassava dough. This is used to prepare banku, a very tasty meal. She wishes to sell it in bags but lacks the capital to do so. There is also a high demand for her dough since it is always fresh. She needs a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to help her increase her supply. She is a very hardworking lady and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her food sales business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madam Elizabeth L. trades in kitchen supplies including pestles, woven baskets, charcoal etc. She however does not own a shop but is hopeful of acquiring one someday and expanding her business. She is therefore very happy with the assistance Kiva is offering and believes her dream will come true. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva in order to implement her desired goals.

loans.use: working capital to expand her kitchen supplies business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Honesty Mini-supermarket, owned by Madam Catherine O., is visited by quite a number of people in her vicinity. She needs capital to re-stock her shop to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to help her expand. Madam Catherine is very hardworking and honest and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: re-stocking capital for her mini-supermarket

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Madam Gifty L. is a pineapple farmer in the Dangme West district in Ghana. She is very hardworking and can produce more pineapples if given assistance. She is seeking a loan of $1050.00 from Kiva to help her produce more. She also has knowledge about loan management and simple accounting from KSF. She is very capable of paying back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to increase pineapple production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Madam Grace A. is a fishmonger. She has lots of customers. She sells her smoked fish in less than no time due to the high demand. She needs capital to produce more fish to sell. She is therefore seeking a loan of $725.00 from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: working capital to expand her fish business

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita V. has a grocery store with basic products that is one year old. The business has improved and she has plans for 2007 to increase her line of products and with that obtain more clients. To do this she is requesting a loan for $1,500.00 which she expects to pay on a term of 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita V. cuenta con 1 año en su negocio de abarrotes, productos básicos. El negocio a mejorado y tiene planes para este 2007 de incrementar la línea de productos y con ello obtener mas clientes por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $1500.00 dllrs ella contempla pagarlos en un plazo de 1 año

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a very entrepreneurial person, that is why she began her business a year and a half ago, a grocery store. She is very happy because she has met several people, her clients have increased as well as the sales, but her clients suggest her to sell different products and with this she could increase the number of clients and sales, that is why she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 which she expects to pay in a term of 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Irma es una persona muy emprendedora por lo cual inicio su negocio hace un año y medio, en el area D. abarrotes, esta muy contenta porque a conocido a mucha gente, sus clientes han incrementado y L. venta tambien pero sus clientes le sugieren que venda diferentes productos y con esto podria incrementar aun el numero D. clientes y con ello las ventas por lo que solicita un prestamo D. $1500.00 dllrs y pagarlo en un plazo D. 1 año.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Maria Castellón began her business a year ago; she has a Snack store in which she sells hamburgers, hot dogs, quesadillas, and sodas. She has great season which has allowed her to stay in the market and get more clients, that is why she has planed to buy more ingredients and equipment for her commercial space, so she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 that she expects to pay in 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Cstellón inicio su negocio hace un año, ella inicio su tienda de Snack en la cual vende Hamburguesas , Hotdogs, quesadillas, sodas, tiene un buen sazón lo cual a hecho que se mantenga en el mercado y sigan acudiendo clientes, por lo cual ella tiene planeado comprar mas ingredientes y equipo para su local comercial, por lo que solicita un prestamo de $ 15000.00dllrs y pagarlos en un lapso de un año.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is a good working woman, that is why she has already 5 years with her very successful grocery store. She would like to extend her space and buy equipment for it, which is why she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 and expects to pay back in 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del pilar es una mujer de trabajo, por lo que lleva ya 5 años con su negocio de abarrotes y como el negocio a marchado bien a ella le gustaría ampliar y equipar su local por lo que solicita un préstamo de $1500.00 dllrs y pretende pagarlos en el plazo de un año.

loans.use: Buy equipment and extend commercial location

loans.name: Akouété

texts.en:
Akouété A. was born in Ahépé in Yoto prefecture on December 11, 1972. Married and the father of five, he also looks after five other people in his family. He left middle school because his parents, as farmers, no longer had the means to support him. He entered an apprenticeship and specialized in automobile air conditioning. An energetic and very talented man, he has complete mastery of his specialization and provides quality service to his customers. He has become very famous, and his shop is quick to take care of its numerous customers, who value his work highly. He currently has seven apprentices. Because of business needs and persistent customer demand, he has decided to sell refrigeration accessories essential to his work, rather than buying them elsewhere in Ghana. But his new plan requires more funding than he has. His keen sense of management and his discipline will allow him to realize his plan successfully. The $1,200 loan that he is requesting will go towards a machine and towards refrigeration accessories to sell in his shop. His plan will bring in additional revenue and allow Mr. A. to provide for his family in a dignified manner.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Akouété est né le 11 décembre 1972 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il a à sa charge cinq autres personnes de sa famille. M. A. a arrêté ses études au cours secondaire car ses parents cultivateurs n’avaient plus les moyens de le soutenir. Il entra en apprentissage et se spécialisa en climatisation automobile. Dynamique et très doué, il a une maîtrise parfaite de son métier et offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle. Il est devenu très célèbre et son atelier accueille sans répit de nombreux clients qui apprécient ses services. Il a actuellement sept (07) apprentis. Pour les besoins de ses activités et à la demande persistante de ses clients, il décida de vendre dans son atelier des accessoires frigorifiques indispensables à son travail plutôt que d’en acheter ailleurs au Ghana. Mais cette nouvelle activité demande plus de moyens financiers qu’il ne dispose pas. Son sens aigu de gestion et sa rigueur lui permettront de mener à bien cette activité. Le crédit de $1200 qu’il sollicite va servir à l acquisition d une machine et à l’achat et à la revente dans son atelier des accessoires frigorifiques. Ce nouveau projet apportera un revenu supplémentaire et permettra à M. A. de subvenir dignement aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: Acquire a machine and buy refrigerator accessories.

payments.comment:
Akouété thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to his project funding which allows him today to increase his activities and automatically his incomes to his proper living conditions improvement and those of his family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!

The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.en:
